loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is a member of the Arco Iris (“Rainbow”) Village Bank.  She is 36 years old and is married with two children. Emerita has a store in her home in the Cuchipampa neighborhood where she sells dry goods, vegetables and fruits. Her daughters run the store in the mornings while Emerita sells fruit from a mobile cart in the Nery Garcia Market, and Emerita runs the store in the afternoons. Emerita and her husband also grow potatoes on a plot of land they rent.  Emerita needs a loan of $650 to invest in potatoes for planting.  Emerita dreams of improving and expanding her business, and that her children may graduate with professional degrees and grow up to have better lives than she and her husband.  

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow.

loans.use: To buy potatoes for planting

loans.name: Las Solidarias Group

texts.en:
Elida L. is only 23 years old, but is living without a job and in extreme poverty. She has no children and is unmarried, which, where she lives, is very rare for a woman of her age. Unlike many of her peers, she decided at a young age that she wants something more with her life and wants to be able to provide for her children someday. 

She is a highly motivated young woman and wants to start a small clothing business. This will be her first loan and she plans on traveling to another city, where she can buy used clothing at a good price, and then sell them in her area. She dreams of having a big clothing store with all the top designers. She also wants to go back to school and get a college degree. 

She realizes she has a lot of work ahead of her, but knows what she wants and is ready to go get it. She did say she is nervous about starting her own business because she has never had anything of her own, and wants to be successful in this. 

Elida also knows that this is her one chance and she is going to do everything she can possibly do to make her dreams come true!

loans.use: Used to purchase clothing for her business

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria G. Najarrois a member of the Azucenas (“White Lilies”) Village Bank.  Gregoria is 37 years old and separated with two children. She has two stands in the April 12th Market where she sells prepared meals with the help of two other people. When there is a lot of demand, she hires more people to help her. She also makes traditional breads some days; she cooks the bread in her grandparents’ oven and her mother sells it in the market.  Gregoria needs a loan of $525 to buy sacks of rice and sugar.  Gregoria’s dreams are to own a restaurant in the center of Ayacucho, for her children to graduate from college with professional degrees, and to improve her home. 
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow.

loans.use: Buy sacks of rice and sugar

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan I. owns a video rental shop. She sells and rent video CDs. She is 39 years old and married with two children. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more video CDs for sale. She says thank you to all who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more Video CDs to sell

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
This is Vicky Ruhambika, a married woman with three children. She is 32 years old and her children are between one and 10 years of age. She is running a grocery business. Her business is doing well and it helps her to get money that she uses to take care of her family. Her husband helps her to run this business,. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a deep freezer for her business. In future she plans to expand her business.

She thanks you for your support.

---
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer for her business.

loans.name: Anie

texts.es: Anie tiene 37 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Tiene un local de recreo turístico, donde brinda  platos típicos y vende bebidas a las personas que vienen a pasar un momento grato por la zona, esta actividad la viene realizando por más de 5 años, y le va muy bien. Dentro de su actividad, le agrada atender a las personas de la mejor manera posible, siendo muy amable, lo cual no es difícil para una persona tan sencilla y acogedora como Anie. La venta de  bebidas y platos típicos es rentable, ya que los precios son elevados, pero de mayor consumo, por el lugar turístico donde está situada. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Anie  tiene pensado invertir en la compra de vitrinas para exhibir los deliciosos  platos y bebidas que ofrece.
texts.en:
Anie is a 37-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 3 children. She has a small restaurant in which she sells traditional food and drinks to tourists who come to spend a pleasant time in the area. She has been in business for over 5 years, and has prospered. In her business, it pleases her to serve her patrons in the best possible way, being very pleasant, which is not difficult for such an unassuming and welcoming person like Anie. Her beverage and food business is very lucrative because prices are high due to the tourist area in which the business is located. This is her first loan with MFP. Anie plans on investing the loan in purchasing a food display case for the delicious meals and drinks that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food display case

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 33 años, es casada, vive con  su esposo y su hijo. Se dedica íntegramente a la venta en la tienda que logró abrir hace un  par de años, negocio en el cual le va muy bien, gracias a la acogida que tiene  entre las  personas, a ella le agrada satisfacer las necesidades de los pobladores que ya necesitaban una tienda cercana dentro de su  zona. Para Beatriz su negocio es  rentable, debido a la necesitada de consumo de sus vecinos, todos acuden desde muy temprano a su  tienda a poder realizar sus compras del día, sobre todo las  amas de casa. Lo difícil es adquirir mayor cantidad de productos, porque son muy costosos y requieren de mayor capital. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Beatriz invertirá 1000 soles en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 33 years old and lives with her husband and son. She works full-time in the grocery store she opened a few years ago. The store is doing well, having been well received by the community. She's happy to fulfill the needs of the neighborhood since there was a need for a nearby store in their zone. Beatriz's business is profitable due to the neighbors' consumer needs: they arrive very early to do their daily shopping, especially the housewives. The challenge is to keep a sufficient stock of products in supply, because it is expensive and requires major capital. This is her first loan with MFP. Beatriz will invest 1000 soles to buy a large stock of products to supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock of products for the store

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike A. sells rechargeable phones and phone accessories. He purchases his goods from Lagos (Nigeria's largest city) to sell in Benin City. He started this business in 2006. 

He is 38 years old and married with four children. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phones and phone accessories to sell. He hopes to expand his business. 

He says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phones and phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
Apolinar se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive en la comunidad Akjerana, sector Achacachi  de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a tres horas y media  de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa, quien se encarga y cuidado del ganado; Apolinar trabaja también como profesor en un colegio del área rural. 

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera y así mejorar su producción de leche y  por lo tanto sus ingresos. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro., la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Apolinar raises cattle, and sells the milk he produces to the PIL Andina (the Andean "Planta Industrailizadora de Leche"). He lives in the Akjerana community, Achacachi sector, in the Omasuyos Province of the La Paz Region, located three and a half hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife who takes care of the cattle. Apolinar also works as a teacher at a rural school. This loan is targeted for buying a dairy cow in order to improve milk production and thereby improve their income. This is his second loan with Impro, having undergone an evaluation which qualified him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica O. is 56 years old and married with eight children. She sells provisions like tomato paste, detergent, milk and soft drinks. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. 

She is indeed grateful to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 34 años, es casada y vive con su esposo. Desde que era joven le gustó la cocina y cuando se casó inicio su negocio de venta de comida, en la cual viene trabajando hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha de preparar sus platillos, los cuales son riquísimos y tienen gran demanda, el local donde tiene su restaurante es alquilado, pero sus ventas son buenas. La venta de comida es rentable, ya que no solo le genera ganancias, sino que también puede ahorrar, debido a que puede disminuir los gastos de alimentación, sin embargo lo complicado es atender cuando hay gran cantidad de clientes, para lo cual tiene que  ser muy rápida. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Carmen empezará a vender bebidas que complementen el consumo de sus platillos para lo cual invertirá 700 soles, y con el resto podrá ampliar y mejorar su local.
texts.en:
Carmen is 34 years old and lives with her husband. She has enjoyed cooking since she was young, and after she got married she began her business selling food, which she has done for four years now. She is very content preparing her dishes, which are delicious and in high demand. Her restaurant is housed in a rented space but her sales are good. Food sales are profitable, providing profits enough for savings, since she can reduce her food expenses. However it is difficult to fulfill orders when there are lots of clients, which is why she has to work quickly. This is her first loan with MFP. Carmen will begin selling beverages to complement her dishes for which she will invest 700 soles and, with the remainder, expand and improve her locale.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages to sell in the restaurant

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis vive en la zona Viviendas de Rio Seco ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto
 
Ella vive junto a sus hijos, su esposo actualmente trabaja en el interior de departamento.

Se dedica a la venta de golosinas, como ser dulces, chocolates, galletas y también vende comida  para escolares consistentes en un plato de fideo a precios muy económicos, en el patio de una escuela.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de mercadería (dulces, chocolates, galletas y fideo y papa y otros condimentos para cocinar aji de fideo) para sus ventas diarias. 
 
Es el segundo   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Gladis lives in the Rio Seco development in the city of El Alto. She lives with her children. Her husband is currently away working in the interior region of their state.

Gladis sells sweets like candy, chocolate, and cookies. She also sells plates of noodles to children in the schoolyard. She will use this loan to purchase merchandise to sell (including candy, chocolate, and cookies, as well as noodles, potatoes, and other ingredients to make “ají de fideo” [a spicy pasta dish]).

This is her second loan with IMPRO. The positive evaluation she received after her first loan makes her eligible to receive another.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sweets and ingredients for pasta

loans.name: Becky

texts.en: Becky O. sells drinks and provisions. Her husband is an automobile mechanic. Becky is 48 years old and married with nine children. She is a Lapo client. She needs the loan amount of 70,000 NGN ($600 US) to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She says "thank you" to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres en Desarrollo" is a large group of 17 people who are hoping to receive their sixth loan. Each member has started to experience success and started to improve her situation. Each member is from a very poor area in the Dominican Republic. They all have businesses ranging from food stores (called colmado) to beauty salons and clothing stores. This has been a very successful group, and a group that has been very faithful in all its repayments!

Magalis A. is the group representative and a great group leader. She is the mother to three children and works as hard as anyone. She was having a hard time before she received her first loan because she and her husband could barely afford to feed their children. Magalis did not have steady work and was barely getting by each day. One day she heard about Esperanza International, which gives out small loans to help start businesses, and she knew that is what she wanted to do. She took out her first loan and started a small stand selling all types of small items such as candy, bread, and rice. She worked hard and kept increasing her business with each loan, and now she has her own colmado! She rents out the store building, and hopes to own the store herself someday. She also is dreaming with her husband about owning their own house someday. She is getting closer and closer to reaching those dreams and is excited about the future. She is ready for this next loan and feels like is only going to continue to increase in size!

loans.use: To purchase products for her store.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience O. is 30 years old and married with three children. Her husband is an automobile mechanic. She sells foodstuffs like yams, melon seed, pepper, etc. With the festive period fast approaching, she hopes to stock her shop to meet the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 63 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Se dedica a la crianza de cuyes desde hace 6 años, y gracias a que sus animalitos aumentan rápidamente puede venderlos en los mercados o atiende solo pedidos en su domicilio. Delia  disfruta de criar estos animalitos y ver como aumentan día a día  la motiva a seguir cuidándolos y alimentándolas de la mejor manera, así incrementan su valor por peso, y se logra obtener buenas ganancias. Sin embargo,  es muy delicada la alimentación de estos cuyes, si no se tienes en debido cuidado  en darles los pastos adecuados, tienden a morir rápidamente. Este es quinto préstamo con MFP, y hasta la fecha no tuvo problemas de pago. Con el dinero solicitado comprará cuyes de raza para mejorar la calidad de sus animales y darles un valor agregado.
texts.en:
Delia is 63 years old and lives with her husband and son. For six years she has raised guinea pigs [a Peruvian delicacy]. Because the animals reproduce and grow so rapidly, she can sell them at markets and also from her home. Delia enjoys raising these animals and watching them grow. She takes good care of them and feeds them well so that she can increase their value per pound and thereby increase her earnings. Feeding the guinea pigs is a very delicate matter, as if one does not take care to provide adequate feed they tend to die rapidly.

This is Delia's fifth loan with Kiva's partner MFP and she has not had problems with repayment. With this loan she will buy pure-bred guinea pigs to improve the quality of her animals and raise their value.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pure-bred guinea pigs

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday O. sells shoes at Uselu market in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. The demands for his shoes are high. He is 39 years old and single. He needs the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more shoes to sell. He says "thank you" to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Josefa Nuvia

texts.es: La Sr. Josefa tiene 33 años de edad, habita en un barrio llamado héroes y mártires en la capital de Managua, Casada, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada, con dos  hijos de 11 y 16 años de edad ambos están estudiando. Sus planes en el ámbito familiar es darles un porvenir y mejora a sus hijos .Doña Josefa vende cosméticos: ropa, zapatos, joyas de plata y otros. Desde hace diez años,  ella inicio su pequeño negocio con fondo propio. Con esta solicitud de préstamo espera  mejorar su economía con la compra de nuevos productos y así aumentar sus ingresos mejorando su nivel de vida y dándole a su familia un mejor futuro. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr realizar sus objetivos de adquirir mayor clientela y vender más productos variados
texts.en:
Josefa is 33 years old and lives in the Heroes and Martyrs neighborhood of Managua. She is married and her husband works for a private company. She has two school-age children, ages 11 and 16. Her plan is to provide a better life for her children.

Josefa sells cosmetics, clothes, shoes, silver jewelry, etc. She began her business ten years ago with her own money. With this loan she hopes to buy new products and thereby increase her monthly earnings. This increase will improve her standard of living and provide her family with a better future. Thanks to loans from Kiva's partner AFODENIC she will meet her goal of acquiring more customers and selling a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for children and adults as well as cosmetics

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 40 años, es divorciada y vive sola. Tiene una pequeña tienda, la cual abrió hace 4 años, y donde ahora presta servicios de telefonía, ya que instaló unas cabinas para locutorio, lo cual viene  funcionando  hace un año. Esta actividad logra que doña Elsa no se sienta sola, sino por el contrario, tenga la compañía de todos los clientes que vienen a su negocio, siendo justamente la atención al cliente lo que más le agrada. Su pequeña tienda es muy concurrida, debido a la amable atención que brinda, esto le permite obtener buenos ingresos económicos, sobre todo del locutorio, que es un útil servicio para las personas. Lo complicado es surtir su negocio con diversos productos que le solicitan, pero que son costosos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Elsa tiene el anhelo de incrementar sus productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, para ello invertirá 1000 soles.
texts.en:
Elsa is 40 years old, divorced and lives alone. She opened a small store four years ago where she now provides phone services--she installed several phone booths, which have been operating for the past year. The highlight of this job is that Elsa doesn't feel lonely--quite to the contrary, she's in the company of all the customers that come to her business, and it is this interaction with her customers that she likes most. Her little store is very crowded, thanks to her attentiveness, and this brings her a good income--above all, from the phone service, which is useful to everyone. The difficult part is stocking her store with the diverse products that people ask for, which are expensive. This is her first loan from MFP. Elsa wishes to increase her product stock to satisfy her customers' needs, for which she will invest 1000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise for sale

loans.name: Evilia

texts.es: Evilia tiene 56 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella es administradora, desde muy joven trabajó en diversas instituciones  educativas, ahora está a puertas de iniciar el funcionamiento de su propio colegio, en el cual también brinda servicio de Internet a los jóvenes de su zona, servicio que lleva más de 4 años. Evilia está muy contenta porque siempre le gustó la idea de formar  su propio colegio  y administrarlo, lo cual la llena de entusiasmo, además de tener el apoyo económico de su servicio de Internet, el cual es muy concurrido por los escolares, aunque los problemas empiezan a surgir cuando las máquinas no  tiene un constante mantenimiento y perjudican los ingresos diarios. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Evilia invertirá el dinero que solicita y aparte otros 300 soles de sus ahorros, en la reparación de sus computadoras y renovación de módulos para las cabinas.
texts.en:
Evilia, 56, is married and living with her husband and two children. She is an administrator. She has worked in various educational institutions since she was very young, and now she is on the threshold of starting the operation of her own school, in which she will also provide Internet service to the young people in her area, a service she has provided for more than 4 years. Evilia is very happy and pleased with the idea of forming her own school and administrating it. She is filled with enthusiasm. She also has the economic support of her Internet service, which is very popular with the students, although problems are starting to show up if the machines are not constantly maintained, affecting the daily income. This is her first loan with MFP. Evilia will invest the money she has requested, as well as 300 soles from her savings, in the repair of her computers and renovation of the cubicles in the booths.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of her computers

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith A. is 30 years old and married with four children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She travels to Warri, Delta State to purchase foodstuffs and provisions to sell in Benin City. She needs the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says, "thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.en: Yovany E. is the representative of the group "Mujeres Trabajadoras 1". This group is receiving its second loan cycle, and hoping to increase the business they started with its first loan. Yovany took her first loan and started a small business selling used clothing in her area. She experienced some success and was able to make all her loan payments while also saving some. She said she was very excited and happy about running her own business. It is the first time in her life that she has something of her own and something that wakes her up in the morning. She is the mother of three children and finally feels like she can provide for them. After the success of her first loan she is already dreaming of owning her own clothing boutique and earning plenty of money to send her children to college and provide them a good lives. She also wants to have her own house someday! She feels like she can do this and thinks this next loan will help her increase in size. She is very grateful for the opportunity and ready for the next step!

loans.use: To purchase clothing for business.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y su hija D. 9 años. DesD. hace 30 años se dedica a la venta D. diversos productos, como útiles escolares, ahora por campaña naviD.ña se dedica a la venta D. juguetes en la pequeña tienda que instaló en su domicilio.  A Gladis siempre le gustó la idea D. tener un negocio propio, D. administrar su dinero y vender gran cantidad D. productos, ya que el trato con las personas es lo que le agrada, aunque lo difícil es poder vender en tiempos D. crisis, cuando no hay campañas, ni ferias, es por eso que aprovecha los días festivos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y hasta la fecha no tiene problemas D. pago, gracias a que su negocio va muy bien. Desea invertir la cantidad solicitada en la compra D. juguetes y panteones para venderlos en esta navidad.
texts.en:
Gladis, 47, lives with her husband and her 9-year-old daughter. She has sold various products, such as school supplies, for more than 30 years. Now, for the Christmas season, she will sell toys in the little shop that she put into her home. Gladis has always liked the idea of having her own business, handling her own money, and selling lots of products, but it is dealing with people that really appeals to her. The hard part is getting sales in crisis times, when there is no celebration or fair, which is why she makes the most of festival days. This is her third loan with MFP, and up to now she has not had a problem repaying, thanks to the fact that her business is going very well. She wants to invest the requested funds to buy toys and nativity scenes to sell this Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Aida Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Aida es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Siglo XXI” del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Tiene 35 años de edad, vive en el Jr. Santa Cruz Nº 210 y es madre soltera de 3 hijos. 

Con el primer préstamo de S/.300 compró un andamio para su tienda. Trabaja duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Su esposo la abandonó y la dejó a cargo de todo. Con el fin de poder pagar su cuota mensual, vende gelatina en el mercado de Juli los días miércoles, al mismo tiempo tiene una pequeña tienda de Abarrotes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas, etc.

Su mayor deseo es tener un Restaurante para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aida is a member of the Women of the 21st Century Community Bank in the village of Juli in the Puno region of Peru. She is 35 years old and lives at 210 N. Santa Cruz as a single mother of three children. With her first loan of approximately $100, she purchased scaffolding for her store. She works hard to make headway for her children. Her husband abandoned her and left her to fend for everything. With the goal of being able to make ends meet, she sells jell-o at the local market on Wednesdays and she also has a small convenience store. With the loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within four months, she will purchase rice, sugar, oil, soft drinks, etc. Her biggest dream is to have a restaurant so she can be able to make headway for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys I. owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods, drinks and pure water. Her husband is a fuel attendant. Gladys is 37 years old and married with seven children. Her husband works in a gas station. She needs the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks, pure water, and foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says, "thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs, drinks and pure water.

loans.name: Hans

texts.es: Hans tiene 33 años, es soltero, pero tiene una hija y vive con  sus padres.El está dedicado a la venta de fertilizantes, negocio compartido con otras personas con quienes se asoció hace 3 años, dentro del negocio lo más resaltante es que estos fertilizantes son muy demandados por los agricultores y Hans atiende a estos clientes con mucho respeto, ya que son compradores claves y permanentes, lo que hace rentable su negocio. Sin embargo, a pesar del desagradable olor de los fertilizantes, lo importante es que Hans disfruta de su trabajo junto a sus compañeros. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y hasta la fecha ha sido muy cumplido en sus pagos. Con la cantidad solicitada desea independizarse y abrir su propia tienda de fertilizantes, para ellos requiere de 2000 soles.
texts.en:
Hans is 33 years old and single, but he has a daughter and lives with his parents. He makes a living selling fertilizers, a business he shares with other people and have been working together for three years. The most outstanding thing is that these fertilizers are in high demand by farmers, and Hans tends to the clients very respectfully, since they are permanent and key components to the business and make it profitable. Of course, aside from the unpleasant odor of the fertilizers, the important thing is that Hans enjoys working with his associates. This is his fifth loan, and he has always been very punctual with his payments. With the loan he is requesting, he plans to become independent and open his own fertilizer store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open his own fertilizer store

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: Née vers 1968 à  HETIN DOGODO  dans la commune de DANGBO, dame  G. Colette est mariée et mère de 6enfants. Elle cultive dans le village de  HÊTIN SOTA  de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement    GF WANGNIME  DE HÊTIN SOTA  situé à proximité de la source thermale de dangbo ; elle vend aussi de la farine et du poisson. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt de 110 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1968 in Hetin Dogodo in the township of Dangbo, Mrs. Colette G. is married and the mother of 6 children. She is a farmer in the village of Hetin Sota in the valley of the Ouémé River and is a member of the group GF Wangnime of Hetin Sota, situated near the hot springs of Dangbo. She also sells flour and fish.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the river level is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc which are staple foods in Benin. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay for laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing their land.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Colette G. has requested a loan of 110,000 F CFA which will allow her to farm about 1.5 hectares, growing some of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1.5 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena I. sells fufu. Fufu is a local food in Nigeria that is gotten from fermented cassava. She needs the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more cassava to process into fufu. She is 46 years old and married with four children. She is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to process into fufu.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace E. owns a restaurant in Uselu Market Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells cooked foods like rice and beans. She has lots of customers patronizing her. She needs the loan amount of 30,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She is 42 years old and married with two children. She is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Amelia Ermelinda

texts.es:
Amelia tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos, también es Profesora de Educación Inicial y vive en el Jr. Puno Nº 221, distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es socia por casi 4 años del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Siglo XXI”. Con el primer préstamo de S/.300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos compró lana y bayeta para bordados. Desde los 20 años  de edad empezó con este negocio, aprendió a hacer bordados para vender en Puno. Actualmente compra bordados de todo tipo y vende sus productos en el Cusco.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más bordados en bayeta.

Su mayor aspiración es tener una microempresa para exportar su Artesanía al extranjero.
texts.en:
Amelia is 40 years old and married with two children. She is an early education teacher and lives at 221 N. Puno in the village of Juli in the Puno region of Peru. She has been a member of the Women of the 21st Century Community Bank for nearly four years. With her first loan of approximately $100 that she received from Kiva partner Manuela Ramos, she purchase wool and cloth for embroidery. Since she was 20 years old she has been in this business, and she learned to make embroideries to sell in Puno. Currently she purchase embroideries of all kinds and sells her products in Cusco. With this current loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within four months, she will purchase more baize embroideries. Her main goal is to have a small business exporting her craftwork to foreign countries.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase embroideries

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Née vers 1983 à   HETIN DOGODO dans la commune de DANGBO, dame  B. Madeleine est mariée et mère de 3enfants et 2 allant à l’école. Elle cultive dans le village de  HÊTIN SOTA  de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement    GF WANGNIME  DE HÊTIN SOTA  situé à proximité de la source thermale de dangbo ; elle vend aussi du poisson. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt de 110 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1983 in Hetin Dogodo in the township of Dangbo, Mrs. Madeleine B. is married and the mother of 3 children, of whom two are enrolled in school. She is a farmer in the village of Hetin Sota in the valley of the Ouémé River and is a member of the group GF Wangnime of Hetin Sota, located near the hot springs of Dangbo. She also sells fish.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the river level is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc which are staple foods in Benin. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay for laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing their land.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Madeleine B. has requested a loan of 110,000 F CFA which will allow her to farm about 1.5 hectares, growing some of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1.5 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Donald Cristian

texts.es:
El Sr. Donald tiene 52 años de edad, habitante del barrio  Riguero, casado su esposa es comerciante con dos hijos de 11 años de edad,  son gemelos y los tiene estudiando. Trabaja como conductor desde hace nueve años y vende productos de frutas. Sus planes familiares son apoyar a su esposa siempre para que sus hijos tengan lo necesario para ser unos profesionales .Inicio su negocio con  ventas de frutas,  con dinero propio para ayudar un poco más en los gastos de la casa.
En lo  económico son aumentar la venta de sus producto con la compra de frutas como: manzana, uva, fresa y productos de bebidas como: gaseosas, jugos, etc.  Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra el aumento de inventario y una mayor utilidad que beneficiará a su familia.
texts.en:
Donald is 52 years old and lives in the Riguero neighborhood. He is married and his wife is a merchant with two children that are 11 years old. They are twins and he has them both studying. He has worked as a driver for the last nine years and also sells fruit. His plans for his family are to always support his wife so that his children have what they need to become professionals. He started his business selling fruit with his own money to help a little with household expenses. Financially, his plans are to increase the sales of his products with the purchase of fruits such as: apples, grapes, strawberries and beverages such as: sodas, juices, etc. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic (a Kiva field partner), he will be able to increase his inventory and increase the usefullness that will benefit his family.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grapes, apples, and products such as juices and sodas

loans.name: Austin

texts.en: Austin I. owns a poultry farm where he rears poultry birds like chicken and turkey. His poultry farm can accommodate 400 birds.  He needs the loan amount of 120,000 NGN to purchase more poultry birds to sell. He is 40 years old and married with four children. He says, "thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds to sell

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime tiene 30 años, es soltero  y vive solo. Se dedica a la venta de repuestos de carros y de diversas maquinarias para las empresas mineras, lo cual viene realizando desde hace 10 años y le va muy bien. Jaime tiene habilidad para los negocios y gracias a su carisma para ofrecer sus repuestos, hace de esta actividad, no un trabajo, sino un medio divertido y agradable de generarse ingresos económicos. Además él vende a precios módicos, por ello  los  mecánicos le comprar constantemente, lo más difícil es que cuando viaja a la ciudad de Lima, tiene encontrar los diversos repuestos, y le toma varios días de búsqueda, esfuerzo y e inversión. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Jaime tiene invertirá la cantidad solicitada en la adquisición de mayor cantidad de  repuestos y maquinarias para luego venderlos en su localidad.
texts.en:
Jaime is 30 years old, single and lives alone. He has sold car parts and various machines for mining companies over the last 10 years, and it has been going well. Jaime has a natural business ability, and thanks to his charisma, selling parts is not so much a job as it is a fun way to generate an income. Furthermore, he sells at low prices, so mechanics buy from him constantly. The most difficult part is when he has to travel to Lima to find various parts; it takes him days of searching, effort and investment. This is his first loan from MFP. Jaime will invest it in the acquisition of a greater quantity of parts and machinery to sell locally.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of parts for sale

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget O. is 45 years old and married with five children. She makes a living selling drinks to both wholesale and retail customers. She buys the drinks from distributor, and has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell. She says thank you to everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: San Juan Evangelista Group

texts.en:
The St. John the Evangelist Village Bank is located in the Asención community of the Yauli District, Huancavelica Department. This beautiful area has many llamas, since it is surrounded by beautiful grazing spots and nearby ranches. The women in this group have few resources and work primarily in agriculture, while some sell vegetables, fruits and sweets in the city of Huancavelica. A few work as artisans. 

Valentina R. D. T. is married and has five children. She has a store which she has been stocking with a wider variety of merchandise since she began taking out loans. She now also sells canisters of gas (for cooking). Her village bank has always been very supportive of her, since it taught her how to save and her savings have helped her through tough times. Thanks to the group training sessions given by her group’s loan officer, Valentina has improved her business. With this loan, Valentina plans to buy more gas canisters for her business. Her dream is to open a large store and for her children to graduate with professional degrees. She plans to use her savings to help two of her children get their degrees. 

Vicenta C. is married and has six children. She sells firewood and dry goods from a tent, since her house is still under construction. Vicenta suffered through the death of her 18-year old daughter which left her depressed. She plans to use her loan to buy firewood for her business. Her dream is for her children to grow up to have better lives than she is. 

Sabina P. is separated and has three children. She buys and sells mutton, pigs, hens and guinea pigs. Sabina has learned how to command respect and value herself, which led her to separate from her first husband. Her children were being psychologically abused, and her husband fractured her arm and injured her spine. She is now rehabilitated, however, and is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise to stock her kiosk. Her dream is to be a businesswoman and run a transport business. She met her current partner at a village bank meeting.

loans.use: The St. John the Evangelist Village Bank needs a loan of $4550 for various businesses. Valentina plans to buy more gas canisters for her business.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: Janeth tiene 21 años, está conviviendo con su pareja y tiene un hijo. Siempre a sido muy optimista y esforzada en su trabajo, gracias a ello pudo abrir  una pequeña bodega desde hace 2 años, pero el local es alquilado y ella ansía llegar a tener un local propio, pero sabe que trabajando arduamente, como hasta hoy y disfrutando de vender sus productos, conseguirá crecer, la ventaja es que tiene clientes muy fieles que visitan diariamente su bodega. Pero a veces no se da abasto para atender a todos, por ello tiene que ser muy rápida y amable para no perder clientes, siendo estresante algunas horas del día. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos para su bodega, sobre todo en aumentar la venta de bebidas.
texts.en:
Janeth is 21 years old and lives with her husband and child. She has always been optimistic and hardworking, which allowed her to open a small grocery store two years ago. Her current space is rented, but she hopes to own one eventually. She knows that working hard and enjoying each day selling her products as she has until now, her business will continue to grow--her advantage is having very loyal customers who visit her shop every day. But sometimes assisting everyone is not enough--she has to be quick and friendly in order to not lose customers, which makes for some stressful times throughout the day. This is her first loan from MFP. With this money she will buy a greater quantity of products for her store, increasing beverage sales above all.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of products for sale

loans.name: Jhonathan

texts.es: Jhonathan es soltero y vive con sus  padres. Es chofer, realiza transporte de pasajeros, actividad que desarrolla hace 2 años, gracias a que pudo adquirir  un automóvil, con el cual trabaja todos los días, Sale todas las mañanas con mucho ánimo y ganas de trasladar a las personas a sus destinos, ese es su fin y propósito, nos comenta. Los ingresos que tiene son muy buenos, por la cantidad de gente que hay en la ciudad que constantemente  requieren de movilidad. Lo difícil es mantener su automóvil, para que esté en un estado adecuado se le debe hacer mantenimientos cada mes. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Jhonathan invertirá la cantidad solicitada en la compra de repuestos para su carro, además, una parte tendrá como reserva para algún gasto, ya que mientras se repara su auto no tendrá ingresos.
texts.en:
Jhonathan is unmarried and lives with his parents. He is a driver and transports passengers, an activity that developed two years ago because he was able to buy a car which he uses for work every day. He leaves every morning with great spirit and desire to transport people to their destinations; this is his purpose, he says. The income has been good because of the quantity of people there are in the city that constantly require transportation. The challenge is ensuring that his car is properly maintained each month. This is his first loan with MFP. Jhonathan will invest the amount requested in the purchase of spare parts for his car. He will also take part as a reserve for any costs, because while his car is repaired, he will not have income.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for his car

loans.name: Bertha Lidia

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 2 niños, es estudiante de la Carrera Profesional de Derecho y vive en el Jr. Ilave  s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Desde el año pasado es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Siglo XXI”. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró materiales para confeccionar ternos. Su esposo, junto con ella, también se dedica a confeccionar ternos para damas, caballeros y niños. 

Actualmente cuenta con un puesto de trabajo en el Mercado de Abastos de Juli, lugar donde confecciona las prendas anteriormente mencionadas (ternos) y donde acuden todos sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará telas de diversa calidad  para la confección de ternos.

Su mayor sueño es concluir su carrera y trabajar para mejorar su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Bertha is a 31-year-old woman with a husband and 2 children. She is studying law and lives on Jr. Ilave s/n, in the Juli district of the Chuchito province, department of Puno.

Since last year, she has been a member of the “Mujeres al Siglo XXI” (21st Century Women) microfinance institute. With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased materials to make suits. Her husband, who helps her, also makes suits for men, women and children.

She currently has a stand in the Wholesale Market of Juli, where she makes the garments and where her customers buy her merchandise.

With this 500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase different quality fabric for making suits.

Her biggest dream is to finish her studies and work so that she can improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric to make suits

loans.name: Tania Lissette

texts.es: La Sra. Tania tiene 43 años de edad, habitante del barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, casada, tiene dos preciosos hijos el varón de de 11 años de edad y la joven de 15 años de edad. Su trabajo en la actualidad es su pequeño negocio de lácteos, venta de fritos, chicharrón y cosméticos lo posee desde hace doce años, Sus planes es terminar la construcción de su casa para ofrecerle seguridad y protección a su familia. En el ámbito económico captar nuevos clientes y comercializar nuevos productos. Agracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr comprar materiales de construcción como: cementos, hierro y madera para terminar de hacer su casa
texts.en:
Ms. Tania R. is a married, 43-year-old woman who lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. She has two precious children: an eleven-year-old son and a 15 year-old daughter. She has a small business, which she has been running for two years, in which she sells dairy products, fried snacks, pork rinds and cosmetics. She plans to finish building her house so that she can offer her family more safety. In the financial sphere, she would like to gain new customers and offer new products. With the loans from Afodenic, she would like to buy construction supplies such as cement, iron and lumber in order to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction supplies to finish building her house

loans.name: Carmin Yesica

texts.es:
Carmín es una nueva socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al siglo XXI” en Juli, tiene 23 años de edad, es casada, madre de un hijo de un año de edad, su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de motocicletas y vive en el Jr. Puno Nº 221, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.


Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará bordados en bayeta para vender en Cusco. 

Tiene planeado abrir un Locutorio en Juli, para lo cual seguirá trabajando con su negocio de Artesanía.

Su mayor deseo es empezar su negocio de llamadas telefónicas y tener muchos locales.
texts.en:
Carmín is a new member of the “Mujeres al siglo XXI” (21st Century Women) microfinance institute in Juli. She is a married 23-year-old mother with a 1-year-old son. Her husband buys and sells motorcycles for a living. They live on Jr. Puno Nº 221, in the Juli district of the Chuchito province, department of Puno.

With this 500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase baize embroidery to sell it in Cusco.

She plans to open a call shop in Juli, but in order to do so, she will keep working in her handicraft business. Her greatest wish is to start her call shop and have many branches.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baize embroidery

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen Osemwenyaru makes a living as a caterer. She bakes egg rolls, meat pies and many other delicacies. She is also involved in outdoor catering for marriages, burials and other events. She is applying for this loan to buy a refrigerator, an oven and bags of flour. She says thank you to everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator, an oven and bags of flour

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort E. makes a living selling foodstuffs, drinks and provisions. She is 56 years old, married and has five children. She and her family live in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Comfort has applied for a loan to buy more foodstuffs, drinks and provisions to sell. She says thank you to all the people who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more food, provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Junet

texts.es: Junet tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella es docente, pero a la par trabaja en la elaboración de manualidades, las cuales vende a los colegios de nivel inicial, y a las personas que solicitan sus servicios, esta actividad la realiza desde 10 años, para poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Esta labor le agrada mucho, y demuestra tener arte y creatividad  para estos trabajos, ahora por campaña navideña está desarrollando mayor cantidad de  adornos navideños para los hogares. Sin embargo, lo cansado es cuidar a sus hijos y dedicarse al diseño de los adornos al mismo tiempo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y es una clienta muy cumplida con los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado Junet desea incrementar sus materiales para elaborar mayor cantidad de  adornos navideños.
texts.en:
Junet is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two children. She is a teacher, but she also makes handicrafts, which she sells to elementary schools and to people who seek her products. She has been in business for 10 years in an attempt to increase her income. She really likes this job, and she demonstrates her artistic talents in her work. During the holiday season, she is developing a greater amount Christmas decorations for the home. However, the most difficult thing for her is looking after her children while at the same time designing decorations. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she is a client that is very responsible with her payments. Junet would like to increase her supplies in order to make a greater quantity of Christmas decorations.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase craft supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth es casada y madre de siete hijos que están a su cargo, tiene 35 años de edad, estudió el quinto año de Secundaria y vive en el Jr. Chua Chua Nº 138, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno. 

Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al siglo XXI” en Juli. Con el primer préstamo que solicitó de S/. 300 compró bayetas y lanas de diferentes colores. Empezó a trabajar desde los 19 años ayudando a su mamá en el negocio de venta de carne, actividad económica a la que actualmente también se dedica. Compra ganado ovino para luego vender carne en la ciudad de Tacna y al mismo tiempo realiza bordados en bayeta.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprara ganado ovino. 

Su meta es construir un pequeño camal para tener las comodidades que requiere su actividad y seguir trabajando con la venta de carne.
texts.en:
Ms. Elizabeth N. is a married, 37-year-old woman with 7 children under her care. She completed her fifth year of secondary school and lives on Jr. Chua Chua Nº 138, in the Juli district of the Chuchito province, department of Puno.

She is one of the founding members of the “Mujeres al siglo XXI” (21st Century Women) microfinance institute in Juli. With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased wool and baize in assorted colors. She starting working at age 19, helping her mother in their meat business, which is the business she currently has. She purchases sheep, then sells its meat in the city of Tacna, but she also makes baize embroidery.

With the loan of 1,000.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase sheep. Her goal is to build a small slaughterhouse so that she can have all the facilities she needs for her meat business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The St. Joseph of Ñahuinpuquio VIllage Bank need a loan of $1100 for various businesses.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie Omoregbee is a hair stylist and also sells grooming supplies in her salon. She is 35 years old and married with one child. Her husband makes a living building furniture. Julie has applied for this loan to buy more supplies to sell. She says thank you to all the people who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Ugo

texts.en: E. Ugo makes a living selling shoes, bags and clothes. She purchases these items from suppliers in Lagos and sells them at the Oliha market in Benin City, Edo state. She is 35 years old and married with four children. She has applied for this loan to buy more inventory to sell. She says thank you to all the people who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, bags and clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es: La Sr. María tiene 42 años de edad, es casada su esposo es conductor, habita en el barrio Casimiro Sotelo en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijas de 23 y 12 años de edad ambas estudian y ayudan a su madre. Sus planes se han realizando poco a poco, ya que desde 22 años tiene su casa, dándole mayor seguridad y comodidad a su familia realizando mejoras en su hogar con el financiamiento de micro financieras. Doña María posee un pequeño negocio de venta de granos básicos y fritanga cuenta con doce años de experiencia laboral. Sus metas es ofertar nuevos productos, captar nuevos clientes, aumentar el volumen  de las ventas y tener mayores utilidades. Agracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra invertir en su negocio con las compra de nuevos productos como: granos básicos, fruta, vegetales y cosméticos.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old, married, and her husband is a driver. She lives in the Casimiro Sotelo neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She has two daughters, ages 23 and 12, who both are studying and help out their mother. Her plans have become a reality little by little, and she has had her house for 22 years which gives her more security and comfort for the family. She has made improvements to the home using micro-finance capital. María has a small business selling staple grains and fried foods, in which she has twelve years of experience. Her goals are to offer new products, attract new customers, and increase her sales. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, she will manage to invest further in her business by buying new merchandise such as: staple grains, fruits, vegetables and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase staple grains and fruits.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al siglo XXI”  desde hace 2 años. Vive en el Jr. San Juan Nº 111, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno. Es soltera y egresada del Instituto Superior Tecnológico de Juli. Empezó a trabajar desde los 20 años de edad. 

Con el primer préstamo de S/.300 que recibió, compró frutas para su juguería.

Actualmente sigue con su negocio y desea implementarlo mejor para la fiesta patronal del día 8 de diciembre que se realizara en Juli.

Con el préstamo de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más frutas, leche, algarrobita, etc.

Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Fabiola has been a member of the cooperative bank “Mujeres al Siglo XXI” (“Women of the 21st Century”) for the past two years. She lives in the Juli district of the Chuchito province, in Puno. She is single, and graduated from the Technological Institute of Juli. She started to work at the age of 20. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received, she bought fruits for her juice stand. Currently, she continues with this business and hopes to make some improvements to it for the cultural festival held in Juli on December 8th. With the loan of 300.00 soles, to be repaid in four months, she will purchase more fruits, milk, carob, etc. Her dreams are to grow her business and to have greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits, milk, carob, etc.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Née vers 1983 à   HETIN DOGODO dans la commune de DANGBO, dame  B. Madeleine est mariée et mère de 3enfants et 2 allant à l’école. Elle cultive dans le village de  HÊTIN SOTA  de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement    GF WANGNIME  DE HÊTIN SOTA  situé à proximité de la source thermale de dangbo ; elle vend aussi du poisson. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt de 110 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Née vers 1983 à HETIN DOGODO dans la commune de DANGBO, dame B. Madeleine est mariée et mère de 3enfants et 2 allant à l’école. Elle cultive dans le village de HÊTIN SOTA de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement GF WANGNIME DE HÊTIN SOTA situé à proximité de la source thermale de dangbo ; elle vend aussi du poisson. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement. Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible. La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt de 110 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Exploitation 1,5hectares  du maïs, du piment

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.es:
La señora Gliceria tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, es madre de un hijo, es Enfermera y vive en el Jr. Puno Nº 221, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al  Siglo XXI” en Juli. En un inicio con el préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió, compró bordados en bayeta para poder vender en Cusco. Inició esta actividad económica cuando entró al Banco Comunal y con el cual continua trabajando. Su esposo trabaja en el Sector Educación.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará bordados de diversos diseños.

Su sueño es salir adelante y conseguir un lugar seguro donde vender sus bordados.
texts.en:
Gliceria is 43 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She is a nurse, and lives on Puno Street in the district of Juli, Chuchito province, in Puno. She is a member of the cooperative bank “Mujeres al Siglo XXI” (“Women of the 21st Century”). With an original loan of 300.00 soles that she received, she bought cloth embroideries to sell in Cusco. She started this initial activity when the cooperative bank arrived, and she continues to work with them. Her husband works in the educational sector. With this loan of 500.00 soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will buy embroideries of varied designs. Her dreams include to get ahead and to obtain a secure location from which to sell her embroideries.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase embroideries of varied designs.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.en:
Maximiliana P. is a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank.  Maximiliana is 56 years old and is separated with four children. Maximiliana sells fish on Saturdays from the door of her house in the San Martin de Porres neighborhood. She also sells fish in the Yanamilla neighborhood.   Maximiliana needs a loan of $700 to buy fresh and frozen fish.  Maximiliana’s dreams are to expand her business, to launch another business, and for her children to finish their studies. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow.

loans.use: Buy fresh and frozen fish

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 12 años no deja de asistir a las ferias de su ciudad, ya que es el lugar donde realiza su actividad económica, la cual es vender condimentos de todo tipo en pequeñas bolsitas y ofrecerlas a las amas de casa. Esta actividad le ayuda cubrir sus gastos, ya que semana a semana sale a vender, le agrada ofrecer sus productos, aunque lo más cómodo seria tener un lugar estable donde venderlos. Pero gracias a Dios, nos dice, la venta de condimentos siempre es buena, porque no hay muchas personas vendiendo lo mismo, además como son muy baratas, vender al por menor es rentable, sin embargo, lo difícil es caminar todo el tiempo  y exponerse al sol todo el día. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita incrementará sus productos, ahora por navidad invertirá para vender pasas, las cuales son muy demandadas en esta época.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 38 years old, and lives with her husband and three children. Since she was twelve, she never missed the fairs of her city as this is where she earns her living selling all types of condiments in small bags to the local housewives. This activity helps her meet her living expenses, since she sells every week, and she enjoys offering her products although it would be more practical to have a stable location from which to sell her merchandise. But, thanks to God she tells us, sales of condiments are always good because not many people offer them. In addition, they are inexpensive and selling them at retail is profitable. Regardless, it is difficult to walk constantly and be exposed to the sun all day. This is her first loan with MFP. With the funds she is requesting, she will increase her supply of products. Now, for the holiday season, she will invest in the sale of raisins which are in great demand at this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quanity of merchandise that she sells.

loans.name: Kpènagni

texts.fr: Née vers 1988 à   HETIN DOGODO dans la commune de DANGBO, dame   H. Kpènagni est mariée et mère de 2enfants allant à l’école. Elle cultive dans le village de  HÊTIN SOTA  de la vallée de l’Ouémé situé à proximité de la source thermale de dangbo ; elle vend aussi du poisson. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Moussiliou Houinsou is a farmer, married and the father of one child. He lives in the district of Houedome, one of four enclaves that make up the township of Dangbo, and more precisely, in the village of Ahovilekome.

He works his field after the river waters recede. His primary activity is growing maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc. In general the population grows market gardens after the river waters recede and during the rainy season.

The local practice of selling off crops before the harvest does not provide them with security, on the contrary, it leaves them worse off. This practice involves selling the future harvest at rock-bottom prices to an affluent person to get hold of the money required for farming. Tired of this practice, he has asked for a loan of 200,000 FCFA to farm about 1.5 hectares of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1.5 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Doña Gregoria es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado D. Chimbo, distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno. Tiene 64 años D. edad, es madre D. 4 hijos y es casada. Asistió al Programa D. Alfabetización durante 3 meses. 

Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. S/.200 aumentó su capital y compró una vaca para engorD.. Hoy en día se dedica a la crianza D. ganado vacuno.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 5 cuotas, y también con parte D. sus ahorros, comprará un ganado vacuno (toro).

Gregoria desea continuar con su negocio y al mismo tiempo trabajar en  labores agrícolas.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a founding member of the cooperative bank “Espíritu Santo” (“Holy Spirit”) located in the Chimbo center of the Yunguyo province, in Puno. She is 64 years old, the mother of four children, and married. She attended the Program of Letters for three months. With the first loan of 200.00 soles that she received, she increased her working capital and bought a cow to fatten. Currently, she dedicates herself to raising cattle. With this loan of 1,500.00 soles, to be repaid in five installments, and using some of her savings, she will purchase a bull. Gregoria wishes to continue with her business, and concurrently work in farming.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull.

loans.name: Lourdes Noa

texts.en:
Lourdes Noa B. D. M. is a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank.  Lourdes is 40 years old and married with 3 children. Lourdes runs a store from a rented space on Maravillas Street where she sells a variety of drinks and ceviche (raw fish cured with lime juice) in the mornings. On weekends, she sells traditional Peruvian meals.  Lourdes needs a loan of $300 to buy beer and soda.  Lourdes’s dreams are for her children to graduate with professional degrees and to open a more profitable business. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow.

loans.use: Buy beer and soda

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Moussiliou

texts.fr: Agé de 21ans, H. Moussiliou est un producteur agricole, marié et père d’un enfant.  Il réside dans l’arrondissement de HOUEDOME, un des 4 arrondissements enclavés que compte la commune de DANGBO et précisément dans le village AHOVILEKOME. Il  travaille son champ après le retrait de la crue. Son  activité principale est la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc. En générale, la population s’adonne à la production vivrière après la  décrue et pendant  la saison pluvieuse. La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future a un nantis pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il sollicite un prêt de 200 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Moussiliou H., 21, is a farmer, married and the father of one child. He lives in the district of Houedome, one of four enclaves that make up the township of Dangbo, and more precisely, in the village of Ahovilekome.

He works his field after the river waters recede. His primary activity is growing maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc. In general, the population grows market gardens after the river waters recede and during the rainy season.

The local practice of selling off crops before the harvest does not provide them with security, on the contrary, it leaves them worse off. This practice involves selling the future harvest at rock-bottom prices to an affluent person to get hold of the money required for farming. Tired of this practice, he has asked for a loan of 200,000 FCFA to farm about 1.5 hectares of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1.5 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Gloria Vilma

texts.en:
Gloria Vilma C. U. is a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank.  Vilma is 40 years old and married with two children. She is a vegetable farmer in the Chacco community, where she owns a plot of land and rents several others. She sells her vegetables on foot in the Nery Garcia Market very early in the morning.  Vilma needs a loan of $700 to pay the rent for the land she farms on.  Vilma’s dreams are to help her children get ahead in life, to own more land, and to expand her business. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow.

loans.use: To pay rent on farmland

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Maribel es socia del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado de Chimbo, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Tiene 35 años de edad y es madre de 3 hijos que están a su cuidado. Estudió el tercer grado de primaria, es casada y su esposo se ocupa de otras labores y también la ayuda a trabajar para poder cumplir con el pago correspondiente. 

Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 compró un chancho para engorde y luego poder venderlo.

Actualmente continua con la crianza de animales menores y realiza labores agrícolas para su sustento. Desde hace un año es integrante del banco comunal.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, aumentará su capital y comprará 01 ganado vacuno a S/. 2.000.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprarse una casa fuera de su pueblo y así iniciar otro negocio.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the cooperative bank “Espíritu Santo” (“Holy Spirit”) located in the Chimbo center of the Yunguyo province, in Puno. She is 35 years old and the mother of three children that she cares for. She studied up to the third year of primary school, she is married and her husband works in other endeavors and also helps her with her work so they can meet their living expenses. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she bought a pig to fatten and later sell. Currently, she continues raising animals and also realizes farming activities to support herself. She has belonged to the cooperative bank for one year. With the loan of 1,500.00 soles, to be repaid in five months, she will increase her working capital and purchase a cow at 2,000.00 soles. Her greatest wish is to be able to buy a house outside of her town and, in that way, start another business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cow at S/. 2,000.

loans.name: Clément

texts.fr: Agé de 28 ans, D. Clément est un producteur agricole, marié et père de deux enfants dont un scolarisé.  Il réside dans l’arrondissement de HOUEDOME, un des 4 arrondissements enclavés que compte la commune de DANGBO et précisément dans le village AHOVILEKOME. Il  travaille son champ après le retrait de la crue. Son  activité principale est la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc. En générale, la population s’adonne à la production vivrière après la  décrue et pendant  la saison pluvieuse. La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future a un nantis pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il sollicite un prêt de 250 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 2hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Clément D., 28, is a farmer, married and the father of two children, of whom one is enrolled in school. He lives in the district of Houedome, one of four enclaves in the township of Dangbo, more precisely, in the village of Ahovilekome.

He works his field after the river waters recede. His primary activity is growing maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc. In general the population works growing market gardens after the river waters recede and during the rainy season.

The local practice of selling off crops before the harvest does not provide them with security, on the contrary, it bankrupts them. This practice involves selling the future harvest at rock-bottom prices to an affluent person to get hold of the money required for farming. Tired of this practice, he has asked for a loan of 250,000 FCFA to farm about 2 hectares of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 2 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy Q. V. is a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank.  She is 39 years old and is married with two children. Nancy has a stand in the Jesus Nazareno Market, where she sells spices, which she prepares herself. She also sells dry goods, ready-to-use (pre-soaked) beans and grains, homemade ice cream and popsicles. Her son helps her with the business.
