Nancy needs a loan of $975 to buy hot peppers, milk and oil.  Nancy’s dreams are that her children will graduate with professional degrees, to open a store in her home, and to offer a wider variety of merchandise in her store. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow.

loans.use: Buy hot peppers, milk and oil

loans.name: Sévérin

texts.fr: Agé de 33 ans, Z. Sévérin est un producteur agricole, marié et père de trois enfants dont un scolarisé.  Il réside dans l’arrondissement de HOUEDOME, un des 4 arrondissements enclavés que compte la commune de DANGBO et précisément dans le village AHOVILEKOME. Il  travaille son champ après le retrait de la crue. Son  activité principale est la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc. En générale, la population s’adonne à la production vivrière après la  décrue et pendant  la saison pluvieuse. La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future a un nantis pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il sollicite un prêt de 190 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Sévérin Z., 33, is a farmer, married and the father of three children, of whom one is enrolled in school. He lives in the district of Houedome, one of four enclaves in the township of Dangbo, more precisely, in the village of Ahovilekome.

He works his field after the river waters recede. His primary activity is growing maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc. In general the population works growing market gardens after the river waters recede and during the rainy season.

The local practice of selling off crops before the harvest does not provide them with security, on the contrary, it bankrupts them. This practice involves selling the future harvest at rock-bottom prices to an affluent person to get hold of the money required for farming. Tired of this practice, he has asked for a loan of 190,000 FCFA to farm about 1.5 hectares of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1.5 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank. Consuelo is 28 years old and single; she lives with her parents. She runs a store from her home where she sells dry goods, fruits, vegetables, gifts and pills; she also has a public telephone. Her store is located on a very busy street, and she and her sister work there every day of the week. Consuelo is also studying to be an elementary school teacher. Consuelo needs a loan of 3450 soles to buy fruitcake, wine and champagne. Consuelo’s dreams are to own a larger, wholesale store, and for her siblings to finish their studies and get jobs in their respective fields.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Consuelo es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial. Consuelo es soltera, tiene 28 años y vive con sus padres, Consuelo tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, regalos, pastillas, teléfono publico, su tienda esta ubicada en una avenida muy concurrida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hermana. Consuelo además estudia educación primaria en la universidad. Consuelo necesita un préstamo de 3450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panetones, vinos y champaña. Los sueños de Consuelo son tener un negocio mas grande y ser mayorista, sus hermanos culminen sus estudios y ejercer su carrera.

loans.use: Buy fruitcake, wine and champagne

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La señora Paula es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al siglo XXI” desD. hace aproximadamente 7 años y vive en el Jr. Puno 221, distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chuchito, departamento D. Puno. Tiene 65 años D. edad, es separada y madre D. 4 hijos ya mayores y con familia. 

Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300 compró bordados en bayeta para venderlos en Cusco (Ollantaytambo). Paula sacó adelante a sus hijos con su trabajo y a pesar D. estar un poco delicada D. salud continua con su negocio para pagar puntualmente su cuota.

Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará bordados en bayeta D. todo tipo.

Paula desea seguir viajando al Cusco para realizar su negocio D. Artesanía.
texts.en:
Paula has belonged to the “Mujeres al Siglo XXI” (“Women of the 21st Century”) cooperative bank for approximately seven years. She lives on Puno Street, in the Juli district of Chuchito province, in Puno. She is 65 years old, separated, and the mother of four children who are now grown and have their own families. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received, she purchased cloth embroideries to sell in Cusco (Ollantaytambo). Paula managed to help her children get ahead with her work, and, despite the fact that she is in somewhat fragile health, she continues to work so she can pay her loan installments in a timely manner. With this loan of 2,000.00 soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will purchase a variety of cloth embroideries. Paula wishes to continue traveling to Cusco to realize her craft sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cloth embroideries.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 35 años, es divorciada y vive con sus hijos. Se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. cosméticos en diversos lugares públicos  y visitando a varias clientas en sus respectivos domicilios o trabajos, sobre todo a jóvenes señoritas, quienes son sus clientes más frecuentes, esta actividad L. practica desD. hace 3 años. Para elL. lo más importante es socializar con las personas, ya que es lo que más le agrada, dialogar y no ser solo una vendedora, sino amiga D. sus clientas, y gracias a que tiene  una facilidad D. comunicarse con simpatía logra un impacto positivo, que se refleja en sus ventas del mes. Lo difícil es cobrar todos lo días y distribuir sus productos, ya que tiene que trasladarse por diversos lugares. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. María tiene pensado invertir los 1000 soles en L. compra D. productos D.  belleza para niñas y venderlos en el colegio cercado a su zona.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old, divorced, and lives with her children. She dedicates herself to selling cosmetics products in various public locations, and visiting various customers at their respective homes or workplaces. Most of all, she tends to young women who are her most frequent customers. She has practiced this activity for three years. For her, an important aspect of her business which she enjoys the most is socializing and chatting with people. She not only wants to be a saleswoman, but also her clients’ friend. Thanks to the fact that communicating comes easily to her, her friendliness has a positive impact on her business which is reflected in her monthly sales. A difficult part is to charge each day, and distributing her products as she has to travel among various locations. This is her first loan with MFP. María is thinking about investing the 1,000.00 soles into the purchase of beauty products for girls and selling them at the school near her zone.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for girls.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.fr: Agé de 39 ans,  D. CELESTIN est un producteur agricole, marié et père de 4 enfants dont 1 scolarisé.  Il réside dans l’arrondissement de HOUEDOME, un des 4 arrondissements enclavés que compte la commune de DANGBO et précisément dans le village AGONGUÊ. Il  travaille son champ après le retrait de la crue. Son  activité principale est la culture du maïs, du niébé, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate. En générale, la population s’adonne à la production vivrière après la  décrue et pendant  la saison pluvieuse. La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future a un nantis pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il sollicite un prêt de 190 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Celestin D., 39, is a farmer, married and the father of four children, of whom one is enrolled in school. He lives in the district of Houedome, one of four enclaves that make up the township of Dangbo, more precisely, in the village of Ahovilekome.

He works his field after the river waters recede. His primary activity is growing maize (corn), niébé (cowpeas), vegetables, okra, and tomatoes. In general the population works growing market gardens after the river waters recede and during the rainy season.

The local practice of selling off crops before the harvest does not provide them with security, on the contrary, it bankrupts them. This practice involves selling the future harvest at rock-bottom prices to an affluent person to get hold of the money required for farming. Tired of this practice, he has asked for a loan of 190,000 FCFA to farm about 1.5 hectares of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1.5 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Fatou Léna

texts.fr: Cette dame est une maréyeuse. Elle est dpuis plusieurs années dans la vente du poisson qu'elle achéte au quai de pêche de Boudody à l'ouest de Ziguinchor. Avec son commerce elle soutient son mari et contribue à l'entretien de sa nombreuse famille. Elle demande ce crédit pour renforcer ses activités.
texts.en:
This woman is a wholesale fish merchant. For several years she has been in the fish selling business. She buys the fish on the Boudody dock, west of Ziguinchor. With her business she supports her husband and contributes to her large family's upkeep. She is requesting this loan to strengthen her activitivites.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish selling

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Se dedica a vender quesos y papas, distribuye en las tiendas al crédito, para luego cobrarles después D. su venta, esta actividad la realiza desD. hace 6 años, y así cubre gran parte D. los gastos dentro D. su hogar. Para María no es complicado su trabajo, por lo contrario es muy tranquilo, ya que distribuye quincenalmente, lo que más le agrada es elaborar estos riquísimos quesos, además le es rentable porque es la única persona que por años ha abastecido a las tiendas D. su zona con estos productos. Lo difícil es trasladar estos productos, y sobre todo ofertar cuando son tiendas nuevas donD. no la conocen. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. María está dispuesta ha abastecer a mayor cantidad D. tiendas, para ello pensó en comprar y vender quesos muy aparte D. los que ella elabora, para satisfacer los pedidos e incrementarlos.
texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. She sells cheese and potatoes, which she distributes to stores to sell. She collects the money after her products are sold. She has been doing this for 6 years and this pays for a large part of her household expenses. Maria doesn't consider her job to be complicated, rather it is very peaceful. She takes her products to the stores every 15 days. What she likes best about her job is making delicious cheeses and this is profitable because she is the only person who supplies the stores in her region with these products. The most difficult parts of her job are transferring the products and supplying products to new stores that do not know her. This is her first loan with MFP. Maria is ready to distribute her products to more stores and in order to do this she would like to buy and sell other cheeses besides the ones that she makes. This will help her fill the orders she has and increase orders in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese and supplies for cheese making

loans.name: Petrona Maritza

texts.es:
La Sra.  Petrona  tiene 45 años de edad, habitante del barrio 380 en la capital de Managua, casada, tiene tres  hijos de 8, 12, y 14 años de edad, todos estudian. Los planes de doña petrona para con su familia es mejorar su nivel de vida, ofrecerle seguridad y una mayor comodidad. Se desempeña como domestica desde hace diez  años, es un trabajo muy casado y agotador.
Sus metas en el ámbito laboral es cambiar a un mejor trabajo, conseguir un préstamo para construir completamente su casa. Para esto va a comprar materiales de construcción como piedra, arena, cemento Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra ofrecerle a su familia una mayor seguridad y casa digna.
texts.en:
Petrona is 45 years old, married, lives in the 380 neighborhood in the capital city of Managua, and has three children ages 8, 12 and 14 who are in school. Petrona’s plans for her family include improving their standard of living, offering them security and additional comforts. She has worked in housekeeping/domestic help for ten years, a job that is very exhausting. Her work-related ambitions are to switch to a better type of employment, and to obtain a loan to finish construction on her house. For this reason, she is going to purchase supplies such as stone, sand, and cement. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, she will manage to offer her family a safer living environment and a more dignified abode.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to finish building her house.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank. She is 48 years old and is married with four children. Faustina has a car parts store, which she runs from a rented location. Her store is near several mechanics' shops. Her husband is a mechanic and has his own shop. Faustina needs a loan of 900 soles to buy pinions and other car parts. Faustina’s dreams are to offer a wider variety of merchandise in her store and for her children to finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial. Faustina es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Faustina tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende repuestos para carros, el local esta ubicado cerca de diferentes talleres mecánicos, además que su esposo es mecánico y también tiene su taller. Faustina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de piñones y trenes fijos. Los sueños de Faustina son de surtir con mas productos su tienda y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Buy pinions and other car parts

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella es cosmetóloga y desde hace 5 años abrió su salón de belleza, al cual se dedica con mucho esmero y trata a su clientela de la mejor manera, lo que le agrada sobre todo, es realizar peinados muy novedosos, llamativos y muy elegantes. Esta  actividad es muy rentable, ya que todos sus vecinos visitan constantemente su  salón de belleza, lo cual le permite generar ingresos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de instrumentos para su salón, como  planchadoras, rizadoras y secadoras, que le ayuden a agilizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old, and lives with her husband and two children. She is a cosmetologist and, five years ago, opened her own beauty salon. She dedicates herself to her business with great care, and she treats her customers very well. What she enjoys the most is creating hairstyles that are very innovative, attractive and elegant. This activity is very profitable as all her neighbors visit her salon constantly which allows her to generate income. This is her first loan with MFP. The funds requested will be invested into the purchase of instruments for her salon, such as flat irons, curlers and hairdryers which will help her carry out her work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tools for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Sefora

texts.es:
La señora Sefora es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Siglo XXI” desde hace un año, es casada y madre de 2 hijos menores. Tiene 30 años de edad, es profesora y vive  en el Jr. Imprenta Nº 134, distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Con este préstamo de S/.300 compró arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, etc. A la edad de 15 años empezó con el negocio de venta de abarrotes. Cuando tuvo su esposo siguió trabajando para salir adelante ya que el no tenía un trabajo seguro. Actualmente continua con la venta de abarrotes los días Domingos en Acora.

Con este préstamo de S/. 600, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 2 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azúcar, 3 bolsas de fideos, aceite por cajas, etc.

Su gran deseo es abrir una tienda de abarrotes para vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Sefora has belonged to the cooperative bank “Mujeres al Siglo XXI” (“Women of the 21st Century”) for one year. She is married and has two small children. She is 30 years old, a teacher, and lives in the Juli district of the Chuchito province, in Puno. With her loan of 300.00 soles, she bought rice, sugar, oil, noodles, etc. She started in the business of selling groceries at age 15. After she married, she continued working to get ahead as her husband’s employment status was not stable. Currently, she continues selling groceries on Sundays in Acora. With this loan of 600.00 soles, to be repaid in four installments, she plans to purchase two sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 3 bags of noodles, oil by the crate, etc. Her greatest wish is to open a general store where she can sell her merchandise at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of rice, two sacks of sugar, three bags of noodles, oil by the crate, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.es: Marilyn tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Siempre le agradó vender productos de belleza, y hace como 2 años se inició en este negocio, ofrecer sus productos es todo reto, pero a tenido la facilidad de  ser aceptada por las personas, gracias a su capacidad de sociabilizar, lo cual la pone en ventaja frente a otras personas dentro de la competencia. Aun así, Marylin trata de que sus ganancias se incrementen y que sus pedidos sean favorables, para ello trata de buscar nuevos clientes en diversos lugares, lo cual puede resultar muy complicado, pero no imposible, y es esta una de las características que valoran sus seres queridos en Marylin, su perseverancia. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y es una socia muy cumplida con sus  pagos. Con la cantidad solicitada incrementará sus productos de belleza para tener  productos qué ofrecer al instante, sin tener que recurrir al catálogo.
texts.en:
Marilyn is 34 years old and lives with her husband and son. She always enjoyed selling beauty products and, about two years ago, she started in this business. Offering her products is a challenge, but she has the advantage of being accepted by the public thanks to her ability to socialize which gives her an edge over the competition. Regardless, Marilyn tries to increase her earnings and bring in orders for which she must seek out new customers in different areas. This can be quite difficult, but not impossible, and perserverance is one of the qualities that Marilyn’s loved ones admire about her. This is her 5th loan with MFP, and she is a member who is very punctual with her payments. With the amount requested, she will invest in beauty products to have on hand should they be requested rather than having to place them on order.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of products that she sells.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery tiene 45 años, es soltera y vive con sus hermanas. Ella es farmacéutica y abrió su botica hace 5 años, negocio que viene funcionando adecuadamente, dando ingresos muy buenos, gracias a que en su zona no cuentan con muchas boticas cercanas, entonces no tiene competencia. Para Mery atender a las personas y ayudarlas a mejorar su salud y su calidad de vida es lo mejor que puede realizar, aunque para ello tenga que invertir  grandes cantidades de  dinero en la compra de medicinas para sus vecinos. Este es  su primer crédito con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado complementará su botica con productos de belleza y regalos, para no sólo ofrecer salud, sino también belleza y felicidad.
texts.en:
Mery is 45 years old, single, and lives with her sisters. She is a pharmacist and opened her pharmacy five years ago. The business progresses well and provides a good income thanks to the fact that, in her region, there are not many local pharmacies therefore she does not have competition. What Mery does best is attending to people and helping them improve their health and the quality of their lives. To do this, however, she must invest large sums of money into the purchase of medicines for her neighbors. This is her first loan with MFP. With the funds requested she will enhance her pharmacy by adding beauty supplies and gifts, so that she offers not only health, but also beauty and happiness.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enhance her pharmacy with the sale of other types of products.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 24 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo en la casa de sus padres. Desde que tuvo su hija se vio en la necesidad de  trabajar para criar a su pequeña, gracias al apoyo de sus padres, quienes le facilitaron el espacio necesario para que pueda abrir una bodega, Nelly inició hace 2 años y desde entonces, no solo trata de vender sus productos, sino que se relacionarse con las demás  personas de su localidad, haciendo de su tienda, no solo un lugar donde ir a comprar, sino un espacio para compartir. Sin embargo, lo difícil es adquirir productos de calidad a precios módicos, lo cual puede obtener en los mercados mayoristas de su ciudad, pero están alejados de su comunidad. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado incrementará la cantidad de sus productos y surtirá su tienda con el fin de poder obtener mayores ganancias y mayor concurrencia.
texts.en:
Nelly is a 24-year old single mother. She and her child live with her parents. Now that she has a daughter to raise, she needs to work. Thanks to support from her parents, who have provided space for her business, Nelly has been able to open a small grocery. She started the business 2 years ago and she's tried since then to not only sell groceries but also to establish links with her neighbors so that the store is more than a place to shop, it's a place to meet friends. However, it's been difficult to buy good merchandise at reasonable prices. She can get wholesale supplies of goods in her city but the suppliers are far from her neighborhood. This is her first MFP loan. She will use the money to increase the quantity of goods she offers and stock her store so that she can increase both her earnings and her customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase quantity of goods for sale.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.fr: Née le 20 octobre 1978 à Cotonou (Aîdjèdo), D. Adeline résidant dans le 5earrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo précisément à Tokpota1,   est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants dont trois (03) sont scolarisés. Adeline est coiffeuse et dispose d’un atelier dans lequel elle mène son activité ; une activité qu’elle mène passionnément pour aider son mari à faire face aux charges familiales. Pour diversifier ses sources de revenus, elle mène comme activité secondaire la vente de jus de bissap. Malgré la passion qu’elle a pour son activité elle ne dispose pas assez de fonds pour mener à bien cette  activité et se faire plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses charges. Pour ce fait, elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 180.000frcs CFA pour l’achat d’un séchoir et de produits de coiffure afin de mieux satisfaire le besoin de la clientèle et se faire assez de revenus pour faire face d’une part à ses différentes charges et d’autre part de se constituer une épargne.
texts.en:
Born on October 20, 1978 in Cotonou (Aîdjèdo), Adeline D. lives in the 5th district of the town of Porto-Novo, more precisely in Tokpota 1. She is married and the mother of 4 children of whom 3 are enrolled in school.

Adeline is a hairdresser and has a salon where she works--work she undertakes passionately so as to help her husband support the family. To diversify her revenue sources, she also sells "bissap" (hibiscus flower) juice. Despite the passion she feels about her work, she does not have enough capital to do really well and bring in enough to easily cover her expenses. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 180,000 F CFA to purchase a dryer and and hairdressing products so as to better satisfy the needs of her clientele while making enough to deal with her various expenses and, on the other hand, be able to put some savings aside.

GF Missimide is a women's group with 14 members from the village of Dekangbo in the district of Gbeko, an enclave of the township of Dangbo. Its members sell cereals and are farmers. The sack of 100 kg of maize in their zone costs 20,000 F CFA, one of flour costs 15,000 F CFA. The members of this group need a loan in the amount of 800,000 F CFA so that they can buy as inventory 20 sacks of maize, 20 sacks of flour and the rest will be for purchasing cooking salt in the town--something they also sell.

This is an entrepreneurs' group where the loan is managed jointly by the members. The following women belong to this group: Julie HOUSSA, Pierrette HOUNLIHO, Martine SAGBO, Pierrette ADANTONOU, Brigitte HOUESSANOU, Véronique ZOSSOU, Félicienne ZOUNON, Valentine ZANNOU, Julienne AGBODJETE, Clémentine KOUTONGNON, Agathe KOKODJI, Henriette HOUNSA, Cécile SONOU, B. M. Anastasie AGOSSOU.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing working materials for her salon

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es: La Sr. Angélica tiene 33 años de edad, habitante de un barrio de la capital Managua llamado 30 de mayo, soltera y con una preciosa hija de tan solo 7 años de edad. Doña angélica trabaja como docente en un colegio desde hace diez años, es un trabajo que ayuda al cuido y educación de su hija formándola a una persona de bien. Los planes para el futuro si  Dios lo  permita la vida para ver a su hija una profesional, unos de sus objetivos personales es progresar con  los estudios en el ámbito laboral para recibir mayores ingresos y que su hija tenga un patrimonio propio. Con la solicitud de préstamo que esta haciendo es para comprar materiales de construcción como piedra, cemento, arena, hierro para terminar de hacer su casa y así tener una vivienda digna
texts.en:
Angelica, 33, lives in a neighborhood of Managua called 30 de Mayo. She's a single mother with a lovely 7-year old daughter. Angelica has worked as a teacher at a high school for 10 years. It's work that helps her to care and educate her daughter, shaping her for a better future. She would like to see her daughter grow up to have a professional career. For herself, Angelica hopes to continue her studies so she can get ahead in her own career and increase her earnings, something that will allow her to better provide for her daughter. Angelica plans to use the loan to buy construction materials--stone, cement, sand, iron bar--so that she can finish building her house and have a decent place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy building materials for house.

loans.name: Neri

texts.es: Neri tiene 32 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus  tres hijos. Hace 3 años inició junto a su esposo, el alquiler de equipos de sonido, actividad que  pudieron percibir que era de  gran utilidad  y demanda en su localidad, por ello se motivaron a comprar equipos y alquilarlos para las fiestas de los pueblos o en los locales  para  diversos eventos. Esta actividad  es muy rentable, debido a la cantidad de fiestas que hay dentro de su zona, y sobre todo porque son pocos los que brindan estos servicios, sin embargo, hay que ser muy cautelosos con los  tipos de personas a quienes se les alquila los equipos y de tener muy claro el trato en caso del daño de los equipos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Neri, junto a su esposo, invertirán en la compra de nuevos equipos para mejorar sus servicios.
texts.en:
Neri, 32, is married. She lives with her husband and their three children. Three years ago, she and her husband decided to start a business renting sound equipment, a business that they could see would be in much demand in their area. They bought equipment and rented it for parties, events in local stores, etc. The business is very profitable because there are lots of parties in the neighborhood and few competitors. However, they have to be very careful about who they rent their equipment to and how it should be treated in order to avoid damage to it. This is their first MFP loan. Neri, together with her husband, will invest in the purchase of new equipment in order to improve their services.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sound equipment for rental business.

loans.name: Margareth

texts.es:
Margareth es socia, desde casi 3 años, del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Siglo XXI”. Vive en el Jr. San Juan Nº 111, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno. Tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de una niña y su esposo es Antropólogo y trabaja en el Programa Construyendo Perú. 

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró insumos para preparar bebidas refrescantes. 

Desde muy joven aprendió a hacer negocio, fue así que pudo terminar la carrera de Derecho satisfactoriamente, y con la finalidad de mejorar sus ingresos  económicos inauguró un snack bar.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará  más insumos y mercadería para su actividad económica.

Su mayor aspiración es desenvolverse como profesional y al mismo tiempo administrar su negocio.
texts.en:
Margareth has been a member of the Mujeres al Siglo XXI [Women of the 21st Century] community bank for 3 years. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno. She is 25 years old, partnered and the mother of a little girl. Her husband is an anthropologist and works for the Construyendo Peru [Building Peru] program.

With an initial S/.300 [300 Peruvian soles] loan, she bought supplies for making cold drinks. She learned how to run a business when she was very young. That's how she was able to earn a Law degree. She set up a snack bar hoping to improve her income. With this S/.200 loan, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy more supplies and merchandise for her business.

Her biggest hope is to get ahead in her profession and manage her business at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for drinks business.

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr: Née vers 1980 à   HETIN ZOUNKPA dans la commune de DANGBO, dame   W. Henriette est mariée et mère de 3enfants et aucun d’entre eux allant à l’école. Elle cultive dans le village de  HÊTIN SOTA  de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement    GF WANGNIME  DE HÊTIN SOTA  situé à proximité de la source thermale de dangbo ; elle vend aussi du poisson. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt de 110 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1980 in Hetin Zounkpa in the township of Dangbo, Mrs. Henriette W. is the mother of 3 children, none of whom is enrolled in school. She is a farmer in the village of Hetin Sota in the valley of the Ouémé River and is a member of the group GF Wangnime of Hetin Sota, located near the hot springs of Dangbo. She also sells fish.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the river level is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc which are staple foods in Benin. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay for laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing their land.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Henriette W. has requested a loan of 110,000 F CFA which will allow her to farm about 1.5 hectares, growing some of the aforementioned crops

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1.5 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es: Sofía tiene 35 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Hace 3 años inició su actividad de bordados, motivada por los diseños que hay en las diversas elaboraciones, los adornos le llamaron mucho su atención y desde  entonces empezó a aprender lo básico para iniciar, luego fue mejorando su técnica, poco a poco, hasta que ahora logró que sus adornos navideños y sus diversos  trabajos sean muy solicitados por las personas. Sofía tiene en su máquina de coser, su mejor ayudante, y le agrada estar horas trabajando  en la elaboración de  diversos bordados, ya que por temporadas la demanda crece y las ganancias se triplican, hay que aprovechar, sobre todo en fiestas navideñas, sin embargo, lo difícil es hacer los moldes de diseños para todos los tamaños siendo éste, un proceso  dificultoso. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de materia prima para su trabajo, así como hilos especiales, lentejuelas y telas.
texts.en:
Sofia, 35, lives with her husband and three children. Three years ago, she started an embroidery business, inspired by designs that she'd seen. The designs captured her imagination and she immediately began learning the basics of embroidery, slowly improving her technique to the point where the embroidery she makes at Christmas is much sought after. Sofia's sewing machine is her best helper and she's happy to spend hours working away at her embroidery. Demand for Sofia's products grows this time of year and her earnings triple, so she has to make the most of the season, above all for Christmas fairs. One hurdle she faces is making designs for all possible sizes, a difficult process. This is Sofia's first MFP loan. With the loan, she will buy wholesale supplies of basic materials such as threads, sequins and cloth.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for embroidery business.

loans.name: Susy

texts.es: Susy tiene 35 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus  tres hijos. Todas las mañanas de los días feriados y de fiestas sale muy temprano a vender  sus productos de limpieza, en especial de cocina, siendo su clientela señoras amas de casa, esta actividad la realiza por más de 10 años, y gracias a que en las ferias  la concurrencia de personas es bastante favorable, puede  vender  mayor cantidad de productos en un solo día, lo que hace de su actividad  algo rentable. Lo difícil es salir muy de mañana y caminar cuadras tras cuadras ofreciendo sus productos, con el fin de poder vender al máximo su mercadería. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. El deseo de Susy es vender en un lugar propio, por ello desea invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos e incrementar sus ingresos y ahorros, para conseguir el monto necesario para su local propio.
texts.en:
Susy is 35 years old, is married and lives with her husband and their three children. In the morning on market days and holidays she leaves very early to sell cleaning products, mostly products for the kitchen. Most of her customers are women who are housewives. She has been doing this for more than 10 years and thanks to the fact that the markets are crowded with people, she can sell a large amount of her products in just one day, making her job somewhat profitable. The difficult part is leaving very early and walking for blocks and blocks offering her products in order to sell the maximum amount of her merchandise. This is her first loan with MFP. Susy would like to sell in her own place in the market. She would like to invest in a larger amount of products and increase her earnings and savings in order to save enough for her own space.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of products to sell

loans.name: Ulises

texts.es: Ulises tiene 34 años, es casado, vive con su esposa y su hijo. Se dedica a la venta de fertilizantes desde hace un año, lo que aprendió gracias a un buen amigo que lo ayudó mucho para salir adelante. Además, Ulises es cantante,  y pertenece a un grupo musical folclórico de su ciudad. Le agrada vender  y aprender del negocio de los fertilizantes, ya que es muy rentable, puesto que hay una muy buena cantidad de agricultores que llegan a la ciudad en busca de estos productos para sus terrenos de cultivo. Lo difícil es pesar estos fertilizantes en pocas cantidades, ya que tiene un olor muy desagradable. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Ulises invertirá 1000 soles en la compra de mayor cantidad de fertilizantes para incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Ulises is 34 years old, is married and lives with his wife and son. He sells fertilizer for a living and has been doing this for the last year. He learned the job thanks to a good friend who helped him get ahead in life. Ulises is also a singer and he belongs to a folkloric music group in his city. He likes being a salesman and learning the fertilizer business. It is a profitable job because there are large numbers of farmers who come to the city to buy fertilizers for their fields. The difficult part of his job is to weigh the fertilizer in small quantities because it has a very disagreeable smell. This is his first loan with MFP. Ulises will invest 1000 soles ($325) in buying more fertilizer so he can increase his sales and his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: Originaire d'ALLADA,dame H. Louise est née en 1961 à Cotonou. Elevée par sa tante , elle aidait cette dernière dans la vente d'akassa (pâte faite à base de maïs) .En 1979, elle alla en apprentissage de couture gràce au soutien financier de sa grande sœur. Elle reçut son diplôme de fin d' apprentissage après 09 ans.Elle a ouvert son atelier de couture et exerça le métier pendant 3 ans avant de se lancer dans le commerce  de maïs ,huile rouge et céréales. Depuis 12 ans ; elle s'est mise dans la vente des oeufs frais et produits de soldes (liquidation):plats,tasses et autres .Elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt de 150000fcfa d'une durée de 10 mois pour renforcer son activité .Mariée à TOSSOU Martin, cordonnier ,elle n'a pas d'enfant.
texts.en:
A native of Allada, Mrs. Louise H. was born in 1961 in Cotonou. Raised by her aunt, she helped the latter sell "akassa" (a porridge made out of maize). In 1979, she was apprenticed to a seamstress, thanks to financial help from her big sister. She received her diploma in that trade after 9 years.

Louise opened her own workshop and plied her trade for three years before beginning to sell maize, red palm oil, and cereals. For 12 years now, she has been selling fresh eggs and articles on deep discount: plates, cups, etc. She is requesting this third loan of 150,000 F CFA with a term of 10 months to bolster her little business. Married to Martin Tossou, a shoemaker, she has no children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 10 cartons of 4 dozen cups and plates; 50 trays of eggs

loans.name: Doris Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Doris del carmen O. tiene la edad de 31 años, habita en el sector de las pilas Oriental ubicado en la ciudad de Masaya, junto a su esposo y hijos,  el esposo de la señora trabaja como albañil para cubrir los gastos del hogar. La señora Doris trabaja en su propio negocio ya que ella se dedica al destace de cerdo desde hace dos años.  Con la solicitud del préstamo es para poder comprar cerdos y incrementar la producción ya que tiene un mercado establecido y sus cliente están demandado mas de la capacidad de ella lo quiere dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, a si como incrementar sus ventas y ingresos
texts.en:
Doris del Carmen O. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Pilas Oriental area in the city of Masaya. Her husband works as a bricklayer to pay for household expenses. For the past two years Doris has worked in her own business, butchering pigs. This loan is to be able to buy more pigs and increase her production. She has an established market and her customers require more than she is capable of producing right now. She wants give good service to her customers and help increase her sales and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pigs

loans.name: Marie Gisèle

texts.fr: Originaire de Porto-Novo,capitale politique du BENIN,dame AGASSOUSSI Marie Gisèle est née en 1968 à Cotonou .Mariée à ACCLOMBESSI Albert ,entrepreneur, elle est mère de 06 enfants.Après son échec au Certificat d'Etude Primaire(CEP), elle aida sa mère dans la vente de divers articles :savons, les conserves,les fruits.Ensuite elle alla en apprentissage de couture -layette pour 3 ans .Elle reçut son diplôme de fin de formation et parallèlement à l'exercice de son métier ,elle ouvre une boutique dans laquelle elle  vend différents articles de mercerie .Elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt de 150000fcfa pour renforcer son activité en la diversifiant avec la vente de soja et d'huile.
texts.en:
A native of Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin, Mrs. Marie Gisèle A. was born in 1968 in Cotonou. Married to Albert Acclombessi, entrepreneur, she is the mother of 6 children. After she failed the Primary School Leaving Certificate, she helped her mother sell various items: soap, tinned foods, fruit. Then she did an apprenticeship in sewing layettes for three years.

Marie Gisèle received her diploma at the end of this course and, while plying her trade, she has also opened a shop where she sells various sewing necessities. She is requesting this third loan in the amount of 150,000 F CFA to bolster her business by diversifying and selling soy and oil.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 1 sack of soy, 1 tin of 10 liters of peanut oil, 6 rolls of poplin, etc.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus  tres hijos. DesD. muy temprano entra a su cocina a preparar los deliciosos platillos que  venderá durante en día, la misma rutina todos los días desD. hace 3 años, y gracias a su buenísima sazón tiene acogida por los visitantes y vecinos que desD. que abre su local la esperan para recibir su atención. La cocina es una actividad muy  agradable D. realizar para Vilma, ya que no tiene que salir D. casa, sino que su trabajo está en casa, lo difícil es preparar grandes cantidades D. comida para todos sus comensales. Este es su 10mo crédito con MFP, y hasta la fecha no tiene problemas en los pagos.Con el dinero solicitado mejorará el ambiente D. su hogar donD. tiene su pequeño restaurante, y comprará los utensilios necesarios para su actividad.
texts.en:
Vilma is 49 years old and lives with her husband and three children. For the past 3 years, she has awoken very early in order to prepare the delicious food that she sells during the day. Thanks to her fantastic cooking, her restaurant is always very crowded with visitors and neighbors who arrive as soon as she opens. Vilma enjoys cooking since it doesn't require her to leave her home since she runs the restaurant out of her house. The challenging part of her job is preparing such large amounts of food for her many customers. This is her 10th loan with Prisma Microfinance and she has yet to have any problems in making her payments. She will use the loan to improve the atmosphere of her home where she operates her small restaurant and she will purchase the necessary cooking utensils for her work.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the atmosphere of her restaurant and buy cooking utensils

loans.name: Ana Modesta

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 45 años de edad, es separada y madre de 03 hijos, uno mayor con familia y dos que aún dependen de ella. Terminó el quinto año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. 9 de Diciembre Nº 400- Barrio 4 de Noviembre, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales” en Puno. Al inicio con el préstamo de S/. 300 aumentó su capital y compró insumos para preparar sándwiches en la tienda escolar. A los 29 años empezó a vender ropa y al mismo tiempo preparaba viandas (comida). Cuando su negocio ya estaba prosperando sufrió un robo y tuvo que empezar de nuevo, puso bastante empeño y nuevamente emprendió su negocio. 

Actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa en el Mercado Bellavista.

Con este préstamo de S/.1, 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas,  comprará prendas de vestir para vender en las fiestas navideñas.

Su anhelo es tener una tienda de lencería (ropa de bebes) y que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana is 45 years old, separated from her husband, and the mother of three children, one of whom is an adult with his own family while the other two are dependent on her. She completed up to her 5th year of high school and she lives on December 9th Street, in the November 4th neighborhood of Puno, Peru. She is a founding member of the Diana de Gales (Diana of Wales) Village Bank in Puno. With her first loan of $100, she increased her working capital and bought ingredients to make sandwiches to sell in a school store. At the age of 29, she started selling clothing and, at the same time, making food to sell. When her business was just started to prosper, she was robbed and had to start over. She put forth a great deal of effort and was once again able to start her business. Currently, she sells clothing in the Bellavista Market. With this $500 loan which she will repay in 4 installments, she will purchase clothing to sell during the Christmas holidays. Her dream is to have her own baby clothing store and for her son to become a professional

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.fr: Agée de 42 ans, dame G. Yvonne est originaire d'Abomey,dans le Zou au centre Benin. Elle n'a jamais fréquenté et aidait dès son jeune âge sa mère dans la transformation de noix de palme en huile rouge et dans la vente. Elle s'est mise à son propre compte après s'être mariée. Elle fait la préparation et la vente de boule de pâte traditionnelle appelée" LIO" et qui est faite à base de maïs,elle vend également les emballages sachets.C'est pour pouvoir renforcer cette activité,qu'elle sollicite ce prêt de 120000fcfa et compte s'approvisionner en maïs et emballages sachets.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yvonne G., 42, is a native of Abomey, in the Zou in the center of Benin. She never went to school and, from the time she was a little girl, helped her mother transform palm nuts into red palm oil which they then sold. She went out on her own after she got married. She prepares and sells balls of porridge traditionally called "lio" made from maize. She also sells plastic bags. It is to bolster this business that she is requesting this loan of 120,000 F CFA; she intends to stock up on maize and plastic bags.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 2 sacks of maize and 6 cartons of bags of various sorts and colors

loans.name: Mujeres De Batalla Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres de Batalla" is a large group of men and women from an extremely poor area in the Dominican Republic. Each member of this group is hoping to receive a loan to increase the size of their business. Each member in this group has received a previous loan and some aR. on their 3rd or 4th while others aR. hoping for their 2nd. This group has businesses ranging from clothing stores to small grocery stores.

Maria V. B. is the representative of this group and and also a hardworking mother to 4 children, all under the age of 17. She has a lot to work for, and is a perfect example of this group. She was having a hard time providing for her children befoR. she started her own business, and had no steady income. She took out her first loan and started a small business making clothing. She was always a great seamstress and thought it would work well if she could use her skill in her business. She did very well with her first loan and has continued to increase her business. She said for the first time she feels like a provider and knows that she can take caR. of her children. She dreams of being a designer and have other people create her designs. She loves what she is doing and is excited to have something of her own for once. She is also praying that one day her children will all be able to go to college and enjoy a better life than she had. She is excited about what the futuR. hold for her, her family, and her business!

loans.use: Purchase of materials for clothing

loans.name: Olga

texts.fr: Dame A. Olga est née le 11/07/1963 à Grand - Popo dont elle est originaire. Elle alla à l'école jusqu'en classe de 5ème où elle fut forcée par sa tante à abandonner pour l'aider à faire le commerce d'articles de tout genre et de nourriture .Elle quittera par la suite sa tante et se mit à vendre une boisson locale à base de maïs appelée "TCHAKPALO" et ce , pour son propre compte. Elle apprit pour un peu de temps la couture .Mais comme  le manque de  moyens ne lui ont  pas permis d'avoir son diplôme de fin d'apprentissage , elle  retourna au commerce : elle achète du maïs en gros et revend  aux détaillants .En ce moment, elle est en rupture de stock et c'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt de 180000fcfa. Mariée à un ingenieur des mines,ZINSALO Stanislas, elle a 2 garçons : Boris et Ulrich.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga A. was born on July 11, 1963 in Grand-Popo, the town she hails from. She went to school up to 6th grade at which point her aunt forced her to leave her studies to help sell general merchandise and cooked food. Later she left her aunt and began independently to sell a local drink made from maize, called "tchakpalo".

She learned sewing for a little while, but since she did not have the financial means to continue up to her diploma as a seamstress, she returned to buying maize wholesale and re-selling it to retailers. At this time, she is out of maize and that is why she is requesting this third loan in the amount of 180,000 F CFA. Married to a mining engineer, Stanislas Zinsalo, she has two sons: Boris and Ulrich.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 8 lengths of "pagne" (African print cloth) and 5 dozen shoes

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: Née à Athiémé le 15/10/1962 de parents cultivateurs ,dame A. Béatrice n'a jamais été à l'école .Dès son enfance ,elle dut aider ses parents à cultiver la terre .Puis , elle se lança dans le petit commerce et se mit à vendre de l'igname frite avec des beignets de haricot..Ce qu'elle fit pendant 3 ans ,avant de changer d'activité pour commencer par vendre les noix d'acajou grillés.Mais actuellement ,elle n'exerce plus cette activité compte tenu du manque à gagner assez élevé et a préféré faire la vente de nourriture :riz accompagné de sauce graine avec poisson frit .C'est pour renforcer cette activité et la diversifier avec la vente d'huile végétale qu'elle a sollicité ce 3ème   prêt de 140000fcfa.Mariée ,elle a cinq enfants tous scolarisés.
texts.en:
Born in Athiémé on October 15, 1962 to parents who were farmers, Mrs. Béatrice A. was never able to go to school. From childhood on, she had to help her parents cultivate their earth. Then she went into petty commerce and began to sell fried yams with bean fritters. She did that for three years, before changing over to selling grilled cashews.

Presently, however, Béatrice is no longer in this business, since she was not able to earn enough money. She preferred to sell cooked food: rice accompanied by grain sauce with fried fish. It is to bolster this business and diversify it by selling vegetable oil that she is requesting this third loan of 140,000 F CFA. Married, she has 5 children, all enrolled in school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 5 jerry cans of 25 liters of vegetable oil and 4 sacks of rice

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
En el municipio de Chichigalpa de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora María del Rosario G. se dedica a laborar vendiendo turrones ambulantemente por las calles de su municipio.

Se ha destacado por ser esforzada en su negocio y debido a que es madre soltera y con un hijo que mantener, busca la forma de cómo brindarle las condiciones necesarias para su crecimiento y desarrollo de este hijo. Es importante destacar que la actividad a la que ella se dedica requiere de muchísimo esfuerzo y dedicación y por este motivo ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra del trigo y del dulce para elaborar los deliciosos turrones que comercializa día a día en su sector.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Chichigalpa in the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Maria del Rosario Gomez works selling turrones (a candy traditionally eaten at Christmas) walking through the streets of the town. She stands out for working very hard at her business and does so because she is a single with a son to take care of. She works to offer him the best possible conditions to grow and develop. It is important to highlight that her job requires a lot of effort and dedication which is why she has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan to purchase wheat and sugar in order to make the delicious candies that she sells everyday in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wheat and sugar

loans.name: Célestrine

texts.fr: Dame H. Célestrine , âgée de 33 ans.Elle est née à SO-AVA dont elle est originaire .Elle n'a pas eu la chance d'aller à l'école .Dès son jeune âge ,elle aidait sa mère dans la vente d'akassa (boule de pâte faite à base de maïs) ,accompagné de la sauce au poisson frais.Elle l'accompagnait également vendre de poissons fumés à gbadagri non loin de la frontière Benin-Nigeria.Après la naissance de son premier garçon :Roland,13 ans aujourd'hui et  en classe de CE1, elle s'est mise dans la vente de poissons fumés .Et c'est d'ailleurs pour le renforcement de cette activité,qu'elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt d'une durée de 08 mois.Mariée à AGBEKPONOU Luc,menuisier de formation,elle est mère de 04 enfants dont Florent le benjamin est âgé de 07 ans.Elle compte s'approvisionner uniquement en poissons frais.
texts.en:
Mrs. Célestrine H., 33, was born in So-Ava, where she comes from. She did not have the good fortune to attend school. Ever since she was a young girl, she helped her mother sell "akassa" (balls of porridge made of maize) accompanied by a sauce made with fresh fish. She also went with her mother to sell smoked fish in Gbadagri, not far from the border of Benin with Nigeria.

After the birth of her first son, Roland, presently 13 and in second grade, she began to sell smoked fish. And it is in fact with a view to bolstering this business that she is requesting this third loan with a term of 8 months. Married to Luc Agbekponou, a trained carpenter, she is the mother of 4 children, of whom the youngest, Florent, is 7. She intends to stock up only on fresh fish.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 6 cases of fresh fish

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y madre de 02 hijos. Estudió el quinto año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Sánchez Cerro Nº 125, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales” en Puno. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 aumentó su capital y compró galletas, gaseosas, gelatinas, etc., para su tiendita escolar. Antes  de comenzar con esta actividad económica se dedicaba a trabajar como Cosmetóloga en una Peluquería.

Actualmente continua vendiendo golosinas en un colegio secundario, en el cual atiende con mucha amabilidad.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará más mercadería como galletas, gaseosas, jugos, queques y otros.
 
Quisiera tener una tienda mayorista de venta de golosinas.
texts.en:
Estela is 39 years old, married, and the mother of two sons. She studied until the fifth year of secondary school, and lives on Sánchez Cerro Street in the Puno province. She is one of the founding members of the “Diana de Gales” cooperative bank. With her first loan of 300.00 soles, she increased her working capital and purchased cookies, sodas, jellos, etc. for her school store. Prior to starting with this activity, she worked as a cosmetologist at a beauty salon. Currently, she continues selling snacks at a secondary school and she tends carefully to her store. With this loan of 3,000.00 soles, to be repaid in four months, she will purchase merchandise such as cookies, sodas, juices, cakes, and other items. She would like to one day have a wholesale store for the sale of snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cookies, sodas, juices, cakes, and other items.

loans.name: Ana Isaura

texts.es:
La señora Ana Isaura se dedica a su labor de atención a su pulpería que ha logrado suplir desde hace 13 largos años con el apoyo de su familia compuesta por su esposo y por sus pequeños hijos en el municipio de Chichigalpa de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Es de mucha necesidad destacar que ella se ha perfilado como excelente cliente de Ceprodel por la razón de que ha realizado un total de 30 créditos y ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio habiendo suplido sus estantes cada vez que se requiere. Hoy en día una vez más espera que su crédito sea otorgado con el propósito de  compara la mercadería para su negocio. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado  a lo inmediato para proceder con su ardua labor en su municipio.
texts.en:
Ana Isaura dedicates herself to tending to her general store, which she has managed to supply for thirteen long years along with the help of her family which is composed of her husband and small children. It is located in the Chichigalpa municipality in the city of Chinandega. It is very necessary to highlight that she has proven to be an excellent client of Ceprodel’s for the reason that she has completed a total of 30 loans, and has managed to get ahead with her business. Today, she once more hopes that her loan request will be granted with the aim of purchasing more merchandise for her business. She hopes that she receives her loan quickly, so she can proceed with her hard work in her municipality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Solange

texts.fr: Dame B. Solange est née le 10/08/83 à Natitingou.Originaire de Dassa dans les collines du Benin. Elle fit les études primaires, secondaires et après son baccalauréat il y a deux ans, elle est aujourd'hui à l'Université d'Abomey Calavi. Parrallèlement à ses études elle a commencé en 2007 la vente des cartes de recharge pour les téléphones mobiles.Elle sollicite ce 2ème prêt de 130000f pour renforcer cette activité et la diversifier avec la vente de jouets qui est très rentable avec l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année. Elle est célibataire sans enfant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Solange B. was born on August 10, 1983 in Natitingou. She comes from Dassa in the hills of Benin. She attended primary and secondary school. After she graduated from high school two years ago, she began her studies at the University of Abomey Calavi. Alongside her studies, in 2007 she began selling rechargeable phone cards for cell phones. She is requesting this second loan in the amount of 130,000 F to bolster this little business and diversify it with the sale of toys which is very lucrative during the period of end-of-year festivities. She is single and has no children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 150 flash and 20 rechargeable cards for various networks, 1 case of toys for children

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva es una nueva socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 2 niños pequeños. Realizó sus estudios en el Instituto Superior  Pedagógico de Juli y vive en el Jr. Arequipa Nº 141, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará bordados y también bayeta y lana para continuar con su actividad. Su esposo trabaja junto con ella. 

Su deseo es tener su jaula de Truchas para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Eva is a new member of the cooperative bank “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli” (“Women of Juli for Progress”). She is 32 years old, has a partner, and is the mother of two young children. She completed her studies at the Superior Pedagogical Institute of Juli and lives on Arequipa Street in the Juli district, located in the province of Chuchito in Puno. With this loan of 500.00 soles, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy embroideries as well as fabric and yarn to continue with her activities. Her husband works alongside her. Her wish is to have a trout cage to improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase embroideries, fabric and yarn.

loans.name: Simone

texts.fr: Dame B. Simone est née le 28/10/1976 à Natitingou.Originaire de DASSA dans les Collines.Elle a fréquenté jusqu'en classe de 5ème .Sur l'insistance de son père ,elle alla en apprentissage de couture .Ceci pendant  4 années.Elle eut son diplôme de fin de formation  en 1998 et exerça le métier de couture pendant 2 ans. Elle laissa le métier et s'est mise dans la vente de divers articles d'alimentation générale : liqueurs,les produits de toilette. Depuis 1 an ,elle a développé son activité et fait aussi la vente de : mèches, pommades et défrisants pour cheveux,chaussures pour hommes-dames,les sacs,les tenues d'enfant et autres menus articles. En vue de renforcer son activité, elle sollicite ce 2ème prêt de 200000f et compte s'approvisionner en mèches, perruques, défriants-cheveux,pommades, et chaussures.Elle est mariée et a une fille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Simone B. was born on October 28, 1976 in Natitingou. She comes from Dassa in the Hills. She attended school up to grade 7. Her father insisted that she apprentice herself to a seamstress. She remained there for 4 years and got her diploma at the end of her course in 1998, then worked as a seamstress for two years.

She left this trade and began to sell general merchandise: liquors, toiletries. One year ago she expanded her business to include the sale of: hair extensions, pomades and hair straighteners, men's and women's shoes, handbags, children's outfits, and other small articles. With a view to bolstering her business, she is requesting this second loan in the amount of 200,000 F CFA. She intends to buy hair extensions, wigs, hair-straighteners, pomades, and shoes. She is married and has one son.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 1 dozen synthetic wigs, 3 dozen hair extensions, 5 dozen hair pieces, 1 dozen hair pomades

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es separada y madre de 2 hijos. Estudió el quinto año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Palomani Nº 192, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales” en Puno. El primer préstamo de S/. 300 lo invirtió en la compra de ingredientes para preparar sándwiches y tortas. A los 8 años empezó a trabajar ayudando a su mamá a vender refrescos y café en Desaguadero, ello la ayudó a que ella pueda iniciar su negocio, ahora vende golosinas, galletas, gaseosas y sándwiches en la tiendita escolar que tiene.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará más productos para su tienda.

Su deseo es terminar de construir su casa y seguir mejorando su negocio
texts.en:
Gloria is separated and the mother of two children. She studied to the fifth year of secondary school, and lives on Palomani Street in the Puno province. She is one of the founding members of the “Diana de Gales” cooperative bank in Puno. She invested her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles into the purchase of ingredients for making her sandwiches and cakes. She started working at the age of eight, helping her mother sell refreshments and tend to a café in Desaguadero. This helped her start her own business and, today, she sells snacks, cookies, sodas, and sandwiches at the school snack store that she has. With this loan of 3,000.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in four months, she will purchase more products for her store. Her dream is to finish building her house, and to continue improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products for her store.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Doña Hilaria tiene 50 años de edad, estudió el segundo año de primaria, es casada, madre de 7 hijos y vive en el Jr. Chua Chua Nº 880, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, desde hace 6 años con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró alimentos balanceados para la Crianza de Truchas, negocio que comenzó antes de ingresar al Banco y con el que sigue trabajando para pagar puntualmente su préstamo, al mismo tiempos se dedica a la artesanía.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará alimentos para truchas.

Su único deseo es salir adelante con su negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Hilaria is 50 years old, studied to the second grade, is married and the mother of seven children. She lives on Chua Chua Street in the Juli district, located in the Chuchito province of Puno. She is a founding member of the cooperative bank “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli” (“Women of Juli for Progress”), with whom she has worked for six years. With her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles, she purchased feed for raising trout -- a business she was involved in prior to joining the bank. She continues working in this arena to be able to pay her loan installments in a timely manner and, concurrently, dedicates herself to producing handmade crafts. With this loan of 1,000.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will buy trout feed. Her only wishes are to get ahead in her business and to improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed for her trout.

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: Dame A. Juliette est née le 30/07/1974 d'un père ,agent de l'ASECNA (agence panafricaine de gestion du transport aérien) et d'une mère ,revendeuse de maïs, elle est originaire de d'AZOVE dans le département du COUFFO.Elle fréquenta jusqu'au CM2 et elle abandonna suite à la grève générale  qui paralysa le système éducatif béninois en 1989. Elle apprit à faire la couture et eut son diplôme de fin de formation en 1999.Elle s'installa à son propre compte pour exercer son métier dans un atelier de couture.Parallèlement à son métier ,elle fait de petit commerce .C'est pourquoi elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt de 120000fcfa pour s'approvisionner en pagne et chaussures .Mariée ,elle a 2 enfants Géronime et Jean Didi
texts.en:
Mrs. Juliette A. was born on July 30, 1974 to a father who worked for ASECNA (the Pan-African air traffic control agency) and a mother who sold maize (corn). She comes from Azove in the county of Couffo. She went to school up to grade 5 and left off because of the general strike which paralyzed the Benin education system in 1989.

Juliette learned to be a seamstress and obtained her diploma at the end of her studies in 1999. She set herself up to work in her chosen field in a little workshop. At the same time, she sells odds and ends. This is why she is requesting this third loan of 120,000 F CFA to stock up on "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored cloth used to make clothing, turbans, and to carry babies) and shoes. Married, she has two children: Géronime and Jean Didi.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying 8 lengths of "pagnes" and 5 dozen pairs of shoes

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr: Native et originaire de Tori  Bossito dans la commune d'Abomey-Calavi de parents cultivateurs, dame T. Albertine n'eut pas la chance  d'aller à l'école. Elle fut initiée très tôt par sa grande sœur défunte à la vente de maïs ,gari,et condiments.A son propre compte ,elle continue avec la même activité , en y  ajouta la vente d'igname .Il y a cinq mois qu'elle a commencé par vendre de l'igname frite avec des beignets de haricots.C'est pour renforcer son étalage de condiments, et de vente de maïs et gari qu'elle a sollicité ce prêt de 150000f. Mariée à un mécanicien auto,AMOUSSOU OKE Mathieu,elle a 3 enfants.
texts.en:
Born and raised in Tori Bossito in the township of Abomey-Calavi in a farming family, Mrs. Albertine T. did not have the good fortune to be able to go to school. Her older sister, now deceased, taught her how to sell corn (maize), gari (cassava flour), and condiments at a young age. She continued this business on her own account, adding the sale of coco yams.

Five months ago, she began to sell fried yams with bean fritters. She is requesting this loan of 150,000 F CFA to diversify her stock of condiments and reinforce her sales of corn and gari by buying 2 jerry cans of oil, 1 basket of coco yams, 1/2 sack of dried beans, 4 baskets of tomatoes, 5 boxes of Maggi cubes, and 1/2 sack of onions. Married to an auto-mechanic, Mathieu Amoussou Oke, she has 3 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying 2 jerry cans of 25 liters of vegetable oil, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La señora Desusa, desde aproximadamente 5 años, es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno. Es casada y madre de 04 hijos, 2 de ellos mayores y con familia y 2 estudian. Su esposo trabaja en la Pesca, en el Muelle de Juli. 

Al inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 300, compró bayeta y lana para su negocio de bordados. Actualmente se dedica a la actividad de bordadura y al mismo tiempo trabaja en la Pesca (truchas, pejerrey, etc.). Empezó con esta actividad desde los 12 años de edad.

Con este préstamo de S/.700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará bayeta, lana y también redes para la pesca.

Su deseo es obtener más ganancias para lograr comprarse un bote.
texts.en:
Desusa has a member of the communal bank "Mujeres al Progreso de Juli" en Juli District, Chuchito Province, Puno Department, for approximately 5 years. She is married and a mother of 4 children, 2 of whom are adults with their own families, while the other 2 are students. Her husband works in the fishing industry at the Juli wharf. At the beginning, with a loan of 300 Nuevo Soles, she bought cloth and wool for her embroideries. Currently, she continues to embroider and at the same time works in the fishing industry (trout, silver smelt, etc). She started this activity at the age of 12. With this loan of 700 Nuevo Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy cloth, wool as well as nets for fishing. Her wish is to increase her income to be able to purchase a boat.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cloth and wool for embroidering, as well as nets for fishing

loans.name: Cica

texts.fr: Originaire de Ouidah, dame D. Cica a été à l'école juqu'en classe de CE1.Après avoir abandonné,elle aida sa maman à vendre de la bouillie faite à base de farine de maïs .Puis à son propre compte,elle s'est  mise à vendre du pain et de la nourriture:mélange de riz et haricot cuit accompagné de friture communément appelé"Atassi".Mais elle a fini par préférer la vente de pain et cessa de vendre du ""atassi".Par ailleurs,elle y a ajouté la vente d'huile végétale pour la cuisson.C'est pour renforcer son activité qu'elle sollicite ce prêt de 120000fcfa.Mariée, elle a 6 enfants dont le dernier  Blanchard Samuel est un nourrisson de 5 mois
texts.en:
Born in Ouidah, Mrs. Cica Dodnon went to school for only two years. After leaving school, she helped her mother sell maize porridge. Then, on her own account, she began to sell bread and cooked food: a mixture of rice and beans accompanied by fries, commonly called "atassi". But she preferred selling bread and so finally stopped selling "atassi". She added the sale of vegetable oil for cooking. She is requesting this loan of 120,000 F CFA to bolster her business. Married, she has 6 children, of whom the youngest, Blanchard Samuel, is only 5 months old.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 7 jerry cans of 25 liters of oil

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La señora Judith tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y madre de 6 hijos. Estudió el tercer año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Libertad Nº 927, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales” en Puno. Al inicio con el primer préstamo de S/.300, compró inciensos, hoja de coca, vino, velas, etc. 

Judith empezó a trabajar hace mucho tiempo porque el dinero que su esposo le daba no le alcanzaba y tenia que apoyar a sus hijos. Actualmente sigue con este negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará incienso, mixtura, fósforos, carbón y juegos artificiales para las fiestas navideñas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Judith is 55 years old, she is married and the mother of 6 children. She completed her third year in secondary school and lives in Jr. Libertad #927, district, province and department of Puno, Peru. Mrs. Judith is a founding partner of the Banco Comunal "Diana de Gales" in Puno. With her first loan of 300 nuevo soles she bought incense, coca leaves, wine, candles, ect. Judith began to work a long time ago because the money from her husband was not enough to sustain her children. Today she continues to work in this business. The loan of 2,500 nuevos soles will be paid in four months and will be put towards buying incense, mixture, matches, coal and fire works for the Christmas celebrations.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Hidalgo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy incense, mixture, matches, coal and fire works.

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr: Née vers 1977 à Godomey dans la commune urbaine d'Abomey-Calavi, dame A. Sylvie eut un bref cursus scolaire jusqu'en classe de CE1. Elle fut enlevée  et amenée au Nigéria par un escroc où elle fut employée par une revendeuse de pagnes et tissus. Elle resta en captivité pendant 5 ans avant d'être retrouvée par ses parents et ramenée au Bénin. Après son retour, elle commença par faire le petit commerce grâce à son père: vente savons, conserves de sardines, sucre, etc. Elle va finir par y renoncer et se mit à vendre des friperies et ce, depuis 15 ans. Aujourd'hui elle a un fonds de roulement d'environ 200000 francs CFA. Mais cela ne lui permet pas de satisfaire au mieux sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi elle sollicite ce deuxième crédit de 100000 francs CFA pour consolider son capital. Mariée, elle a deux enfants: Enoch et Gédéon.
texts.en:
Born around 1977 in Godomey in the town of Abomey-Calavi, Mrs. Sylvie A. attended school briefly, up to the second grade. She was kidnapped and taken to Nigeria by a crook and there she had to work for a "pagne" (lengths of brightly colored African cloth) and cloth seller. She remained in captivity for 5 years before being found by her parents and brought back to Benin.

After her return, she began by selling small items, thanks to her father's help: soaps, tins of sardines, sugar, etc. She gave this up and began to sell used clothing 15 years ago. Today, she has a working capital of about 200,000 F CFA. But this does not allow her to completely satisfy her clientele's needs. That is why she is requesting this, her second loan of 100,000 F CFA so as to consolidate her capital. Married, she has two children: Enoch and Gédéon. d

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying 1/2 bale of used clothing of various types

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia, desde hace 6 años, es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al progreso de Juli”. Estudió el cuarto grado de Primaria, es casada, madre de 9 hijos y vive en la Comunidad de Vilcallami, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Con el primer préstamo de S/.300 que recibió, compró lana y bayeta para bordados. 

Compra y vende artesanía (bordados) para llevar a Puno, al mismo tiempo se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. Hoy sigue con la misma actividad económica. 

Con este préstamo de S/.600, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará lana y bayeta, también invertirá en la crianza de pollos.

Su único deseo es seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia has been a member of the "Mujeres al progreso de Juli" communal bank for 6 years. She studied until the fourth grade, is married and a mother of 9 children. She lives in the community of Vilcallami, Juli district, Chuchito Province, in the department of Puno. With her first loan of 300 Nuevo Soles she purchased wool and cloth for embroideries. She buys and sells handicrafts (embroideries) to take to Puno and also works raising baby animals. With this loan of 600 Nuevo Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase wool and cloth. She will also invest in raising chickens. Her only desire is to continue ahead with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool and cloth for embroideries, as well as investing in raising chickens

loans.name: Brikissou
