texts.fr: Née le 20/01/1975 à Kétou dont elle est originaire ,dame I. Brikissou fréquenta jusqu'en classe de 4ème où elle décida volontairement d'arrêter .Elle commença par vendre dans une cabine téléphonique des cartes de recharge .Puis peu à peu elle se mit à vendre des produits cosmétiques de tout genre auquel elle ajouta plus tard la vente des mèches .Aujourd'hui elle dispose d'une boutique pour mener son activité.C'est pour augmenter son capital qu'elle sollicite ce 1er prêt de 100000fcfa.Elle compte ainsi mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.Mariée à FADEYI Séraphin, brodeur de formation, elle a 1 enfant: Primous
texts.en:
Born on January 20, 1975 in Kétou where she comes from, Mrs. Brikissou I. went to school up to the 6th grade at which point she decided to stop her studies. She began selling rechargeable telephone cards in a telephone booth. Then, little by little, she began to sell cosmetics of all sorts, and later on also hair extensions. Today, she has a little shop for her busines. She is requesting this first loan of 100,000 F CFA to add to her working capital. She believes that will allow her to better respond to the needs of her clientele. Married to Séraphin Fadeyi, a professional embroiderer, she has one child, Primous.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying 5 cartons of various cosmetic products

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest B. is 30 years old. He is single with one kid who is currently in school. Ernest is a dealer in mobile phones and accessories. He also provides repairs and servicing works for his customers. He says the sale of mobile phone has become a very lucrative business in Ghana because almost every Ghanaian desires to possess a mobile phone for easy and fast communication.

He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He requests the loan to enable him procure a stock of mobile phone and accessories. He hopes the loan would enable him to increase savings to expand his shop to include the sale of iPods and digital cameras. He belongs to the community group called Vibrant Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. He does not sell on group meeting days and his picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Kwasi

texts.en:
B. Kwasi is twenty-eight years old. He is married with one kid who is currently in school. B. has been a dealer in electrical and electronic parts like televisions, sound systems, speakers, cables, transmitters, screw drivers, electric fans, etc. for six years now. He also provides repairs and servicing works for his customers. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells them to his customers at retail prices. He requests the loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes the loan will enable him to increase his savings to expand his shop to include refrigerators, and other logistics to facilitate his business growth.

B. would be so glad for your support.

He belongs to the community group called Vibrant Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. He does not sell on group meeting days and his picture was taken during his group meeting.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of electrical and electronic gadgets and parts.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine A., a 52-year-old trader, is married with four children. One child is currently in school while the rest are currently dependent. She is a very resourceful wife and mother whose hard work brings livelihood to the family. 

Celestine supports her husband in providing for the household through the sale of used clothing. Selling used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand new cloths are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore, selling used clothing has created a market for many women. 

She has been in this business for the past 17 years. Presently, she still sells through hawking and has been walking through the scorching sun all day to make ends meet. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used things in order to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s future and also to rent a store to trade in. 

She is member of the group called Vibrant. Members agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy increased bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida A. is 46 years old. She is divorced with four children. As the mother, part of the family responsibility for the kids rests on her shoulders. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, bottled water, boxes of body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, and the like. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more inventory. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for the children’s education. 

Vida belongs to the community group called Vibrant Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral for the loan and support one another in repaying the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting. 

She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Robert Kennedy

texts.en:
Robert Kennedy S. is a teacher for young students. He operates a game shop where kids come to play TV games such as soccer, Nintendo, boxing, etc., in his neighborhood during their vacation and leisure period. He started his operation two years ago. 

He is a 39-year-old father of three kids who are currently in school. In addition to the TV games, he also operates a gift shop and sells items like love cards & success cards. Interestingly, he runs these business concurrently.  With his good customer service many clients comes there to play games during their leisure time. 

With the loan, Robert wants to buy more gifts cards to increase his stock so that he can make additional income to sustain the other area of his business. He also hopes to increase his savings to provide his kids with a quality education, as a teacher acknowledging the importance of education. He would appreciate the assistance very much. 

He is a member of the group called Vibrant Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another in repaying the loan. His picture was taking when he was visited.

loans.use: To buy gifts shop items like love cards & success cards and other game equipment, etc.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es: Benedicta tiene 35 años, es soltera, vive sola en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de hoja de coca, para su uso en diferentes momentos, como  medicinal, para dárselo a los turistas contra el soroche y mareo, para que la gente lo adquiera para realizar el conocido pago a la tierra, entre otras costumbres de la región. La venta es buena, ya que este tipo de eventos son muy realizados en la cosmovisión andina, lo más difícil de su venta es tener que comprarla, ya que siempre se presentan inconvenientes por sus otros nexos ilegales. Este es 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de hojas de coca para venderlas en este mes de diciembre, ya que por estas fechas se realizan los pagos a la tierra.
texts.en:
Benedicta is 35 years old, single, and lives alone in a house left to her by her parents. She sells coca leaves which are used in a variety of ways: medicinal, selling to tourists as a remedy against altitude and motion sickness, to people who buy it to do tribute to the earth among other customs of the region. Sales are good as these types of events are very common in the Andean beliefs, and the most difficult part of the sales is having to buy the leaves, as they can be difficult to find because of their other illegal uses. This is her 9th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she will buy a large quantity of coca leaves to sell during the month of December, as during this time of year people make tributes to the earth.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a large quantity of coca leaf to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 46 años, vive sola, ya que está divorciada y no tuvo hijos. Se dedica a la venta D. calzados en uno D. los mercados más conocidos D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, el Mercado Tupac Amaru, desD. hace 20 años. Lo que le gusta a Elsa D. su trabajo es vender, ella siempre se ha destacado por tener poder D. convencimiento, lo cual le ayuda mucho en la venta. Las ventas, gracias a que la ubicación D. su puesto es muy buena, son muy buenas, haciéndole pensar en agrandar su negocio. Lo más difícil D. su trabajo es tener que permanecer en su trabajo durante varias horas al día, y pasar el frió que suele hacer en esta temporada. Este es su 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad D. mercadería para vender en época naviD.ña.
texts.en:
Elsa is 46 years old, lives alone, as she is divorced and does not have children. She has been selling shoes for 20 years in one of the most well-known markets in Juliaca, Tupca Amaru market. What Elsa likes about her job is selling. She has always stood out for having the ability to convince others, which has helped her a lot in sales. Thanks to the good location of her stall her sales are very good, leading her to consider expanding her business. The difficult part of her work is having to remain at work during various hours of the day and the cold weather of this season. This is her 9th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been punctual with her payments. With the money she will buy a large quantity of merchandise to sell in the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a large quantity of merchandise to sell

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: Emiliana tiene 55 años, es viuda, vive con su hija Benedicta D. 35 años, con la cual trabaja en la venta D. hoja D. coca. Ella se ha venido dedicando desD. hace  40 años a la venta D. hoja D. coca, para poder solventar los gastos D. su familia, lamentablemente quedó viuda hace algunos años y ahora trabaja para llenar ese vació y sentirse útil. A Emiliana le gusta mucho su trabajo, es por eso que le dedica tanta atención a realizarlo, haciendo que crezca poco a poco durante estos largos años. Las ventas son muy buenas, ya que la hoja D. coca, como es sabido, tiene bastantes propiedades medicinales y en la ciudad D. Puno es muy utilizada para la elaboración D. mates, que se les brinda a los turistas afectados por la altura, además D. su consumo a la hora D. elaborar los cultivos, en la lectura D. la suerte y demás. Este es su 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad D. costales D. hoja D. coca para vender en los meses D. diciembre y enero.
texts.en:
Emiliana is 55 years old, a widow, and lives with her 35 year old daughter Benedicta, with whom she works selling coca leaf. She has been selling coca leaf for 40 years so she can meet her family’s expenses. Sadly she was left widowed a few years ago and now she works to fill this emptiness and feel useful. Emiliana really likes her work, and that is why she spends so much time at her work, making it grow over these longs years. Sales are very good, as coca leaf has rather unique medicinal properties and in the city of Puno it is used to make tea provided to the tourists affected by the altituD., and at the time of cultivating it is used in fortune telling and other uses. This is her 9th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she will buy a large quantity of sacks of coca leaf to sell during the months of December and January.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of coca leaf to sell

loans.name: Fany

texts.es: Fany tiene 29 años, es soltera y vive sola. Se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas en su pequeña tienda que implementó hace 6 años. Fany siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora y todos los esfuerzos que ella hace son para forjarse un mejor porvenir, pensando en conformar una familia más adelante. La venta es muy buena, ya que con su carisma se gana a la clientela, logrando que regresen a su negocio. Fany no le encuentra dificultad a su trabajo, más todo lo contrario, se siente muy feliz realizándolo. Este es su 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de bebidas para incrementar sus ingresos económicos y así realizar todas sus metas.
texts.en:
Fany is 29 years old, single, and lives alone. She dedicates herself to selling sodas in her small store which she started six years ago. Fany has always been a very hard-working woman, and all the efforts she puts forth are so she can forge a better future for herself, with thoughts of starting a family going forward. Sales are very good, since her charisma attracts customers who help her business to grow. Fany doesn’t have any difficulties with her work, on the contrary, she feels very happy realizing it. This is her 9th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very punctual with her payments. She will use the requested funds to purchase a greater quantity of beverages to increase her income and in that way make her goals a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more beverages to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 29 años, es soltera, vive sola ya que no tuvo hijos. Se dedica a la venta de productos por campaña, vende según la ocasión, por ejemplo ahora que se viene la época navideña, venderá todo tipo de adornos navideños que suelen ser muy demandados en estas épocas. Lo que le gusta a Luz Delia de su trabajo es el tener que variar cada vez en la venta, ya que vender solo una tipo de producto se le hace rutinario. Pero las cosas no son siempre buenas, ya que algunas veces las ventas descienden en algunas temporadas, pero Luz sigue motivada con el  pensamiento de triunfar y salir adelante. Este es su 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará gran cantidad de adornos navideños para vender en esta época.
texts.en:
Luz is 29 years old, single, and lives alone since she never had children. She dedicates herself to selling seasonal products based on the occasion. For example, now that it is the Christmas season, she will sell all types of decorations that are in high demand during this time. What Luz Delia likes about her work is the need to vary her products each time, since selling only one type of merchandise gets redundant. However, things don’t always go well, such as when sales go down some seasons. However, Luz continues being motivated with thoughts of triumphing and getting ahead. This is her 9th loan with Microfinazas Prisma. She will use the requested funds to purchase a large quantity of Christmas decorations to sell during the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase Christmas decorations to offer for sale.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela tiene 36 años, es madre soltera de una niña de 12 años llamada Ana. Se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades, las cuales vende por campaña, vende gran cantidad de adornos, muñecos, etc., para mantener a su pequeña, la cual es su motivo de vivir. El trabajo de Mariela es muy dedicado, trabaja durante todo el día, si no está realizando sus manualidades, las está vendiendo en su pequeño puesto que tiene en el mercado Tupac Amaru de la ciudad de Juliaca. Lo de su labor es confeccionar las manualidades, debido a que muchas de ellas requieren gran paciencia y dedicación, y a veces ella no puede hacerlo sola cuando son grandes cantidades. Este es su 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará gran cantidad de material para realizar adornos navideños, ya que en estas fechas salen muy a cuenta y así poder aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mariela is 36 years old and the single mother of a 12-year old daughter named Ana. She dedicates herself to producing seasonal handmade crafts to sell. She sells a large quantity of decorations, dolls, etc., to support her child who is her reason for being. Mariela’s work requires a great deal of dedication, and she works throughout the day. If she is not making her crafts, she is selling them at her small stall in the Tupac Amaru market located in the city of Juliaca. Her labors require a great deal of patience and dedication and, at times, she cannot make large quantities of them working alone. This is her 9th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been very punctual with her payments. With the funds requested, she will purchase a large quantity of materials to make Christmas decorations. They are in high demand during this season, which gives her an opportunity to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for making Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 48 años, es soltera y vive de forma independiente. Se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas, cerveza, etc., para solventar sus gastos económicos, ella realiza esta actividad desde hace 35 años, teniendo mucha experiencia en la venta. A Paulina le gusta su trabajo, porque le resulta muy rentable, y ya está pensando en implementar otro tipo de negocio adicional, como un restaurante, pero para esto debe crecer mucho más en su actual negocio, es por eso que Paulina recurre a nuestra ayuda. Este es su 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita podrá comprar mayor cantidad de bebidas para implementar mucho más su tienda.
texts.en:
Paulina is 48 years old. She is single and she is an independent woman. She sells soda drinks, beer, etc. in order to pay her economic expenses. She has been doing this activity for 35 year; therefore she has a lot of experience in sales. Paulina likes her work, because it quite profitable. She is already thinking of implementing another additional business, such as a restaurant, but first she must make her current business grow more. That's why Paulina is asking for your help. This is her 9th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been very punctual with the payments. She will be able to buy a bigger quantity of drinks to have a better stocked shop with the money that she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 28 años, es soltera, vive sola ya que no tuvo hijos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde que terminó la secundaria se ha dedicado al trabajo, es así que desde hace 8 años incursionó en el negocio de la venta por campaña, siendo este un negocio muy rentable, ya que Silvia, según la temporada, percibe los productos que pueden tener mayor demanda. Lo difícil es conseguir la mercadería y viajar constantemente, pero Silvia ya se ha acostumbrado a estos trotes, ya que lo que ella más desea es prosperar en su negocio. Este es su 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para vender en esta época de navidad.
texts.en:
Silvia is 28 years old. She is single and lives alone since she doesn't have any children. She is a very hard-working woman and she has been working since she finished middle school. She started a business of seasonal sales 8 years ago; a very profitable business, since Silvia gets the products that have the biggest demand according to the season. The most difficult part is to obtain the merchandise and to travel constantly, but Silvia has already got accustomed to these routine; since her biggest wish to make her business prosper. This is her 9th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, she has been very punctual with the payments. She plans to buy a larger quantity of merchandise to sell at this Christmas season with the requested money.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Have a larger variety of products to sell.

loans.name: Karen Nelida

texts.es:
Karen es soltera, tiene 20 años de edad, estudia la carrera de Turismo en la Universidad Nacional del Altiplano y vive en la Urbanización Totorani del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales” en Puno. Su primer préstamo de S/. 300 lo invirtió en la compra de artículos de dormitorio como colchas, edredones, sabanas y otros. A los 14 años empezó con este negocio en el cual le ha ido bien. Trae sus productos de Desaguadero y Tacna para venderlos en su puesto del Mercado Bellavista.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará más mercadería para las fiestas navideñas.

Su deseo es hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Karen is single. She is 20 years old and she is studying the career of Tourism at the National University del Altiplano and she lives in the Urban development called Totorani in the district, province and department of Puno. She is a partner of Communal Bank "Diana de Gales “ in Puno. Her first loan of $95 was invested to buy articles for the bed such as bedspreads, comforters, sheets and others. She started this business at the age of 14 and she has done quite well. Se brings her products from the city of Desaguadero y Tacna to sell them in her stand at the Bellavista Market. With this loan of $550 which will be repay over a period of 4 months, she will buy more merchandise for the Christmas holidays. Her desire is to make her business grow and increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise for the Christmas holidays.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Doña Margarita tiene 75 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 5 hijos que tienen familia. Vive en la Av. Circunvalación Nº 1347, distrito, provincia y departamento D. Puno.

Es socia del Banco “Diana D. Gales” en Puno desD. hace 6 años aproximadamente. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300 aumentó su capital y compró cereales como trigo, chuño, papa, maíz. Empezó con este negocio a los 50 años D. edad y trabajó durante muchos años con la venta D. cereales, después D. un cierto tiempo cambio D. negocio por su edad resultándole muy  difícil. 

Actualmente se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes como fideos, azúcar, galletas, gaseosas, etc., los cuales venD. en diferentes lugares D. Puno.

Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará galletas, aceite, fideos, gaseosas, etc.

Margarita desea seguir trabajando con su negocio hasta donD. pueda.
texts.en:
Mrs Margarita is 75 years old, she is married and a mother of 5 children who already have family. She lives in the Av. Beltway 1347, district, province and department of Puno. She has been a partner of the “Diana D. Gales“ Bank for approximately 6 years. With the first loan of $300, she increased her capital and bought cereals such as wheat, freeze-dried potato, corn. She began this business when she was 50 years old and worked selling cereals for many years, after a certain time she changed businesses because of her age it was becoming quite difficult. At present, she sells groceries such as noodles, sugar, cookies, sodas, etc., which she sells in different areas of Puno. With this loan of $650, which will be repaid over a period of 4 months, she will buy cookies, oil, noodles, soda drinks, etc. Daisy wants to keep on working with her business as long as she can handle it.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cookies, oil, pasta and soda drinks, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, 3 con familia y uno que vive con ella. Estudió el segundo grado de Primaria y vive en el Jr. Daniel Alcides Carrión  s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos compró materiales para bordados en bayeta. A la edad de 20 años empezó a realizar negocio, traía productos de limpieza y los llevaba a Puno, y al mismo tiempo seguía haciendo trabajos de Artesanía, negocio al que actualmente se dedica.

Con este préstamo de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 2 kg. de lana y 20 metros de bayeta para seguir confeccionando bordados.

Su mayor deseo es que su hijo sea profesional y al mismo tiempo abrir una Ferretería.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 48 years old, she is a single mother of 4 children. Three of them already have a family and one still lives with her. She studied until the second year of alementary and she lives in Daniel Alcides Carrión street, district of Juli, Chucuito province in the department of Puno. With the first loan of $100 that she received from Manuela Ramos she bought materials for embroideries in baize. She started doing business at age 20, she was bringing cleaning products and taking them to Puno and at the same time she kept on doing handycrafts which is business she is doing at present. With this loan of $100 which will be repaid over a period of 4 months, she will buy 2 kg of wool and 20 meters of baize to keep on making embroideries. Her biggest desire is that her son becomes a professional and at the same time, he can open a Hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará dos kg. de lana y 20 mts. de bayeta.

loans.name: Nancy Adelaida

texts.es:
Nancy es soltera, tiene 27 años de edad, estudió el quinto año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Lima s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró bayetas y lana. Desde muy pequeña aprendió a bordar, lo cual le ayudó a tener un capital y así poder vender su artesanía en Puno. 

Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará 2kg. de lana y 20 metros de bayeta.

Su sueño es tener más mercadería y un puesto seguro donde vender su artesanía.
texts.en:
Nancy is single and she is 27 years old. She studied until the fifth year of secondary school and she lives in Lima, district of Juli, of the province of Chuchito, in the department Puno. She is a founder partner of Communal Bank " Mujeres al Progreso de Juli ". With the first loan of $100, she bought baize and wool. She learned to embroider from a very early age, which helped her to have a small capital and be able to sell her crafts in Puno. With this loan of $175, which will be repaid over a period of 4 months, she will buy 2 kg of wool and 20 meters of baize. Her dream is to have more merchandise and a stable place where to sell her crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 2 kg. of wool and 20 mts of baize.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Triunfo (“Triumph”) Village Bank. Juana is 50 years old and is married with four children. She and her family own a leather workshop, where they make horseback riding equipment and accessories like saddles and bridles, as well as a variety of other products. Juana both works and sells from home. Juana needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy leather and old coins, which she uses to make some of the accessories. Juana’s dreams are to expand her business and for her children to grow up to be working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo. Juana es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Juana junto a su familia tienen una talabartería en donde confeccionan accesorios para caballos como trenzados, monturas, entre otros productos, el taller y las ventas lo realizan en su domicilio. Juana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de monedas y cuero. Los sueños de Juana son ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Buy old coins and leather to make horseback riding equipment/accessories

loans.name: Rosario Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo, estudió Enfermería Técnica y vive en el Jr. Bolognesi Nº 597, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales” en Puno. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300, compró peluches. También se dedica a preparar viandas en el comedor popular del Barrio Huajsapata y los días sábados continua vendiendo artículos de regalo como peluches, juguetes, etc. en la Av. Simón Bolívar.

Con este préstamo de S/.900, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará mixtura, productos artificiales, incienso y más peluches.

Su deseo es mejorar sus ganancias y tener más mercadería.
texts.en:
Rosario is 42 years old, is a single mother of one son, studied Nursing, and lives at Jr. Bolognesi Nº 597 in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is a member of the community bank "Diana de Gales" in Puno. With the first loan of 300 Soles, she bought cuddle toys. She is also dedicated to preparing popular food in the Neighborhood Huajsapata and on Saturdays continues selling gift articles like cuddle toys, games, etc. on the Av. Simón Bolívar. With this loan of 900 Soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy variety toys, artificial products, incenses, and more cuddly toys. Her desire is to improve her earnings and have more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy variety toys, artificial products, incenses, and more cuddly toys

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth es  socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, vive en el Jr. Lima Nº 523, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno. Es conviviente, madre de 2 hijos y estudió el quinto año de secundaria. 

Con el primer préstamo de S/.300 compró arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, etc. para su tienda de abarrotes, negocio que inició a los 28 años. En la actualidad continua en este rubro.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más mercadería como gaseosas, jugos, frutas, galletas, arroz, azúcar, etc.

Su deseo es salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the community bank "Mujeres al Progreso de Juli" and lives at Jr. Lima Nº 523, district of Juli, province of Chuchito, department of Puno. She is married, mother of two children, and studied up to the fifth year of secondary school. With the first loan of 300 soles, she bought rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc. for her grocery store, a business that she began at age 28. Presently she continues in this area. With this loan of 1200 soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy more merchandise like sodas, juices, fruits, cookies, rice, sugar, etc. Her desire is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará gaseosas, jugos, frutas, galletas, arroz, azúcar, etc.

loans.name: Sonia Antonieta

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 58 años de edad, estudió el quinto año de secundaria, es casada, madre de 6 hijos, 5 de ellos mayores y con familia y una hija que está con ella, y vive en la Av. Circunvalación 192 del Barrio Mañazo, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales” en Puno. En un inicio, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 lo invirtió en la compra de papa, anteriormente se dedicaba al pelado de papa para repartir a las pollerías y a los carritos salchipaperos. Este trabajo le resultaba muy cansado por su edad así que cambió de actividad. 

La señora Sonia ahora vende salchipapas, tallarín con pollo, hamburguesas en su casa y al mismo tiempo atiende en su tienda de Abarrotes.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará papa, salchicha, pollo y otros insumos para su negocio.

Su gran deseo es hacer crecer su negocio y cambiar a otro que no le de mucho trabajo.
texts.en:
Sonia is 58 years old and studied until the fifth year of secondary school. She is married and a mother of six children; five of them are older and have families and one of her daughters still lives with her. She lives at Av. Circunvalación 192 of the neighborhood Mañazo in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is one of the founding members of the community bank "Diana de Gales" in Puno. At the beginning with the first loan of 300 soles, she invested it in purchasing potatoes. Previously she was dedicated to the peeling of potatoes to deliver to the poultry stores and to the salchipapa (a Peruvian dish - french fries with sausage, condiments, and toppings) carts. This job made her very tired in her age so she changed activities. Señora Sonia now sells salchipapas, noodles with chicken, and hamburgers in her home and at the same time manages her grocery store. With this loan for 1500 soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy potatoes, sausages, chicken, and other ingredients for her business. Her grand desire is to make her business grow and change to another one that is less work for her.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes, sausages, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Virginia Aurelia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia, desde hace 6 años, pertenece y es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales”. Tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, madre de 2 hijos y vive en el Jr. Cutimbo Nº 190, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Al inicio, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300, aumentó su mercadería comprando textos de lectura de distintos autores. Se dedica a la venta de libros. A la edad de 26 años empezó a realizar  todo tipo de negocios y también  vende miniaturas en la Feria de Alasitas en el mes de Mayo. 

En la actualidad sigue vendiendo libros en el Jr. Ilo y al mismo tiempo hace otro tipo de negocios.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará artículos navideños para vender en el Parque de la Madre.   

Su deseo es tener una tienda de venta de libros.
texts.en:
Señora Virginia, since six years ago, has been a founding member of the community bank "Diana de Gales." She is 36 years of age, married, and a mother of two children. She lives at Jr. Cutimbo Nº 190 in the district, province, and department of Puno. In the beginning, with the first loan of 300 soles, she increased her merchandise by buying reading texts of different authors. She is dedicated to selling books. At the age of 26 she began doing this type of business and also sold miniature items at the Alasitas Market in the month of May. Presently she continues selling books on Jr. Ilo and at the same time does another type of business. With this loan of 1200 soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy Christmas articles to sell in the Parque de la Madre. Her desire is to have a book store.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Christmas articles

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a member of the Triunfo (“Triumph”) Village Bank. She is 42 years old and married with five children. She makes a living by running a wholesale dry-goods store in a rented location near several inter-provincial taxi stops. She and her husband work at the store every day of the week. Eva also farms potatoes on her land, located near the Matara community. Eva is applying for a loan to buy fruitcakes to sell to her customers. Eva dreams that her children will graduate with professional degrees. She also wants to have more investment capital and become a great entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Eva es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo. Eva es casada, tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, Eva tiene una tienda de abarrotes al por mayor en un local alquilado ubicado cerca de los paraderos a distintas provincias, actividad que realiza todos los días junto a su esposo. Además Eva se dedica a la agricultura de papa en sus terrenos ubicados en la comunidad de Matara. Eva necesita un préstamo de 3500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panetones. Eva sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener mas capital y ser una gran empresaria.

loans.use: to buy fruitcakes to sell to her customers

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "SAN JOSÉ" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA RIENI QUIEN ES SOLTERA PERO TIENE BAJO SU CARDO A DOS D. SUS HIJOS, AL IGUAL QUE LAS DEMÁS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO ELLA DEMUESTRA RESPONSABILIDAD Y ES POR ESO QUE TIENE LA CONFIANZA D. TODO EL GRUPO. EN SU MAYORÍA LOS SOCIOS (AS) SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS COMO ROPA, COMIDA , BEBIDA, PERFUMES, CHOCOLATES, COSMÉTICOS Y ALGUNAS SE DEDICAN A ACTIVIDADES COMO A LA ENSEÑANZA A DOMICILIO, ELECTRICISTAS Y AL SERVICIO DOMESTICO. TODAS VENDEN EN EL MERCADO CENTRAL EN EL CUAL EXISTE MUCHA COMPETENCIA PERO ELLAS SABEN COMO SALIR ADELANTE YA QUE TIENE  EXPERIENCIA EN SU NEGOCIO. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO FINANCIADO POR AGROCAPITAL ES PARA EL INCREMENTO D. SU NEGOCIO EN PRODUCTOS Y MATERIALES A LA VENTA ASÍ COMO PARA LA COMPRA D. HERRAMIENTAS D. TRABAJO. LOS SOCIOS (AS9 NO TIENEN EXPERIENCIA CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS YA QUE ES LA PRIMERA VEZ QUE OBTIENE FINANCIAMIENTO CON ESTA MODALIDAD, PERO ELLOS(AS) SE CONOCEN ENTRE SI Y SABEN QUE SE TRATA D. GENTE RESPONSABLE Y CUMPLIDA.
texts.en:
The group "San José" is represented by Señora Rieni, who is single but has two children under her control. Just like the rest of the group she shows responsibility, which is why she has the confidence of the rest of the group. The majority of the members are dedicated to selling products like clothing, food, drinks, perfumes, chocolate, and cosmetics, while some of the members are dedicated to activities like home schooling, electric work, and domestic services. All of their sales take place in the central market, where there is lots of competition, but they know how to succeed since they have experience in their businesses. The loan financed through Agrocapital will be used to increase their business with products and materials to sell as well as purchasing work tools. The members don't have experience with solidarity groups since this is the first time they have obtained financing through this method, but they know each other and know that they are working with responsible and punctual people.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Glendise

texts.en:
Glendise is a member of the Tulipanes (“Tulips”) Village Bank.  

Glendise is 38 years old and married with three children. Glendise travels to different regional markets (she used to travel to two different markets, but now travels to four) to sell various fruits and to buy cheese, grains, garlic and chickens. She grinds the grains into flour, which she then sells wholesale in different markets in the city of Ayacucho. She sells the other products door-to-door. Glendise needs a loan of 2000 Soles to buy wheat, broadbeans, quinoa and garlic. 

Glendise’s dreams are to build her own home, to buy a car to transport her wares, and to send her children to school. 

---
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Glendise es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes. 
Glendise es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Glendise viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región, anteriormente viajaba a 2 ferias y actualmente viaja a 4 ferias, en donde vende frutas variadas y de las ferias compra quesos, cereales, ajo y gallinas, sus productos los vende de casa en casa y los cereales los procesa en harinas y lo vende por mayor en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad. 
Glendise necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, haba, quinua y ajo. 
Los sueños de Glendise son construir su casa, comprar un carro para transportar sus productos y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Buy wheat, broadbeans, quinoa, and garlic

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank.  

Dina is 27 years old, single and lives alone in a rented home. Dina is an elementary school teacher and works at a private school. In her free time, she sells cosmetics from a catalogue to her friends and family members. 

Dina needs a loan of 600 Soles to buy a variety of cosmetics.  Dina dreams of going back to school to finish her thesis, to get her teaching degree and would also like to study another profession. 

---
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Dina es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial. 
Dina es soltera, tiene 27 años y vive sola en una casa alquilada, Dina es docente del nivel primario y trabaja en un colegio particular, Dina en sus tiempos libres vende cosméticos por catálogos, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares. 
Dina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos variados. 
Dina sueña con sacar su titulo, seguir estudiando otra carrera.

loans.use: Buy a variety of cosmetics

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank.  

She is 46 years old and is married with four children. Victoria runs a store from her home, where she works every day selling vegetables, dry goods, beer and a variety of drinks. Victoria also sews clothing in a workshop.  

Victoria needs a loan of 750 Soles to buy beer.  Victoria dreams of expanding her business and of offering a wider variety of products for purchase. 

---
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Victoria es casada, tiene 46 años y 4 hijos, Victoria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende verduras, abarrotes, cervezas y bebidas variadas, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Victoria tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir donde brinda servicios de compostura.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza.
Victoria sueña con ampliar su negocio, surtir con mas productos.

loans.use: Buy beer for neighborhood store

loans.name: Pura Vida Uno Group

texts.es: EL Banco Comunal Pura Vida Uno es un grupo que con dificultades pudo concluir su anterior ciclo por socios que no cumplieron con el plan de pagos a pesar de eso el grupo siempre estuvo pendiente por la recuperación y el cumplimiento de los pagos, de esta manera es que decidieron retirar a esas personas incumplidas e integrar otras socias con el fin de poder trabajar mejor este ciclo bajo la presidencia de la señora Delfina Suleide. La mayoría de los socios (as) trabajan con mercadería de cosméticos, comida con la que generalmente ambulan por el mercado de la ciudad de Montero. De los quince integrantes 10 son mujeres emprendedoras y 5 varones responsables con ganas de trabajar y salir adelante con el apoyo y las facilidades que le otorga la institución al otorgarles un nuevo crédito. Todos los Socios (as) del grupos están agradecidos porque podrán invertir en sus pequeños puestos de venta y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Existen parentescos familiare pero ellos tienen independencia económica.
texts.en:
The community bank Pura Vida Uno is a group that was able to complete its previous cycle with difficulties due to members that did not complete the plan of payments. Despite that the group always had outstanding payments because of the payment plans that they had to recover, they were able to complete the cycle. This is why they decided to retire these unpaid members and incorporate new members with the goal of being able to work better this cycle under the presidency of Señora Delfina Suleide. The majority of the members work in cosmetic merchandise or food sold in a traveling manner at the markets in the city of Montero. Of the fifteen members, ten are enterprising women and five are responsible men with the desire to work and improve with the support and facilities offered to them by the institution through a new credit. All the members of the groups are thankful because they will be able to invest in their small sales jobs and be able to improve the quality of the lives of their families. Familiar relationships exist between the members but they all have economic independence.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital for operations

loans.name: Florida Group

texts.es: El grupo FLORIDA esta representado por la señora Olga es un grupo D. 17 socios(as) D. los cuales 16 son mujeres 1 varón; son personas muy responsables con ganas D. trabajar entusiastas y muy comprometidas con la institución. La mayoría D. sus socias venden comida rápida en las calles D. sus barrios, también se dedican a la venta D. zapatas, abarrotes, verduras refrescos y cotillones el varón se dedica a la construcción D. viviendas. En general ya tienen experiencia cono grupo solidarios ya que van cursando su segundo ciclo en la Fundación agrocapital, en el anterior ciclo demostraron responsabilidad y cooperación. El destino del financiamiento es para el incrementar su negocio D. ventas D. comida ambulante y a la mejora D. sus pequeños negocios para poder velar por el bienestar D. su familia. Existen parentescos familiares entre los socios (as) pero todos tienen independencia económica.
texts.en:
The FLORIDA group, represented by Olga, is a group of 17 partners, of which 16 are women and one is male. They are very responsible people with an enthusiastic work ethic who are very committed to their institution. The majority of the female partners sell fast food on the streets of their neighborhoods; others sell shoes, groceries, vegetables and soft drinks, and the male partner builds houses. In general, they already have experience with group solidarity, and are now enrolling in their second loan cycle with Fundación Agrocapital. In the previous cycle, they demonstrated responsibility and cooperation. These finances will be used to increase the mobile food sales and to improve their small businesses to ensure the wellbeing of their families. There are some family relations among the partners, but each has economic independence.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Estela Del Carmen

texts.es: L a señora Estela del Carmen Martínez Tienen la edad de 32 años habita en el municipio de Monimbo,  ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya, junto a su esposo y hijos; el esposo de la señora trabaja para compartir los gastos del hogar .Ella desde hace cuatro años se dedica a vender tortillas y también vende golosinas y gaseosas, para poder salir hacia delante con su familia ella entrega tortillas y vende en la misma casa , con su propios esfuerzos ha logrado mantener este negocio ya que la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento . Ella solicita el apoyo de Afodenic para poder incrementar más su negocio en las venta de tortillas, también comprar productos para incrementar su inventario y poder obtener mejor ganancia  y así darle un mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Estela del Carmen Martínez is 32 years old and lives in Monimbo in the city of Masaya with her husband and children. Her husband works to pay the shared household expenses. For the past four years, Estela has sold tortillas, confections and soft drinks to get her family ahead. She serves the tortillas and sells the other items from her home, and through her own efforts has been able to maintain her business. The main challenge she faces is a shortage of financial resources. She is seeking the help of Afodenic to increase her tortilla sales and stock more products, allowing her to earn a higher wage and give her children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn to produce and sell tortillas

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a member of the Santa Rita Village Bank. 

Erlinda is 33 years old and lives with her partner and her four children. 

Every afternoon, she sells prepared meals made from chicken intestines. Erlinda is planning to launch a business selling clothing to family and friends.  She is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to buy pants, t-shirts and sweaters.  

Erlinda’s dreams are to build her own home, to own a nice home with all the necessities, and for her children to graduate from college with professional degrees. 

---
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Erlinda es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita.
Erlinda es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Erlinda vende comida preparada de los intestinos de los pollos, sus ventas los realiza en el paradero de una linea de transporte urbano, actividad que realiza por las tardes. Erlinda con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado iniciar con la venta de ropa que ofrecerá a amigos y familiares.
Erlinda necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, polos, chompas.
Los sueños de Erlinda son construir su casa, tener una casa bonita con todo lo necesario y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Buy pants, t-shirts and sweaters

loans.name: Heidy Thalia

texts.es:
La señora Camila pertenece al Banco Comunal “Loreto”, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez Nº 344, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años de edad, es madre de un hijo menor de edad, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa, la cual le brinda buenas ganancias que le permite pagar su préstamo puntualmente. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de leche, menestras, 2 paquetes de aceites, etc.

Camila se siente contenta porque su negocio ha crecido y la estabilidad económica de su familia ha mejorado.

loans.use: Comprará 6 moldes de dulces, 2 sacos de aguajes, 6 paquetes de gaseosas, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Amaqella Village Bank, which means “don’t be lazy” in Quechua. 

Nancy is 35 years old and single with two children. She has a chicken restaurant, located on a very busy street, where she employs four staff to help her serve the public. Nancy is the head cook.

Nancy also sells a variety of clothing by special order. Nancy needs a loan of 2000 Soles to buy sacks of rice and sugar and a sign to hang outside her restaurant.  

Nancy’s dreams are for her children to graduate with professional degrees and to open another location for her restaurant. 

---
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella que significa No Seas Flojo en quechua. 
Nancy es soltera, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Nancy tiene un restaurante y polleria ubicado en una avenida muy transitada, el local es alquilado y tiene 4 personas que le ayudan en la atención al publico, Nancy se encarga de la cocina. Además Nancy vende ropa variada de acuerdo a los pedidos que tenga. 
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz por sacos y un letrero publicitario para su negocio. 
Los sueños de Nancy son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios profesionales e implementar otra sucursal.

loans.use: Buy sacks of rice and sugar and a sign to hang outside of restaurant

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
La señora Camila pertenece al Banco Comunal “Loreto”, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez Nº 344, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años de edad, es madre de un hijo menor de edad, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa, la cual le brinda buenas ganancias que le permite pagar su préstamo puntualmente. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de leche, menestras, 2 paquetes de aceite, etc.

Camila se siente contenta porque su negocio ha crecido y la estabilidad económica de su familia ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Camila belongs to the “Loreto” Communal Bank, located at Jr. Comandante Suárez Nº 344, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 28 years old, mother to one young son, is married, and her husband is an independent laborer. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300 she decided to invest in selling groceries. She has been working with the communal bank for 2 years. Today she has a convenience store in her home, which provides her good earnings and allows her to pay her loan punctually. With this loan for S/ 2,000 which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 cases of milk, 2 packages of oil, supplies, etc. Camila feels content because her business has grown and her family’s economic stability has improved.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 cases of milk, 2 packages of oil, supplies, etc.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La señora Feliciana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Loreto”, ubicado en el Jr. Loreto Nº 254, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo”. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene 10 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de medicinas, tiene el apoyo de su esposo y viajan por las zonas rurales a vender productos medicinales a sus clientes.   

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 caja de ampicilína, panadol antigripal, dolocordralan y otros. 

Gracias a la ayuda recibida del banco, su negocio está creciendo día a día y sus clientes han aumentado en estas últimas semanas.
texts.en:
Feliciana belongs to the “Loreto” Communal Bank, located at Jr. Loreto Nº 254, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 48 years old, mother to three school age children, married, and her husband is an independent laborer. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300 she decided to invest in selling groceries. She has been working with the communal bank for 10 years. Today she has a business selling medicine. She has the support of her husband and they travel through the rural areas to sell medicinal products to their customers. With this loan for S/ 1,200 which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 1 case of antibiotics, Panadol cold medicine, pain relievers, and others. Thanks to the bank’s help, her business is growing daily and her customers have grown during these last few weeks.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy antibiotics, cold medicine, pain relievers, etc.

loans.name: Nubia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Nubia G. con gran esfuerzo se dedica a laborar en su negocio de venta de comestibles  tales como gaseosas, galletas y meneítos comercializados en el Mercado Oriental a la intemperie y con la necesidad de tener su propio tramo. 

Es importante destacar que ella es originaria del municipio de Ciudad Sandino y para llegar a su establecimiento en el Mercado Oriental, todos los días se levanta dese muy temprano para abordar los buses y estar puntual en su establecimiento.

La razón por la cual ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los productos para su respectiva comercialización en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
With great effort Mrs. Nubia G. works selling food products such as soda pop, cookies, and snacks in the open air Oriental Market and by necessity has her own selling area. It is important to note that she is originally from Sandino City, and to arrive at her place in Oriental Market, every day she gets up very early to board the buses and be on time to her business. The reason she is seeking Ceprodel’s support is to obtain a loan that will allow her to buy the products she sells in her establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food products to sell

loans.name: Karin Rosanita

texts.es:
La señora Karin pertenece al Banco Comunal “Loreto”, ubicado en el Jr. Loreto Mz. 250 Lt. 17, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja en la Marina. 

Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio y tiene una bebe de 15 días de nacido, así es que se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y a la atención de su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 15 cajas de gaseosas, 3 paquetes de agua mineral, gaseosas descartables, etc.

Karin manifiesta que recibe un apoyo de Manuela Ramos y agradece a todas aquellas personas que la apoyan.
texts.en:
Karin belongs to the Loreto Community Bank, located at jr. Loreto Mz. 250 Lt. 17, Calleria District, Colonel Portillo district, Ucayali department. She is 32 years old, the mother of four young children who even depend on her, she is maried and her husband works in the Marina.

With the loan that she received from Manuela Ramos for S. 300 she decided to invest it in the sale of sodas. She has four years working with the community bank.

She actually counts on the same business and has a 15 day old baby, so she is dedicated to the care of her children and attending to her business.

With this loan of S. 2,000, which will be paid in five months, she will buy 15 cases of soda, 3 packages of mineral water, etc.

Karin hopes to receive support from Manuela Ramos and thanks all of the people who support her.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 15 cases of soda and 3 packages of mineral water

loans.name: Loyda

texts.es:
La señora Loyda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Románticas”, ubicado en el Jr. Sheshea Mz. 17 Lt. 7, distrito de Manantay, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. 

Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y viaja a las zonas rurales a vender la mercadería a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará una docena de faldas, 2 docenas de polos, 2 docenas de blusas, 1 docena de sandalias y zapatos, etc.

Loyda manifiesta alegría porque todo lo que ha logrado es gracias a su habilidad para el trabajo
texts.en:
Loyda belongs to “Las Románticas” Community Bank, located in Manantay district, Coronel Portillo province in the department of Ucayali. She is 31 years old and the mother of two minor children who still depend on her. She is married, and her husband is employed independently.

With her first loan from Manuela Ramos in the amount of 300 soles, she decided to invest in the sale of soft drinks. She has been working with the community bank for two years.

Now she sells clothes and shoes and travels to rural areas to sell merchandise to her customers.

With this loan of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy a dozen skirts, two dozen polo shirts, two dozen blouses, a dozen sandals and shoes, etc.

Loyda is happy because of everything she has achieved thanks to her ability to work.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 1-2 dozen each of skirts, polo shirts, blouses, sandals, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Rhina Esther

texts.es:
La Señora Rhina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Loreto”, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez Nº 398, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 46 años de edad y es madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores de edad.

Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de refrescos. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con un motokar y tiene el apoyo de su hijo para el manejo de su herramienta de trabajo.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 2 llantas, un par de amortiguadores, etc., también tapizará los asientos y arreglará el motor.

Rhina se siente contenta porque ha logrado tener una movilidad, gracias al apoyo que le brinda el banco comunal.
texts.en:
Rhina is a member of the Loreto Community Bank, located at 398 Comandante Suárez Lane in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo region of Ucayali. She is 46 years old and a single mother to three adult children. She used her first loan from Kiva's partner Manuela Ramos to invest in selling soft drinks. The loan was for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles (approximately US $98). She has been working with the bank for two years. She currently makes a living from driving a motorcycle rickshaw, which her son helps her keep in good repair. With this loan of 3,000 nuevos soles (US $975), to be repaid in five months, she will purchase two tires, a set of shock absorbers, and other rickshaw parts. She will also upholster the seats and fix the motor. Rhina is happy because, thanks to the support of her community bank, she has her rickshaw.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two tires, a set of shock absorbers, etc.; to upholster the seats and fix the motor

loans.name: Rosa Alvina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Loreto”, ubicado en el Jr. Loreto Nº 241, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 59 años D. edad, es madre D. 6 hijos mayores D. edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como profesor D. Educación Secundaria. 

Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. ropa. Tiene 7 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una motokar como herramienta D. trabajo. Se dedica a su hogar y a la administración D. su movilidad.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,100, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 2 llantas, focos, etc., también arreglará el motor y tapizará los asientos. 

Rosa se siente contenta por el apoyo que le brinda el banco comunal y agradece a Dios por permitirle estar un día más con su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the cooperative bank “Loreto”, located on Loreto Street in the Callería district of Ucayali. She is 59 years old and the mother of six grown children. She is married, and her husband works as a secondary school teacher. With the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in clothing sales. She has been working with the cooperative bank for seven years. Currently, she uses a motocar as her tool of traD.. She dedicates herself to tending to her home, and to administering her transportation business. With this loan of 1,100.00 Peruvian soles, which she will repay in five months, she will purchase tires, headlights, etc., and will also make repairs to the engine and upholster the seats. Rosa feels very content for having the support of the cooperative bank, and gives thanks to God for allowing her to spend another day with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two tires, headlights, etc., and also to make engine repairs and upholster the seats of her motocar.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
El negocio de venta de ropa en toda época requiere de la inversión en la compra de este producto para ofrecerlo ya que si no se realiza de esta manera por lo general los clientes deciden comprar la ropa en otro establecimiento. Muy consciente de esta situación, la señora María A. se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado Central de Chinandega donde atiende con muchísimo esfuerzo con el propósito de sobrevivir en la vida.

Para salir adelante ha buscado el apoyo brindado por Ceprodel para que le permita la compra de la ropa y así comercializarla en su establecimiento de ventas en el mercado de la ciudad de Chinandega.
texts.en:
The sale of clothing for all seasons is an effort that requires an investment into products to offer to customers, otherwise they will decide to go elsewhere to make their purchases. Very conscious of this situation, María A. dedicates herself to selling clothing at the Central Market of Chinandega where she tends to her business with great care hoping to triumph in life. To get ahead, she has sought the support of Ceprodel which allows her to buy the clothing and then market her wares in her establishment at the market of the city of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Josefina De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Josefina J. desde hace 8 años se ha destacado en su negocio de venta de electrodomésticos comercializados en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hare su establecimiento para atender a sus clientes.

La única razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito que le permita comprar los electrodomésticos a su proveedor y una vez teniendo el producto lograr comercializarlo para continuar con el sostén de su familia que tanto necesita de ella.
texts.en:
Josefina J. has owned her home appliances business for 8 years. She sells in the Mercado Central of Chinandega where every day she opens early in the morning hours in order to serve her clients. The only reason she approached Ceprodel is to request a loan with which she will be able to buy home appliances from her supplier and once she has them, she will sell them to continue supporting her family which depends so much on her.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy home appliances for resale

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva tiene 54 años, es divorciada, vive con sus hijos y sus nietos. Ella ha encontrado en la venta de queso y de panes una actividad muy rentable, ya que inició hace 5 años y le está yendo muy bien, sus productos no los vende en las ciudades cercanas, sino que los lleva como pedidos a la capital, Lima, donde pagan muy bien por ellos, y es mucho más fácil y rápido de vender que en su propia ciudad. Dentro de su actividad, lo que le agrada es viajar constantemente para la capital y así poder visitar a su hija y nieto que viven allá, sin descuidar su principal motivo de viaje, inicia desde muy temprano a repartir sus quesitos a las familias que lo solicitan y también aprovecha para aumentar sus pedidos para la próxima  quincena. Este es su primer crédito en MFP. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra y venta de mayores productos de la sierra para poder llevarlos a la capital.
texts.en:
Elva is 54 years old, divorced, and lives with her children and and grandchildren. She has discovered that selling cheese and bread is very profitable as she has been in this business for 5 years and business is good. She does not sell her products in nearby towns; rather, she sells by special order in the capital, Lima, where clients pay well, and it is much easier and quicker to sell than in her hometown. In terms of her work, what she enjoys most is travelling habitually to the capital, where she can then visit her daughter and grandchild who live there, without neglecting the main reason for her trip, as she distributes her goats' milk cheeses to families who have placed orders, as well as taking orders for her next biweekly trip. This is her first loan with MFP. She will invest the money in the purchase and sale of more products from the mountains in order to bring them to the capital.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantities of products for resale

loans.name: Judyth

texts.es: Judyth tiene 35 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Se dedica a conducir un motocarro hace 2 años, siendo mujer tiene la fuerza para realizar trabajos muy pesados, ejemplo que a muchas mujeres les gustaría seguir. Además, para las personas que la conoces, Judith es una mujer muy esmerada en su actividad, sumado a ello tenemos resaltar, lo bien que se siente en ayudar a su pareja en  los gastos del hogar. Dedicarse al motocarro es una actividad rentable, ya que en su zona las personas están muy  acostumbradas a movilizarse en este tipo de vehículos, aunque lo difícil es cubrir el precio de los repuestos y mantenimientos que necesita. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Con en el dinero solicitado invertirá en el mantenimiento de este su motocarro.
texts.en:
Judyth is 35 years old, married, and lives with her husband and child. She has driven a motocar for the past 2 years. She is a woman with the strength to accomplish heavy work, an example which many women would like to emulate. As well, Judith is known as a very diligent woman, to which we also must add how good she feels helping her partner with household expenses. Motocar driving is profitable, even though it is difficult to cover the cost of spare parts and maintenance. This is her first loan with MFP. She will use the loan in maintaining her motocar.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of her motocar

loans.name: Liszet

texts.es: Liszet tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Gracias al esfuerzo que puso en sus diversas actividades logró abrir una tienda en su propia casa, a la cual se ocupa desde hace 2 años, y puede cuidar a sus hijos haciendo de su centro de trabajo y su hogar una misma cosa, lo cual le agrada  porque no descuida a sus seres queridos. Para Liszeth, trabajar en su bodega es algo rentable, ya que los ingresos son diarios y solo es cuestión de administrarlos de una manera adecuada, aspecto que trata de realizar, para seguir creciendo en su negocio sobre todo por el bienestar de sus pequeños hijos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado adquirirá mayor cantidad de productos para incrementar sus ingresos y para estar acorde a la competencia, que cada vez es mayor.
texts.en:
Liszet is 32 years old and lives with her husband and children. Thanks to efforts she made in a variety of activities, she has been able to open a store in her own home, which she has been running for 2 years, and is able to take care of her children herself by making her home the centre of her work, which makes her happy as she does not have to leave her loved ones. For Liszeth, working in her store is profitable as she makes money every day and it is simply a matter of administering the revenues adequately, something she tries to do in order to continue increasing her business, above all for the well-being of her young children. This is her first loan with MFP. She will use the loan to acquire a large quantity of products to increase her revenue and be able to compete with other stores as competition is ever greater.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the products for sale in her store

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 26 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y su pequeño hijo. Ella es administradora de una empresa de trasportes, y desde hace 4 años, también administra su propia bodega, gracias a ello puede ejercer su profesión y tener un negocio propio, debido a que las personas frecuentan su tienda para comprar lo boletos de viaje, también consumen los productos de la bodega de luz. Ella manifiesta que no tiene ninguna dificultad en su negocio. Según nos comenta, sólo tiene algunas dificultades cuando se retrasan los buses que salen de viaje. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. El dinero solicitado se invertirá en la compra de productos para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Luz is 26 years old. She is a single mother, living with her parents and her young child. She is an administrator in a transport company, and for the past 4 years has also run her own grocery store, thanks to which she is able to work for herself and own her own business: people come to her store to buy bus tickets as well as to buy products from her grocery. She says that there are no difficulties in her business. From what she tells us, there are only some difficulties when the buses are delayed. This is her first loan with MFP. She will use the loan to buy products to supply her grocery.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise in her grocery

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Inició su trabajo de venta de dulces en una humilde carreta donde llevaba sus  golosinas a venderlas a los colegios y escuelas de los alrededores, gracias al esfuerzo que puso logró con el tiempo instalar una pequeña bodega en su casa, pero a pesar de que tiene un lugar estable, no deja de salir a vender a los colegios  los diversos dulces, ya que le agrada poder hacerlo. Sin embargo, lo difícil es empujar la carreta, pero el regresar es muy gratificante, por las ganancias que obtuvo, restando importancia al cansancio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. María desea seguir creciendo e invertirá 300 soles más, aparte de los 700 que solicita en la compra de dulces navideños y panetones por temporada.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old and lives with her husband and child. She started selling candies from a humble cart with which she brought her sweets to sell at local high schools and elementary schools. Thanks to her hard work, she was able to open a small grocery store in her home. Now that she has a fixed spot, she no longer goes out to sell her various candies at schools, although she would still like to do so. No doubt, the most difficult part is pushing the cart, but it is very gratifying on the way back, and with the income she has made it is easier to forget how tired she is. This is her first loan with MFP. María would like to continue expanding and will invest an addition 300 soles, over and above the 700 soles from this loan, to buy Christmas sweets and panetones for the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Christmas food products

loans.name: Melchora

texts.es: Melchora tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo D. 12 años. Es una prospera vendedora D. verduras, muy alegre y rápidamente atienD. a sus clientes para poder vender mayor cantidad en el día, sobre todo en las mañanas, cuando son horas D. gran estrés por la cantidad D. personas que viene al mercado, pero Melchora ya tiene práctica, debido a su enorme experiencia por los 12 años D.  vender este tipo D. productos. Su negocio es rentable porque compra al por mayor y prepara cada porción, en el caso D. los condimentos, en menores cantidades, luego al vender gana mucho. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. La cantidad que solicita la invertirá en la compra D. más verduras y condimentos  secos para satisfacer los pedidos D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Melchora is 40 years old and lives with her husband and her 12-year old child. She is a prosperous vegetable seller, very happy and attentive to her clients in order maximize her daily sales; it can be especially stressful in the mornings due to the number of people who come to the market. But Melchora is experienced, having spent the past 12 years selling this type of product. Her business in profitable because she buys in bulk and creates portions, in the case of condiments, in smaller quantities, on which she can make a profit when she resells them. This is her first loan with MFP. She will use the loan to buy more vegetables and dry condiments in order to satisfy her clients' demand.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the products she sells

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por mantener a su familia  libre de necesidades, por ello viene trabajando en una empresa donde producen alcachofas para luego exportarlas a los diversos países. También se dedica desde hace 5 años a la crianza de cuyes, ya que ahora de la misma forma como algunos de nuestros productos agrícolas son exportados, la demanda de cuyes también es una de las actividades más rentables, por los grandes pedidos que hay por su alto grado proteico. Sin duda ambas cosas son muy difíciles de realizar, sobre todo cuando hay que matar a los cuyes para poder venderlos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y asume el compromiso de ser puntual con sus pagos, ya que es muy responsable con sus acuerdos asumidos. Nancy invertirá el dinero en la compra de cuyes de raza que eleven el costo de  venta, por el tamaño y peso que poseen.
texts.en:
Nancy is a hard-working woman who strives to support her family with their needs, which is why she works in a company producing artichokes for export to different countries. As well, she has raised guinea pigs for the past 5 years, as now much as some of our agricultural products are exported, the demand for guinea pigs makes this one of the most profitable activities due to the high demand for their high-grade protein. No doubt both jobs are very difficult to perform, especially when it comes to killing the guinea pigs in order to be able to sell them. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be punctual with her repayments, as she is very responsible. Nancy will invest the money in the purchase of purebred guinea pigs which will increase their resale value due to their size and weight.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy purebred guinea pigs

loans.name: Renee

texts.es: Renee tiene 29 años, vive con su actual pareja y su pequeño hijo. Trabaja en las madereras, presta servicios desde hace 8 años, actividad que le permitió iniciar un negocio propio de venta de madera, ya que tiene contacto con las distribuidoras, los trabajos en madera es lo que le agrada realizar y en el cual piensa especializarse. Para Renee, la venta de madera es muy rentable, ya que son pocas las empresas por su zona que compiten en el mismo rubro, y gracias a que tienen contacto con personas de otras ciudades puede aumentar su producción. Lo difícil es el traslado de las maderas. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Invertirá la cantidad solicitada en la compra de madera, pero también en ayudar a su pareja en un nuevo negocio que desean realizar.
texts.en:
Renee is 29 years old and lives with his wife and small child.
