Since he was 8 years old, he has worked in the lumber industry, which allowed him to start his own business selling lumber since he had contacts with the distributors. He enjoys working in this industry and he plans to specialize in it. For Renee, selling lumber is very profitable since he has few competitors in his region, and since he has contacts with people in other cities, he has been able to increase his production. His main challenge is transporting the lumber. This is his first loan from Prsima Microfinance and he will invest the money in purchasing lumber and will also help his wife with the new business they would like to start.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of larger amounts of lumber

loans.name: Juan Rogelio

texts.es:
Don Juan labora en una línea transportista como chofer, el realiza viajes al interior del país cada semana. Sin embargo tiene una familia muy unida que en cada regreso lo reciben con mucha alegría; nos comenta él y su esposa que ellos fomentan la hermandad entre sus hijos para cuando sean grandes tengan un trato bonito.
Siguiendo con el ejemplo el Sr.  M. desea ayudar a su hermana, la cual en este momento necesita que la intervengan quirúrgicamente pero no cuenta con el capital, por tal motivo requiere de un préstamo para cubrir ese gasto, que desafortunadamente no tenían contemplado.
texts.en:
Juan works with a transport company as a driver, making trips into the country's interior each week. Nonetheless, he has a very unified family who receive him joyfully each time he returns from a trip. He and his wife foment a spirit of brotherhood between their children so that when they are older, they will treat each other well. Mr. M. wants to help his sister who is currently in need of surgery but does not have enough money to pay for it; this is why he is requesting a loan to cover the cost of this surgery that has suddenly come up.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María J. está muy agradecida con todos ustedes, por el gran apoyo que recibió en el préstamo pasado; con ello pudo emprender un negocio de abarrotes en su propia casa y de esa manera ya no tuvo que dejar a sus hijos y así prestarles una mejor atención. 
 Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de productos y nuevamente solicita su colaboración para invertirle y hacerlo crecer para mantenerse por largos periodos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Maria Juarez is very grateful for the great help she received through her past loan. With it, she was able to start a small grocery business that she runs out of her own home which allows her to stay with her children and care for them during the day. She needs to add a greater variety of products to her business and she is requesting another loan in order to invest and increase her stock so it lasts for longer periods.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply her small general store

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
La señora Zoila Cámara vive en casa de su hija, y sus ingresos son del negocio de venta de ropa (nueva y semiusada) que tiene para ella.
La vivienda necesita un portón de metal al frente de la casa, porque ellas trabajan todo el día y temen ser victimas de un robo.
Es por eso que solicitan el préstamo para darle seguridad a la casa donde vive.
Ella es una persona trabajadora y con los ingresos del negocio y la ayuda económica de sus hijos planea pagarlo.
texts.en:
Zoila Cámara lives in her daughter's home and makes her living selling clothing (new and gently used). The house needs a metal gate in front because they both work all day and are afraid of being burglarized. For this reason, she is asking for a loan to make the home they live in more secure. She is a hard worker and will repay you with money from the income generated by her business and with the financial help of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To erect a gate in front of their home for security

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 13 años. Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, como gallinas y pollos, las cuales vende a buenos precios por ser sus animales de buena raza y de consumo en los  grandes restaurantes, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años, ya que vio en ella una muy buena forma de ganar dinero. Realiza su trabajo dentro de su hogar, alimentando y cuidando a sus animalitos adecuadamente. El tener animales de raza es de gran beneficio, por el precio que tienen de venta, lo difícil es invertir en los alimentos para su debido engorde y que obtengan el peso adecuado. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en la compra de cuyes, para iniciar la venta de estos animalitos también.
texts.en:
Irma is 37 years old and lives with her husband and 13-year old child. She raises small animals, such as hens and chickens, which she sells for a good price as her animals are purebred and will be consumed in large restaurants. She has been doing this for 6 years, as she saw this was a good way to make money. She works from home, feeding and caring for her small animals. Raising purebred animals is profitable due to the good resale price. What is difficult is to invest in feed to fatten them up so that they grow to a good weight. This is her first loan with MFP. With this loan, she will buy guinea pigs in order to begin selling these small animals as well.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start-up a guinea pig business

loans.name: Raida

texts.es: Raida tiene 37 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Todas las mañanas se levanta para preparar los alimentos necesarios que venderá  como desayuno en las puertas de los lugares públicos más concurridos, como los mercados y escuelas o colegios, esta actividad la viene realizando por 4 años, y desde entonces ha tenido el entusiasmo de salir todas las mañanas, gracias a su buen trato con las personas, también tiene clientela en las tardes y sale a vender  algunos aperitivos, haciendo de esta actividad una de sus labores más rentables, para incrementar sus ingresos económicos, lo difícil es trasladar su triciclo al lugar donde vende. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en el alquiler de un local donde pueda vender más cómodamente los deliciosos platillos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Raida is 37 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 2 children. Every morning she wakes up to prepare the food she will sell for breakfast in the entrances of the most crowded public places, such as markets and schools or high schools. She has been doing this for 4 years and since then has been full of enthusiasm to go out every morning. Thanks to her good treatment of people, she also has clients in the evenings and she goes out to sell snacks, which makes this business one of her most profitable, her greatest obstacle to increasing her income is the difficulty in transporting her tricycle to the spots where she sells. This is her first loan with MFP. She will invest the loan in a the rental of premises where she can more comfortably sell her delicious dishes to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent premises for her food business

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y dos de sus hijos en la casa que heredó de su madre. Hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de comida, con el apoyo económico de uno de su hijo que se fue a trabajar a otro país, desea abrir un bonito restaurante en el futuro. Esta actividad es algo que le apasiona realizar, puesto que desde muy joven ayudó a su madre en la cocina y gracias a ella, ahora puede realizar riquísimos platos de comida, su buena sazón atrae a las personas que degustan sus platillos. Pero dentro de todo, lo difícil es poder medir la cantidad que hay que preparar para el día  para no tener pérdidas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Rebeca desea invertir en la compra de víveres, para solventar los gastos de inversión en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two of her children in the home she inherited from her mother. For 5 years she has been selling food. With the financial help of one of her children who went to work in another country, she would like to open a nice restaurant in the future. She is passionate about cooking, as she began helping her mother in the kitchen from a very young age and thanks to her, now she is able to make delicious meals. Her ability to season dishes well attracts people to come taste her meals. But in all, the most difficult is knowing how much food to prepare each day so as not to have any waste. This is her first loan with MFP. Rebeca would like to invest in the purchase of food, to cover the cost of investment in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food to prepare

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Mrs. Tom K., age 49, is a single woman, and a resident in Ptasrong Commune in the Pursat Province. She earns her income from growing rice and selling a small amount of groceries from her home. She lives with her two nephews, both of whom help her with the farm work. Tom works very hard trying to grow her business. To earn extra a revenue, Tom is requesting a loan so that she can purchase piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to breed.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
“My children are no longer attending class and it hurts me so much because I’m their mother and I really do have good plans for them", says Carolyn K., a 44-year old mother of four children from Pasonanca, Zamboanga City. With her husband's salary as an electrician, they can hardly meet all their family needs. “Because we don’t have enough money to pay for education, my children choose to stay home”, she added.

She sells food items in the neighborhood. She gets additional income from this, which she uses to support her children. She needs additional capital to make her business grow.

She is requesting a loan to purchase additional ingredients and food items to sell in her stall.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and other food items to sell

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Khoeun K., 55, and his wife, Mrs. Heng Sok, 50, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1978 during the Pol Pot regime and have four children: one son and three daughters. Three of their children have full-time employment and the youngest daughter studies in a local school. 

Khoeun and his wife have been growing jasmine flowers for ten years. In addition to farming jasmine, he is also a fisherman. The couple grow jasmine on their farmland near the house and sell the flowers in the Phnom Penh market. Khoeun is requesting a loan of $700. He will use some of it to purchase a water pump and pipe for farming. With the remainder, he will buy more jasmine trees to plant on his new plot of farmland.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, pipe, and jasmine saplings for their farm.

loans.name: Kirana

texts.en:
Kirana I., a 29-year-old mother of three children from San Jose Gusu, Zamboanga City, is selling variety of goods for a living. Her husband, a government employee, has been very supportive of her in her business.

Because they didn’t own the house, she has engaged herself in a retail business. She sells various items in her store to earn additional income for the family. She wants to have their dream house built.

She is requesting a loan to purchase additional goods to sell in her store. In this way, she could earn more and save enough to support her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria I., a 29-year-old mother of three children from San Jose Gusu, Zamboanga City, is a dressmaker. Her husband, a government employee, has been very supportive of her in her business.

Because they didn’t own the house, she engaged herself into a tailoring business. She sews various kinds of clothes to earn additional income for her family. She wants to have their dream house built.

She is requesting a loan to purchase additional materials, especially fabrics, to use in her business. In this way she could earn more and save enough to support her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for making dresses

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok R. is 50-years old and resides in the Ptasrong Commune in Pursat Province. She is married with seven children, four of whom are students, and three are married and live away home. Her husband, Noun Thom, is 49 years old. The couple are local cultivators who have owned farmland for growing various kinds of plants like fruit trees and vegetable crops. Sok and Thom are requesting a loan to buy additional farmland. The loan will help them to increase their income and sustain their family's living expenses. (Mrs. Sok R. is pictured)

loans.use: To purchase additional farmland

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia M., a 43-year-old mother of two children, from Putik, Zamboanga City, is a food vendor. She is a devoted wife and aspires to provide her children with a good education as well as a good quality of life. To supplement her husband’s income as a welder, she sells food in her stall to help support their children. People come to her to buy food. She is happy to get started with her small business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase additional food ingredients to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional food ingredients to sell

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira O. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2003. The loan sums have permanently increased and so have the business turnovers. Mrs. O. was born in 1980 in B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She does not have  special education, but she knows business features, so she has been engaged in business for six years. Mrs. O. trades food products, and she has her trade outlet in the local bazaar, Farovon. She trades meat products (sausages, salami), milk-sour products (curd, kefir, milk), juices, sweets and vegetable oil. She has repeat customers. She is very polite and a kind woman by nature. Mrs. O. applies to KIVA with the request of financial support through a business development loan of 4,000 TJS for six months for purchasing a new refrigerator. It permits her to increase the existing assortment and business turnover.

loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator.

loans.name: Mukaddam

texts.en: Mukaddam I. lives in the B. Gafurov region, but she trades in the Khujand local bazaar “Panjshanbe”. She is engaged in commercial service and trade. She trades the children's wear that she brings from Istaravshan. Mrs. I. has been engaged in business for seven years and has good business skills. She brings good assortment so she has repeat customers. Mrs. I. asks KIVA for the business support loan of 400 TJS for three months for new seasonal wear importing. She thanks KIVA for it support.

loans.use: new seasonal wear importing

loans.name: Ronalie

texts.en:
Ronalie D. R. is a hog raiser and a meat vendor. Everyday, she sells meat to earn enough money for her family. She wants the best for her children and aspires to give them a good future.“I'll do everything to raise my children well and help him to achieve their dreams”, says the 34-year-old mother from Putik, Zamboanga City. She and her husband have worked together to support their growing family needs. 
She is requesting a loan to purchase additional meats to sell in her stall. In this way, she can save enough money for her children's future.

loans.use: To purchase additional meats to sell in her stall

loans.name: Khojiakbar

texts.en: Khojiakbar F. has been an active client of our loan program since 2006. He is married and brings up five children. He lives and works in Khujand. Mr. F. Khojiakbar has 13 years in business, and he started the business from scratch. Thanks to the previous loans, he could open a business of small wares selling. Today he is engaged in the business of cigarettes, chewing gum and ground nuts selling. Besides, he works as night watchman. Mr. F. applies to KIVA with the request of the business development loan of 1,000 TJS for six months for expansion of business assortment. He thanks KIVA for its support and participation.

loans.use: To expand his business selling cigarettes, chewing gum, and ground nuts.

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.en: Mukadas K. first applied to MicroInvest in 2005. At that moment she was in a difficult business situation, but thanks to the loans she took, she improved her existing business and expanded the trade outlet to cigarettes, chewing gum and notebook selling. Her loan sums increased permanently and show her business developing and her business turnover increasing. Today Mrs. K. Mukadas trades children's wear that she brings from Istaravshan and the Kyrgyz Republic. When she goes for the parcels, every time she gets a good assortment. Currently, Mrs. K. is on the last loan repayment step, and she is going to continue working with MicroInvest, so she applied to KIVA with the request of a business development loan of 3,100 TJS for three months for expanding her trade outlet merchandise.

loans.use: To expand her store's merchandise.

loans.name: Muyassara

texts.en: Muyassara K. was born in 1964 in the B. Gafurov region. She lives in the B. Gafurov region, but she works in the Khujand local bazaar “Panjshanbe”. She has been in business for 10 years. She trades fruits (apples, grapes, bananas, and oranges) and salads that she makes herself. She brings the fruits from Russia and Uzbekistan. Mrs. K. applied to KIVA with the request of financial support for her existing business.  With a business development loan of 2,000 TJS for eight months, she plans to buy popular holiday fruits and increase her business turnover. She thanks KIVA for support.

loans.use: To purchase fruits for selling.

loans.name: Sérgio Abia

texts.pt:
Sérgio Abia M. is 42 years old and was born in Boane, a district in Maputo province. He is married and the father of two children, 2 and 12 years old. In addition to his children, he takes care of his sister-in-law who lives with them.

Sérgio studied though 9th grade, then stopped because financial conditions did not allow him to continue. Sérgio has never moved from this city. He spent his childhood with his family. He works as an electrician at Mozambique Electricity, a public utility company, from 7:30am to 3:30pm. He makes a monthly salary of 7,500 Meticais (MZN) and saves 500 MZN.

This is Sérgio's second loan request with Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner) and his first with Kiva. His first loan was for 13,000 MZN to purchase construction material, and this loan will be for additional construction material. Sérgio anticipates that he will not be able to complete the project with this loan. Thus, he intends to repay the loan early and predicts that he will request another loan of about 20,000 MZN to finish the job. Sérgio appears with his 2-year-old son in the photo.

Translated from Portuguese, Brazil by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

Sérgio Abia M. nasceu em Boane, um dos distritos da província do Maputo e tem 42 anos de idade. Casado maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos, com idade de 12 anos para o primeiro e 2 anos para o segundo. Para alem dos filhos e esposa sustenta uma cunhada que vive com eles.

Sérgio estudou até 9ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras para continuar, sérgio nunca mudou se de cidade, passou a sua infância junto da família, é funcionário da Electricidade de Moçambique com funções de electricista com um horário de trabalho das 7:30 as 15:30, tem um salário mensal de 7500,00mt e poupa mensalmente 500,00mt.

Sérgio solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku pela segunda vez e primeira no Kiva, onde o primeiro foi de 13.000,00mt tendo aplicado na compra de material de construção e este também de 13.000,00mt vai continuar com a compra de material de construção. Assim o sérgio pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro dado que prevê não conclusão através deste empréstimo. Sérgio aparece na foto com o seu filho de 2 anos.

loans.use: Purchase construction material for his home

loans.name: Abduhalim

texts.en:
Abduhalim U. applied to MicroInvest in 2004 when he heard a successful loan story from his brother who improved his business terms significantly. At that moment, he worked as a cook's assistant. But thanks to the loans he was able to open his own café business. 

He is skilled and has the appropriate knowledge. He prepares the national cuisine and has repeat customers. Abduhalim makes plov (the national dish made from rice and neat), sambusa (national doughnut with meat), soups and others. 

Mr. U. Abduhalim is applying to KIVA for the financial support and asks for a business development loan of 1600 STJ for six months for the repair of his trade area. He thanks KIVA for the support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: Repair of trade area

loans.name: Vinodio Julião Dos Santos

texts.pt:
Vinodio Julião dos santos C. é natural de Boane, província de maputo e tem 21 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de um filho com dois anos, ainda vive com os pais.

Vinodio é estudante da 12ªclasse,  desde 2007 faz negocio de compra e venda de recargas de credito Mcel qual vende no estabelecimento da mãe, isto é, gere o estabelecimento em sociedade com a mãe.

Vinodio pretende com este empréstimo abrir seu próprio estabelecimento comercial, onde vai vender mais produtos dentre as cervejas. Neste momento tem tido ajuda de uma empregada e sua mãe. Onde tem de rendimento mensal liquido 3000,00mt e este constitui o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no kiva.

Vinodio pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro empréstimo afim de começar a juntar material de construção para sua casa.
texts.en:
Vinodio Julião dos Santos C. is a native of Boane, Maputo Province, and is 21 years old, married and father of a two-year-old son who still lives with his parents. Vinodio is a student in the 12th grade. Since 2007, he has bought and sold Mcel phone credits which he sells in his mother's store. That is, he runs the store in partnership with his mother. Vinodio plans to open his own store with this loan, where he will sell more products, including beer. At this time, he has had help from an employee of his mother's. He has monthly net revenue of 3000 meticais, and this is his third loan from Hluvuku and first on Kiva. Vinodio plans to repay early so that he can request another loan in order to start to assemble construction material for his house.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell products

loans.name: Khusein

texts.en:
Khusein K. applied for the first time to MicroInvest in 2008, but he recommended himself as a reliable and professional client. He has no problems with loan repayments. He is engaged in commercial service and trade, so he trades men's wear in the local bazaar. He works with the direct suppliers so he is able to trade at low prices. He has a good assortment. 

Now, Mr. Khusein K. is applying to KIVA with a request for a business development loan of 1200 STJ to import new seasonal wear. 

He thanks KIVA for the support and hopes for further cooperation.

loans.use: importing new seasonal wear

loans.name: Beatriz Rafael

texts.pt:
Beatriz Rafael T. é natural de Maputo e tem 53 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 5 filhos e de pais diferentes onde os primeiros 4 foram do seu primeiro casamento e um do segundo este que veio a perder a vida. Para alem dos filhos sustenta uma nora. Vive numa casa própria e é funcionária da educação.

Beatriz concluiu o nível médio em educação escolar, o mesmo fez depois do casamento dado que antes apenas tinha feito até 5ªclasse e começa a trabalhar como professora e dai consegue  criar condições para continuar com os estudos.

Beatriz solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku pela 3ªvez e primeira no Kiva, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para construção de uma dependência. Assim pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Beatriz Rafael T. is 53 years old and a native of Maputo. She is a widow and the mother of 5 children. The first four children are from her first marriage. The fifth child she had with her second husband, who lost his life. She supports a daughter-in-law in addition to her children.

Beatriz completed secondary school after she got married. Previously, she had studied through only fifth grade. She started to work as a teacher, thus making it possible to continue her studies.

Beatriz is asking for her third loan from Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner), which is her first with Kiva. With this loan, she intends to buy construction material to build a house. She plans to repay early and request another loan to complete the job.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
“I am a mother who has big dreams for my child”, says Julieta A., a 38-year-old mother from Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte. She aspires to having a simple, happy family life. Having little to provide for her family's needs, she worries where to get money to send her children to school.  

Her desire to help with the family expenses encourages her to have her own store, where she sells a variety of goods to her neighbors. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional stock and items to sell. By doing this, she believes she will earn a bigger income.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Chlat

texts.en:
Chlat S., 24, is married and lives with two children, her husband, her mother, and her sister in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. One of her children is a student, while other is too young to attend the school. 

She and her husband sell coconut and grow vegetables on a plot of land behind her house to earn a living and are able to make $8 a day. Her mother and her sister also help her to grow vegetables. 

Chlat S. would like to take out a loan to purchase fertilizers and the rest of the loan will be used to repair her house. (She is on the right hand side of the picture with her mother.)

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and repair house.

loans.name: Adelino João

texts.pt:
Adelino João B. é natural de Boane província do Maputo, tem 21 anos de idade, solteiro, apenas sustenta dois irmãos e a sua mãe. É professor primário com um horário das 7:00 as 12:30h, tem um salário mensal de 4700,00mt e faz poupanças por 500,00mt. Vive numa casa própria no bairro 3 de Boane.

Para Adelino este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, o primeiro foi de 10000,00mt também destinou para compra de material de construção e tomou conhecimento da existência da Hluvuku através de colegas da escola que já eram clientes.

Adelino pretende pagar antes do tempo com propósito de voltar a solicitar outro empréstimo no valor de 20000,00mt para a conclusão da sua obra.
texts.en:
Adelino João B. is a native of Boane, in the province of Maputo. He is 21 years old and single. He supports two siblings and his mother. He is an elementary school teacher and works from 7:00am to 12:30pm. He makes 4,700 Meticais (MZN) and saves 500 MZN per month. Adelino lives in his own house in Neighborhood 3 of Boane.

This is Adelino's second loan request from Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner) and his first with Kiva. The first loan was for 10,000 MZN and also to buy construction material. He learned about Hluvuku through his colleagues at school who were clients.

Adelino intends to repay the loan early and to request another in the amount of 20,000 MZN to finish the job.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea was born on April 8th, 1968, and he is married to Victorine Ijang. They are blessed with three children only one of whom is under 15 years of age. As a hard-working young man, he has faced some major challenges in life such as the death of his mother, poor health, dropping out of school and inadequate funds to continue his business. Because of all these challenges, Andrea later found GHAPE as a source of relief in 2005. In that same year, he received his fist loan of 20,000FRS, then 45,000FRS in the year 2006, and 100,000FRS in the 2008. With all these loans, his repayments were done promptly.

With the new loan, he plans to buy piglets for 100,000FRS, one month old chicks for 100,000FRS, and he will use his personal contribution of 50,000FRS to buy seedlings for gardening. Andrea will start repayment at the fourth month from the day of loan disbursement. He plans to use the profit from the loan to educate his children, expand on his business, and buy for the children’s needs. The business of Andrea will help his community by providing organic manure to them for crop cultivation and provide vegetables to the community. He is convinced the business will succeed because of the experience he has as far as the business is concerned, and he has a ready market to supply his product. 

Andrea prefers to take a loan from GHAPE because the method of repayment is good and comfortable for him, and proper follow-up is being done to ensure the loan is properly managed. 

---
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying piglets and seedlings for cultivation

loans.name: Fátima Bernardo Vetece

texts.pt:
Fátima Bernardo Vetece C. nasceu em Magude distrito nortenho da província do Maputo, tem 32 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 4 filhos. Apenas sustenta uma irmã que vive com ela dado que os filhos vivem com o pai na província de Nampula.

Fátima estudou até 8ªclasse e parou por ter ficado grávida, assim viu se obrigada ao casamento o qual durou apenas 16 anos, o divorcio foi premeditado pela transferência do marido de Maputo para Nampula e por lá conheceu outra mulher e volta para oficializar o divorcio. Neste processo os filhos passaram a viver com o marido dado que ele é que oferecia condições para o sustento.

Fátima vive neste momento na base de negocio, qual consiste na venda de produtos diversos com destaque a cerveja, refrescos e vinhos. Tem um horário de 10horas por dia de trabalho. Tem uma receita líquida mensal de 4000,00mt e consegue poupar algum.

Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e  pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de ampliar o seu estabelecimento para uma mercearia de venda de bebidas.
texts.en:
Fátima Bernardo Vetece C. is 32 years old and was born in Magude, a northern district in the province of Maputo. She is divorced and has 4 children. She supports only her sister who lives with her because the children live with their father in the province of Nampula.

Fátima studied through eighth grade and then stopped because she became pregnant, which obliged her to get married. Her marriage lasted 16 years. They got divorced because her husband was transferred from Maputo to Nampula, where he met another woman, and he returned to finalize the divorce. During this process the children went to live with their father because he had the conditions to support them.

Currently Fátima makes her living from her business selling a variety of products, including beer, soda, and wine. She works 10 hours a day, makes 4,000 Meticais (MZN) monthly, and is able to save some.

This is her second loan from Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner). She intends to repay it early and request another loan to grow her establishment into a grocer's shop for selling drinks.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than S., 27, is married and resides with her two children and her husband in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been growing different kinds of vegetables to earn a living and is able to make $4 per day, while her husband is a construction foreman and makes $5 a day. Their two children are too young to attend school.

Mrs. Than S. would like to take out a loan of $700 to purchase more construction tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more construction tools.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom S. is a 29-year-old resident of the Pursat Province. He makes breads by himself in his home and sells them to his customers by going from market to market in his local area. He can earn an income of approximately $3 each day. Mom is married to Mrs.Tin Chan, 29, who is the mother of four children, all of whom are still young and attend school. She sells vegetables to help supplement the family income. To earn additional income, Mom has applied for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to begin a motor-taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to begin a motor-taxi service

loans.name: Sros

texts.en:
Sros Y., 36, is married and lives with four of her children and her husband in the Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She works selling various kinds of vegetables in the market to earn a living and is able to make $3 of profit each day, while her husband is a pig breeder on a plot of land behind the house. On average, he makes $5 a day.

Sros Y. is asking a loan from Kiva of $1000 to expand by adding more pigs and purchase feed for them as well.

loans.use: Raise pigs and purchase feed

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Mùa năm nay 41 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại huyện Mê Linh- Hà Nội. Năm 2003 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư và chăn nuôi, đến nay công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập ổn định .Bên cạnh đó hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm khoản thu nhập từ lương làm thêm của chồng nên kinh tế gia đình chị Mùa đang ngày càng phát triển vói mức thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng  vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư M. bò và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs Trần Thị Mùa is 41 years old. She lives in Mê Linh district, Hà Nội with her her husband and their 2 children. In 2003, she received a loan from TYM fund to start raising livestock. Today she and her family have a stable income, their business is well. Her husband works and his salary contributes toward the family's finance so they are well off. Their combined income is 5.000.000 VND a month. This round of loan she is requesting 15.000.000 VND to buy cows and feed for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cows and feed for the animals

loans.name: Ploak

texts.en:
Ploak S. is married and lives with three of her children and her husband in the Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers who grow rice and sugar cane and sell them to the market-wholesaler to earn a living and are able to make $5 each day. Ploak Savornn is pictured while she was drying her rice crops. This couple is also supported by their three children who work growing vegetables, in a hotel, and as a security guard at Angkor Temple.

Mrs. Ploak S. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. This will allow them to save money, as before they used public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Ploak

texts.en:
Ploak S., 39, is married and lives with four of her children and her husband in the Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She purchases and sells rice to the market-wholesaler to earn a living and is able to make $8 each day, while her husband grows rice and many kinds of vegetables. On average, he makes $4 a day to help support the family. This couple is also supported by one child who works in a salon.

Mrs. Ploak S. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to expand her rice stock.

loans.use: To expand rice stock.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica was born in 1950.  She later married and was blessed with two children, though her husband died.  As a widow, she has struggled to raise money and care for her children, making life very difficult for her.  In the year 2007, Margaret found GHAPE and enrolled herself in the program.  She was first given a loan of 40,000 FRS, and she managed to successfully pay off the loan promptly. 

Monica is now requesting a loan of 200,000 FRS, in which she plans to buy coco yams for “achu” production.  “Achu” is one of the most common foods in the Northwest region of Cameroon; it is produced from matched coco yams and is eaten with yellow soup.  She will spend her 200,000 FRS loan accordingly: 40,000 FRS for coco yams, 10,000 FRS for palm wine and 150,000 FRS for drinks.

Monica promises to start repaying her loan the day it is disbursed. She is convinced her business will succeed due to her experience in the industry, the business location and customer loyalty.  Her business will also help the community by providing food for them at moderate prices, reducing their costs of living.

Monica also promises to pay for her grandchildren's school fees, food for her family and needed medications with the profit from her business. She prefers to receive loans from GHAPE because no collateral security is needed in order for the loan to be disbursed.  Also, the repayment schedule is comfortable and convenient.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying coco yams for "achu", palm wine, and beer

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun P., 34, is married with two young children, living at home in the province of Siem Reap. She works in a grocery store, typically making $8 USD per day.  Her husband, Him Beuy, grows rice, typically making $5 USD per day.  

Chhun P. would like a loan of $1000 USD to add more inventory to her grocery store to attract more clients.

loans.use: To add more grocery inventory.

loans.name: Lus

texts.en:
Lus N., 35, is married and lives with her two children and husband in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia.  She weaves palm leaves to make roofs and sells them to the local market in order to earn a living.  Lus is able to make $4 USD per day.  Her husband grows sugar cane, and he makes $5 USD per day.  

Lus N. would like to take out a loan of $500 USD to purchase fertilizers for her husband to put on his farmland.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Tình năm nay 50 tuổi, Chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương đã được 13 năm. Gia đình chị có 5 người con trong đó có 4 người con đã trưỏng thành và có công việc ổn định. Hiện tại nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị là từ buôn bán hàng tạp hoá, lương công nhân của chồng và sự hỗ trợ của các con. Với mức thu nhập khoảng 5.000.000đ/ tháng gia đình chị Tình đang là một trong những hộ gia đình có kinh tế ổn định trong thôn.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm hàng hoá phục vụ cho nhu cầu tiêu dùng của nhân dân trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Mrs Tình is 50 years old. She is a TYM fund member for the last 13 years. She has 5 children, 4 of which are grown up and hold a stable job. Currently her family main income comes from the grocery store, her husband's salary and her children's contribution. With an income of 5.000.000 VND a month, her family's finance is considered as solid. This round of loan Mrs Tình is requesting 15.000.000 VND to buy more products for her store in preparation for the upcoming Tet festivities.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more products for her grocery store

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is married to Nkain Cletus, and they are blessed with six children, two of whom are under 15 years of age. They live in a three-room house in Nanga-Street, in the Bamenda-NW region of Cameroon. Immaculate has decided to work extra hard to help her husband raise their large family. She has faced many challenges in life, including inadequate funding for her business and ill health. These challenges made life uncomfortable for her until Sept.18, 2007 when she discovered GHAPE and became a member. In that same year, Immaculate received her first loan, which she has successfully repaid. She plowed the profit she made right back into her business.

Immaculate will start repayments on this loan on the day it is disbursed. She strongly believes that her business will succeed because of the way she approaches her customers, the way she displays her goods and the experience she already has in the business. She also is proud of the fact that her business helps her town by paying taxes that foster economic growth. With the profit from the business, she plans to pay her children's school fees, and continue to expand her business. She prefers to receive loans from GHAPE because of the education it offers, and because the method of repayment is convenient

loans.use: To buy corn, beans and groundnut for resale

loans.name: Cham

texts.vi:
Chị Vũ Thị Châm 34 tuổi hiện  đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ tại huyện Mê Linh- Hà Nội. Chị Châm tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1995. Vòng vốn đầu chị sử dụng để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Sau một thời gian sử dụng vốn hiệu quả gia đình chị đã có thêm nguồn vốn để đầu tư vào xưởng mộc của gia đình. Hiện tại cùng với chăn nuôi đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị 
Với số vốn 10.000.000 đ mong muốn được vay trong vòng vốn tới chị Châm có kế hoạch sẽ sử dụng để đầu tư thêm vốn mua gỗ phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất, kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. V. Thi Cham is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 small children in the district of Me Linh - Ha Noi. She has been a member of TYM fund since 1995. Her first loan was used to invest in raising farm animals. The loan program was so effective that after a period of time, her family was able to save enough to invest in a carpentry/lumber business. Presently, this business and raising farm animals are their main sources of income. With the next loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to purchase additional lumber for her carpentry business

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in carpentry

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
“I live in the kitchen. My whole life is spent more on cooking foods, which is of great help to earn a living", says Evelyn G., a 36-year-old mother of four children, from Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte. Her husband raises pigs and both of them contribute fully to provide for the needs of their children.

She owns a small restaurant which operates 24-hours a day near the pier area. She never gets tired of working just to save enough money for her children’s education. She cooks well and is able to cater to all of her customers with satisfaction.

She is requesting a loan to purchase additional utensils for the restaurant and piglets for her husband. She says “The time will come that I don’t need to buy meats from the market and have them cooked for my customers. We are raising pigs for our small restaurant to augment our income".

loans.use: To purchase 5 more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.vi: Chị Dương Thị Hoa năm nay 44 tuổi, gia đình chị có 5 nguời con trong đó có 3 con đã trưởng thành. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1996. Trong suốt 12 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị Hoa luôn chấp hành tốt các quy định của Quỹ sử dụng vốn hiệu quả và hoàn trả vốn đúng hạn,. Hiện tại hàng tháng ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm khoản thu nhập ổn định từ lương làm bảo vệ của chồng nên cuộc sống gia đình chị đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị Hoa  mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm bò về nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. D. Thi Hoa is 44 years old. Her family has 5 children, and 3 are grown. She has been a member of TYM fund since 1996. For the 12 years that she has been with the fund, she always complied with all stipulations, using the loans effectively and repaid the loans on time. In addition to raising farm animals, her family also has additional income from her husband as a security guard, and thus their standard of living has gradually improved. For the next loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to purchase additional cows to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase additional cows to raise

loans.name: Bich

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Bích năm nay 55 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện tại chị đang kinh doanh thực phẩm khô tại chợ  thị xã Phúc Yên. Hàng tháng  ngoài thu nhập từ kinh doanh  buôn bán gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ việc cho công nhân  thuê phòng trọ. Với mức thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng việc hoàn trả vốn của gia đình chị Bích rất thuận lợi.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh hàng khô.
texts.en:
Ms. P. Thi Bich is 55 years old, and joned TYM fund in 2003. Currently she has a grocery store at the market in the town of Phuc Yen. Every month, in addition to her store, she also makes extra money by renting out rooms to her employees. With average income of 360 USD per month, the loan program is very effective for her. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to invest in her grocery store

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Il's Group

texts.en:
This is a small borrowing group of 5 members and Mrs. S. is the group leader. Il S., 28, is tailor from her house in Romchek 1 Village. She has a small store and runs her tailoring business to make modern clothes and custom orders. Il is able to earn $2.80 per day. She is married with one child. Her husband is motorcycle taxi driver. To increase the amount of clothes produced and satisfy her customers, Il is requesting a loan to purchase more fabrics to use for her business. The other four members of the group are:

Mrs. Youk H., 48, is Khmer rice cake seller and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

Mrs. Hing C., 35, is grocery seller and she is requesting a loan to use for her husband's business.

Mrs. Sin K., 37, is a carpenter and is requesting a loan to use for her business.

Mrs. Vong K., 45, is church staff member and is requesting a loan to use for her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric to use for her business

loans.name: Hai

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Hải năm nay 55 tuổi gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành. Năm 2003  chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán. Hiện nay cả hai vợ chồng chị đều làm công việc kinh doanh buôn bán thịt lợn. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị Hải. 
Vòn vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư cho công việc kinh daonh buôn bán của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. T. Thi Hai is 55 years old. She has 3 children who are all grown. In 2003 she joined TYM fund to borrow money to invest in some sort of business. Currently she and her husband are working together in their business of selling pork. This business is Ms. Hai's main source of incom for her family. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: Née vers 1975 à Abomey dont elle est originaire .Dame A. Alice fréquenta jusqu'en classe de CE2 avant d'abandonner pour apprendre la couture pendant 3 ans. Finalement elle préfèra le commerce dans lequel elle s'est lancée voiçi 15 ans déjà.Elle vendit au premier abord des épices ,puis elle commença à vendre divers articles qu'elle achète chez les Chinois:Assièttes,pagnes,ustensiles de cuisine,chaussure et autres pacotilles.Pour la vente de ces divers articles elle est ambulante.C'est pour le renforcement de cette activité à la fin des fêtes de fin d'année,qu'elle sollicite ce 3ème crédit pour s'approvisionner uniquement en chaussure.Mariée,elle a deux enfants:Abraham et Cathérine.
texts.en:
Born around 1975 in Abomey, the town she is from, Ms. Alice A. attended school through the 3rd grade before dropping out to learn how to sew, which she did for three years. In the end, she preferred commerce, in which she got started fifteen years ago already. At first, she sold spices and then started selling various items from China: plates, pagnes (colorful African-style cloth), kitchen utensils, shoes, and other cheap items. These are sold door-to-door. To boost this business for the year-end holiday season, she is requesting this third loan to get supplies of shoes only. Ms. A. is married and has two children: Abraham and Cathérine.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Three boxes of shoes

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.fr: Originaire d'Abomey,dame H. Clarisse est née vers 1975 à Porto-Novo.Elle n'a pas été à l'école et très tôt elle a été initiée par sa mère au commerce.En effet ,cette dernière était revendeuse de médicament au marché noir.Ainsi dame HEKOUINON a commencé à vendre de médicament avant de se lancer dans la vente divers articles:fournitures scolaires ,chaussures,pots et bouquets de fleur.Cela fait presque 10 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité et c'est pour la renforcer  à l'approche des fêtes qu'elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt de 100000fcfa pour s'approvisionner en fleur et chaussure.
texts.en:
Mrs. Clarisse H. is originally from Abomey, she was born in 1975 in Porto-Novo. She did not attend school, and very early on her mother introduced her to the business. Indeed, she was a black market medicine reseller. Thus Mrs. H. started selling medicine before selling various articles: school supplies, shoes, flowers, and pots. She has been practicing this activity for the last 10 years and to strengthen her business with the Holidays nearing she is requesting this 3rd loan of 100,000 CFA (USD 200) to stock up on flowers and shoes.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 10 dozens of flower bouquet, 10 dozens pairs of shoes

loans.name: Sen's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan that is comprised of four members all residing in Odombang Commune in Battambang Province. Mrs. Sen S., 36, sells different kinds of fruits in an area near the bus station. She started this business in 2006 and earns approximately $4 per day. She takes care of five children, all of whom are young and are going to school. Her husband, Chan Chom Rong, age 42, is a farmer. To earn extra income, Sen is requesting a loan to purchase piglets to raise and to buy more fruits for sale. She is the leader of three other members listed below:

Thet S. is a 52-year-old fruit seller. She is requesting a loan to buy piglets to raise and fruits.

Sam S., 38, is a housewife and is requested a loan to run a new store to sell fruit.

Sen S., 34, sells vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits for her store to sell.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Née vers 1948 à Sèhouè,dame DEKPAMAKO Marguérite est originaire d'Abomey.D'une mère revendeuse ,elle fut très tôt initiée par cette dernière  et ne mit jamais pied à l'école. Ainsi ,dame D. Marguérite  aidait sa mère à revendre des tissus, pagnes, et autres articles dans sa tendre enfance .Par la suite,à son propre compte,elle se mit à vendre des médicaments au marché noir ,mais aussi des liqueurs .Cette activité ,elle va l'abandonner pour la vente  de fleurs,chaussures,articles de solde s des grands magasins et autres .C'est pour renforcer cette activité,qu'elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt pour s'approvisionner en chaussure pour homme,femme et enfants.Mariée,elle est mère de 6 enfants.
texts.en:
Originaire d'Abomey,dame HEKOUINON Clarisse est née vers 1975 à Porto-Novo.Elle n'a pas été à l'école et très tôt elle a été initiée par sa mère au commerce.En effet ,cette dernière était revendeuse de médicament au marché noir.Ainsi dame HEKOUINON a commencé à vendre de médicament avant de se lancer dans la vente divers articles:fournitures scolaires ,chaussures,pots et bouquets de fleur.Cela fait presque 10 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité et c'est pour la renforcer à l'approche des fêtes qu'elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt de 100000fcfa pour s'approvisionner en fleur et chaussure.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Approvisionnement:2 cartons de chaussures

loans.name: Nam Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Năm 33 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Thời gian đầu  tham gia vào Quỹ chị  Năm  vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Sau 4 năm tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và học hỏi kinh nghiệm kinh doanh đến nay ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn đang đầu tư vốn để sản xuất và kinh doanh hàng mã. Hiện tại cả hai vợ chồng chị Năm đều tham gia sản xuất và kinh doanh mặt hàng này.  Với mức thu nhập bình quân đạt 5.000.000đ/ tháng  kinh tế gia đình chị Năm đang ngày càng ổn đinh và phát triển hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để mua nguyên liệu phục vụ cho  công việc sản xuất và kinh doanh hàng mã của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nam Thi N., 33 years old, joined the Fund in 2004. In the beginning Mrs. N. borrowed money to invest in raising livestock and planting trees. After 4 years of participating in the Fund and learning and developing her business skills, today besides the livestock business she also invests in manufacturing and selling funerary goods. Currently she and her husband both contribute to the work in manufacturing and selling these goods everyday. With their average income reaching 5,000,000 VND/month, the family's finances are becoming more stable day by day and is also growing. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to buy more raw materials to use in the manufacturing and sales business of funerary goods of the family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials for manufacturing

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Dương Thị Tỉnh tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Gia đình chị Tỉnh có 5 người con trong đó có 4 con đang tuổi đến trường. Hiện tại gia chị đang có một cửa hàng ăn tại  huyện Bình Xuyên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng. Với mức thu nhập ổn định này kinh tế gia đình chị Tỉnh đang ngày càng  phát triển hơn. Vì vậy gia định chị cũng có điều kiện hơn trong việc chăm sóc và đầu tư cho các con đi học,
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để thêm vốn đầu tư mua thực phẩm và đồ dùng phục vụ cho việc kinh doanh hàng ăn của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs Dương Thị Tỉnh participates in TYM fund since 2003. She has 5 children, 4 of which are still in school. Her family runs a restaurant in Bình Xuyên district, province of Vĩnh Phúc. Her family income is 5.000.000 VND a month. With a stable income, her family financial condition improves and it allows her to provide a good education for her children. This round of loan she is requesting 15.000.000 VND to stock up on food and some needed things for her family restaurant.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more stock for her restaurant

loans.name: Chun's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group of three members. 

Mrs. S. was selected to be group leader. Chun S., 26, is an ice-cream seller in Battambang Town, which is located in the west of Cambodia. She is married to Mr. Sok Vanny who is motorcycle taxi driver. They have one child. Her older sister and aunt also live with family. 

To bring more income, S. needs a loan to purchase a cart to transport her ice-cream to sell by transporting it to the customer's home. 

The other three are:
Mrs. S., 46, is a seller of cooked rice and needs a loan to use for her business. 
Mrs. Yen K., 45, is housewife and needs a loan to use for her husband's business. 
Mrs. Van Y., 57, is vegetable seller and needs a loan to use for her husband's business. 
These people live in Orchar Village, Battambang Province.

loans.use: to purchase a cart to transport her ice-cream

loans.name: Thich Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Thích năm nay 42 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Trong suốt 7 năm tham gia Quỹ  chị Thích  sử dụng vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Bên cạnh đó gia đình chị còn đầu tư mua máy say sát để sát gạo phục vụ cho nhu cầu của bà con địa phương. Hiện taị với mức thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng từ chăn nuôi, say sát  cuộc sống của  gia đình  chị Thích đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay mức vốn 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thóc về sát thành gạo bán nhằm tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Thich Thi N., 42 years old, has been participating in the Fund since 2007. In the 7 years of participating in the Fund, Mrs. N. used the loan to invest in her livestock and tree farming ventures. Besides that, her family also bought a milling machine to grind rice as a service for the local townspeople. Currently with an income of 6,000,000 VND/month from raising livestock and grinding rice, the family's quality of life is gradually improving. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in buying harvested rice to process into edible rice in order to increase the family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw harvested rice to process into edible rice

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đinh Thị Lạc năm nay 48 tuổi,  chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương đã được 5 năm. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi cả hai vợ chồng chị Lạc đều đang đi buôn bán gạo. Công việc kinh doanh thuận lợi đem lại cho gia đình chị nguồn thu nhập ổn định khoảng 5.000.000đ/ tháng. Với nguồn thu nhập này gia đình chị Lạc cũng có điều kiện hơn để cải thiện cuộc sống và đầu tư cho các con đi học.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn kinh doanh và  mua thêm lợn, thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs Đinh Thị Lạc is 48 years old, a TYM fund member for the last 5 years. Currently she and her husband raise pigs and sells/trades rice. The business is stable and it brings in 5.000.000.VND a month for her family. With this income, her family's living condition has improved and they are able to provide good education for their children. For this round of loan, Mrs Lạc is requesting 20.000.000 VND to invest in their rice business, buy more pigs to raise and buy feed for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Freny

texts.en:
Freny D., a 66-year-old widow from Butuan City, Agusan Del Sur, started her business in 2004. After her husband's death, she has solely managed the business to support herself.

She is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 to purchase dry goods and vegetables. She also looks into some other  opportunities to have additional income. She aspires to own another business like raising hogs because this is what her late husband liked to do.

Looking wearily at how she can sustain her income, she admitted that her husband was more familiar in business. “CEVI really helped me operate my business,” she said. “Now, I’m also making use of credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage from them.”

loans.use: To purchase dry goods and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Thao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thảo năm nay 49 tuổi, chị đang sống tại xã Cao Minh - Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh phúc. Năm 1996 chị Thảo tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và buôn bán nồi đất. Nhờ chăm chỉ làm ăn  nên công việc chăn nuôi, buôn bán  ngày càng phát triển giúp cho kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng ổn định hơn. Hiện tại chị Thảo đang đầu tư vốn để chăn nuôi lợn. Bên cạnh đó hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thên nguồn thu nhập từ lương làm bảo vệ của chồng  nên kinh tế gia đình rất ổn định với mức thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Thảo xin vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn và  thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Thao Thi N., 49 years old, livest in the town of Cao Minh - Phuc Yen, province of Vinh Phuc. She joined the Fund in 1996 and borrowed money to invest in raising livestock and selling clay pots. Thanks to her hardwork, the livestock and clay pot sales expanded and increased day by day, helping her family's finances become more stable. Currently Mrs. N. is investing in raising pigs. Besides that, her family also has a monthly income from her husband's salary as a security guard, so her family's finances are very secure with an income of 6,000,000 VND/month. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in buying more pigs and feed for the livestock business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy pigs, feed

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina M. is 55 years old and has three children. Her husband, a retired army soldier, just died last August 2008. She said that the pains still endure when she remembers the death of her husband. To ease that pain, she just turns all her attention to her children and grandchildren.

To support her family well, she sells food at their house. People come to their house and buy food to eat. She is requesting a loan of Php 5,000 to CEVI to purchase ingredients and food items to sell. 

“I am happy because I am a member of The CEVI credit program,” she said. “They really help us to strive more in our lives and hope to achieve good future for our children." 

Now, she enjoys making use of credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage that CEVI offers to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and food items to sell.

loans.name: Sau Thi

texts.vi: Chị Vũ Thị Sáu 38 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Ngoài ra hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ việc đánh bắt cua cá nên cuộc sống gia đình đang ngày càng ổn định hơn. Nhờ có thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng gia đình chị  Sáu cũng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống và đầu  tư cho  các con ăn học. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000 đ để đầu tư mua nguyên vật liệu sửa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm lợn về chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sau Thi V. is 38 years old. She joined the Fund in 1999. Currently her family's main source of income is raising livestock and farming trees. Besides that the family also has an income from fishing and crabbing, so their finances are becoming more stable day by day. Thanks to a monthly income of 6,000,000 VND/month, Mrs. V. and her family are much more able to improve their quality of life and pay for their children's schooling. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in materials to renovate the livestock pen and buying more pigs to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovating livestock pen, buying pigs

loans.name: Ha Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hà 34 tuổi, chị tham gia  Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị Hà là từ buôn bán hàng tạp hoá và chăn nuôi với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Bên cạnh đó  chồng chị làm nghề xây dựng nên hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập khoảng 3.000.000đ. Với mức thu nhập ổn định này cuộc sống của gia đìnhchị Hà đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
Chị Hà mong muốn vòng vốn tới được vay thêm 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm hàng hoá phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con trong dịp Tết nguyên đán sắp tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ha Thi N., 34 years old, joined the Fund in 2003. Currently her family's main source of income is trading and selling general goods and raising livestock with an income of 3,000,000 VND/month. Besides that main business, her husband also works as a construction worker so the family has a supplemental income of 3,000,000 VND/month. With this stable income, the family's quality of life is improving day by day. Mrs. N. would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND in this round of funding to invest in buying more goods to serve the demands of her customers in the upcoming Tet New Year's holiday.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Ket's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group of three members. Ket S., 38, makes Cambodian noodles for sale. She makes them from her house and she has been working at her business since 2000. S. is married to Mr. Khoeun Ponlok and has nine children. Her husband is pig raiser and helps his wife to make noodles. To increase her productivity and alleviate works, she needs a loan to purchase a machine to use for her noodle making business.

The other two member are: Mrs. Sanh P., 42, makes fish paste to sell and needs a loan to expand her business.

Mrs. Kit S., 46, makes Cambodia noodles for sale and raisies pigs. She needs a loan to expand her business.

The people live in Prekroch Village, Battambang Province.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to use for her noodle making business

loans.name: Noriniso

texts.en: R. Noriniso applied first to MicroInvest in 2008. She trades in fruits, salads, vegetables and greens. She works with suppliers of fruits, she makes salads herself and she sells greens that she grows herself. Mrs. R. Noriniso has recommended herself already as a client as she has not delayed loan repayments. Now she is applying to KIVA for a loan of 1000 STJ for 5 months for opening a new trade outlet in the crowded bazaar, which will help her to increase her business. She thanks KIVA for its help and support.

loans.use: Open a new trade outlet

loans.name: Mukadam

texts.ru: Шарипова Мукадам женщина в возросте 40 лет , замужем имеет троих детей.Сама работает фармацевтом в аптеке.За товаром ездиет сама. Скоро её брат хочет женится, и Мукадам хочет подарить ему холодильник.Мукадам узнала о потребительских кредитах от своих подруг и решила обратится к нам в Микроинвест.Она благодарна что существуют такие кредиты.Мукадам как старшая сестра хочет внести свой вклад для новобрачных.
texts.en:
Mukadam S. is 40 years old, married and has three children. She works as a pharmacist at a pharmacy and delivers merchandise herself. Her brother is getting married soon, and Mukadam wants to give him a refrigerator as a gift. She found out about this lending program from her friends and is very grateful that this opportunity exists. As the older sister, Mukadam wants to contribute to the soon-to-be-married couple.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refrigerator purchase

loans.name: Phong's Group

texts.en:
There are four borrowers in this group, which is made up of people who live in the Kompong Pras Commune in Battambang Province. Mrs. Phong T. is 33 years old. She owns and runs a store in front of her house, where she sells beef soup and roast beef to customers who come to eat in her house. She currently earns approximately $4 per day. She is married to Lot Sitha, age 35, who is a rice farmer who also works with her. They have two children, both of whom are in school. T. hopes to expand her business, which is why she is applying for this loan.

The remainder of borrowers in this loan group are:

Mrs. Lay T., 33, is a teacher who also sells cakes to students. She is requesting a loan to buy motorcycle-repairing materials for her husband's business.

Mrs. Lay T., 28, is a primary-school teacher. Her husband, Som Ol, 40, is buying a car which he will resell at a profit. T. is requesting funds to use as a capital for her husband's business.

Mrs. Pech L., 54, runs a well-digging business and has several employees. She is seeking a loan to buy more well-making materials which will make this work easier.

loans.use: To expand various small businesses

loans.name: Louis

texts.fr: Le vieux B., à côté de ses activités de gardien, fait du nettoyage. Il arrive à renforcer ses modestes revenus pour couvrir les besoins familiaux. Il habite le quartier de Tiléne et sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter sa production et par conséquent ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Elderly Mr. B. works as a cleaner aside from his work as a caretaker. He manages to boost his modest income for meeting family needs. He lives in the Tiléne district and is requesting this loan to increase his productivity and consequently his net revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cleaning

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina M. is 42 years old and the mother of seven children. She never stops dreaming a good life for her family and has devoted her whole life to ensuring that her children are well cared for and have enough food to eat. 

To earn enough money to support her children, she grows and sells vegetables in her neighborhood. She also raises chickens for additional income.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and grow vegetables for sale. She is also looking into  other possible areas to generate income to support her family well.

By joining CEVI, she has access to the credit, training and insurance coverage we offer to all of our clients.

loans.use: To buy seeds to grow vegetables for sale

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.en: M. Khairullo lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan, where he lives with his wife and three beloved children. Mr. M. makes a living running a small grocery store. Before MicroInvest loans became available, he traded in rice but thanks to MicroInvest loans he now owns his own company. He is proud of the fact that he has a good assortment of items to sell to his customers--sugar, sweets, bread, meat products, cheese, beer, juices, tinned stewed meat, perfumes and other items. He has applied to Kiva for a new loan to repair and upgrade his store. Mr. M. thanks Kiva for its support and for the help it provides to small businesses like his.

loans.use: to repair tand upgrade his store

loans.name: Ngyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiền năm nay 48 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành và có công việc làm ổn định. Hiện tại nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình chị là dựa vào chăn nuôi và sự hỗ trợ  của các con. Mặc dù chồng chị không may mất sớm nhưng nhờ chăn chỉ làm ăn nên thu nhập của gia đình chị luôn ổn định ở mức 4.000.000đ/ tháng . Với mức thu nhập này cuộc sống của chị và các con đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chịmong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ngyuen Thi H. is 48 years old. She has three adult children with stable jobs. Currently, her main source income comes from animal husbandry and from her children's help. Although her husband passed away early, because of hard work, her family's income is steadily maintained at 4000000 dong (Vietnamese dollars) per month. At this income level, Mrs. Nguyen and her children's live is improved day by day. She hopes to borrow 10000000 Vietnamese dollars to buy more pigs and feed for livestocks.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is 42 years old and married with two children. She makes a living selling fish and has been in this business for a long time. She buys her fish from various places and sells them in Benin City. Demand for her fish is high. She has applied for a loan to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Phách năm nay 50 tuổi, chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại xã Cao Minh thị xã Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc. Năm 1997 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tìnhthương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện nay ngoài chăn  nuôi gia đình chị còn đầu tư mở xưởng mộc chuyên sản xuất và bán các lại đồ gia đụng. Bên cạnh đó  để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình  chồng chị  còn làm thêm nghề xe ôm. Vì thế thu nhập của gia đình chị luôn ổn định ở mức 6.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để mua thêm gỗ đầu tư cho xưởng mộc
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi P. is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and two children at the village of Phuc Yen in the town of Cao Minh, Vinh Phuc province. She joined TYM Fund in 1997 to borrow fund for investing in raising livestock. Currently, besides her livestock business, she also invests in a factory specializing in producing household utensils. In order to increase her income, her husband also works as a motorbike cabbie (Instead of a car, motorbike cabbies takes passengers on motorbikes for fares). Her family's income is at a stable 6,000,000 Vietnamese dollars per month. Sheb wishes to borrow 10,000,000 Vietnamese dollars (600 USD) to buy additional lumber for her factory.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget O. is 27 years old and married with 3 children. She sells foodstuffs like garri, yam, beans, etc. in Uselu Market, Benin city, Edo state, Nigeria. Bridget needs the loan amount of N40, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence I. is 56 years old and married with 7 children. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is happy because the demands for her goods will increase during and after the festive season. She needs the loan amount of N70, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs, provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.en: S. Zulfiniso lives in the B. Gafurov region. She has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2002. She is married with 3 children. Mrs. S. has been engaged in the family business of livestock for 12 years. She has a milk cow and 4 bulls. Her milk cow gives 10 liters per day and she sells the milk to the collective farm and also makes curd. Mrs.S. is applying for a business development loan of 3000 STJ for 2 months for winter projects and heating her cow barn. She thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: Heating the barn

loans.name: Sa's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan of four members. Mr. Sa M. is 37 years old and makes a living by buying cows from far places to raise and sell back after fattening them for a week or two. He is married with four children, all of whom are students and are living at home. His wife, So Mash, 37, sells roasted beef in front of her house. To enlarge the business, M. is applying for a loan to purchase an oxen.

M. is the leader of this group that has three members as below:

San S., 29, is selling vegetables and fish. She needs a loan to buy more fish to sell. Ny A., a cake seller, is 56 years old, is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell. Rim Y., age 18, is a fish seller who is seeking a loan for her husband to buy a fishing boat.

They all live in Vattamem Commune in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: A. Manzura lives in the B.Gafurov region. She is a loving mother and grandmother. She has been engaged in the family business of livestock  for 40 years so she has taken care of animals all her life. She helped her mother when she was young and continued when she got married. She has 2 cows and 3 bulls. She dreams of having a milk cow so she decided to apply to KIVA for a business development loan of 2000 STJ for 6 months fto purchase a milk cow. She thanks KIVA in advance for its support.

loans.use: Purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim L., 40, and her husband, Mr. Sophorn Horn, 39, live in a small village across from the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1988 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of their children study in local school and the oldest one weaves silk at home. 

Lim has been a silk weaver for 5 years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to middlemen in the village, who sell them in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been building wooden houses for 5 years. The couple also grows rice in their rice farm near the village.

Lim is requesting a loan of $500. She will use some of it to purchase silk materials for her weaving business. With the remainder, she will buy fertilizer, pesticide, and rice seed for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and rice seed for growing.

loans.name: Thi Hoa's Group

texts.vi:
Trần Thị Hoa sinh năn 1962 (mã số 010117050051) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.578.000 vnđ để đầu tư kinh doanh vận chuyển sắt vụn. Cô đang ở cùng chồng và con gái. chồng cô làm nghề lái xe có thu nhập ổn định khoảng 5.000.000 vnđ/ tháng. Con gái cô đang theo học phổ thong. Cô là người nhiệt tình và có ý thức hoàn trả vốn tốt. Cô làm nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có:
 Nguyễn Thị Mỹ sinh năm 1953(mã số 010117050053) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
 Nguyễn Thị Phượng sinh năm 1975 (mã số 010117050054 ) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn.
 Nguyễn Thị Dịch sinh năm 1953 (mã số 010117050052 ) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đi chợ rau.
 Trần Thị Liên sinh năm 1982 (mã số 010117050056 ) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư ao cá.
 Trần Thị Nhài sinh năm 1965 (mã số 010117050055 ) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà.
texts.en:
Mrs. T. Thi Hoa was born in 1962. She would like to borrow 4,578,000 VND to invest in scrap metal transporting business. She lives with her husband and daughter. Her husband is a driver with an income of 5,000,000 VND per month. Her daughter is in grade school. Mrs. T. is an enthusiastic person and a conscientious borrower who wants to repay her loan on time. She is the team leader of her group, which includes the following people: _N. Thi My, born in 1953 who wishes to borrow 4,142,000 VND for raising pigs _N. Thi Phuong, born in 1975 who wishes to borrow 4,142,000 VND for raising pigs. _N. Thi Dich, born in 1953 who wishes to borrow 4,142,000 VND for produce selling business. _T. Thi Lien, born in 1982 who wishes to borrow 4,142,000 VND to invest in raising fish. _T. Thi Nhai, born in 1965 who wishes to borrow 4,142,000 VND to invest in raising chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: chăn nuôi

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Greetings from J.Pierre  R. in Kigali, Rwanda! 

J.Pierre is 31 years old, married with one child.
