He owns a small shop in his local area. He sells domestic materials like soap, maize flour, cassava flour, matchboxes, salt, sugar, beans, Colgate, paraffin and biscuits. From all his business activities, he earns about $150 per month. He employs two people to help him running this business.

J.Pierre is requesting a loan of 500,000 Rwf, which will help him to expand his business. This loan will be repaid in eight months.

loans.use: Expand his Business

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina A. sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to stock her shop with all that her customers need. She is 40 years old and married with six children. 

Justina hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs, drinks and provisions to sell. 

She says a big thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Abibatu U. has a machine that she uses to grind cereal. She also sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, plantains, etc. She makes more profits from the sales of foodstuffs. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. 

She is 36 years old and married with three children. 

She says a big thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra is a widow. She has two grown children and many grandchildren. She sells various home products in her small kiosk located at the central city market. Her working capital is 6,000 UAH and her gross monthly income is 3,000 UAH.

Alexandra has been in this business for 12 years now. She was able to develop her business due to HOPE loans. She tried selling different goods. The type of goods she sells now have turned out to be the best for her. 

Alexandra is a caring mother and grandmother. She continues to work to help her grandchildren have a better life. She is a very optimistic and hard-working person. 

Alexandra would like to get a loan of 3,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She paid back all seven previous loans without a single delay and said that the loans helped her to sustain her business.

loans.use: to increase inventory for kiosk

loans.name: Victory

texts.en:
Victory I. is 35 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a police officer. She sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to her customers. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. 

She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en:
Inobat S. is married and has three children. She lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is engaged in the family business of raising livestock. Mrs. S. Inobat is skilled in the livestock business, having done this for 10 years. She takes care of a milk cow and also sells the milk to the collective farm and makes yogurt products. 

Mrs. S. Inobat dreams of having sheep to make yarn. Now Mrs. Inobat S. asks KIVA for business support of a loan of 2000 STJ over six months for the purchase of special dairy-making equipment that permits her to increase the production and sale of yogurt products.

loans.use: Purchase of special yogurt making equipment

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria O. sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is 42 years old and married with three children. Her eldest child is studying medicine at the University of Benin. 

She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell. 

She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel O. lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 34 years old and married with three children. She sells foodstuffs like crayfish, melon, beans, etc. 

Mabel needs a loan of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. 

She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en:
Adesuwa E. sells yams in bulk and individually in New Benin Market in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 49 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a farmer. 

She needs the loan amount of N70, 000 to purchase more yams to sell. 

She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is divorced. She sells women's clothing at the central market of Melitopol city. Good pricing and excellent client service bring her repeated clients all the time. Her gross monthly income is 5,000 UAH, invested in goods capital equals 7,000 UAH.

Tamara is very experienced in clothing sales. She has been in this business for 15 years already. She says she will continue to sell women's clothing because that is what she just loves to do. She always greets her clients with a nice smile and suggests the best clothing that fits them well.

Tamara is asking for a loan for 3,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to receive additional income and finally finish fixing her apartment.

loans.use: to increase clothing inventory

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia A. sells gallons of palm oil. Palm oil is an essential commodity in Nigeria. The demand for her palm oil is high. She is 34 years old and married with 8 children. Felicia needs the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more gallons of palm oil to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more gallons of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en:
Eldaniz A. is 43 years old and has run his cattle breeding business in the southern part of Azerbaijan, called Imishli, since 1995. Eldaniz takes care of his parents who are on a pension now and need special care and medicine.

His principal work is the buying and selling of cattle. This business requires lots of travel because he needs to go to remote areas where these animals cost less. This necessitates considerable financial means. The business is very profitable, but his lack of capital makes his income insignificant, and living conditions remain difficult in his household.

Also Eldaniz has a car which he uses sometimes to take local people from one village to another. But his business is not permanent and does not bring enough funds to cover basic family needs.

To strengthen his business, he is asking for a loan of 1200 USD, which will serve to buy more cattle. This will allow him to effectively meet the needs of his household.

loans.use: Purchase four calves

loans.name: Ayyub

texts.en: Ayyub Q. is 56 years old and lives in the small village of Internally Displaced People, called Bilasuvar. He is married with four children. He supports his children as well as his wife and parents. His main source of income is farming and raising livestock. Ayyub is an experienced livestock breeder. In order to better manage his herds and increase productivity, he needs to build an enclosure for them. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 USD. This will allow him to make his livestock business more profitable so that he can better support his family.

loans.use: Purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Clement E. is a photographer and he also prints. He is 38 years old and married with a child. He needs the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase films, camera, and printing papers. He says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more films, camera and printing paper

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara S. is 39 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three wonderful children. Sara keeps her store where she sells different kinds of foodstuffs, which she has been running for the past 6 years. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and variety. Gulnora is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her store to buy groceries again. Sara is seeking to keep her business strong and has requested a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase the inventory she has for sale. One of her dreams is that her children progress in their studies. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Sara reach all of her aspirations.

loans.use: Purchase more food inventory

loans.name: Tajudeen

texts.en: Tajudeen B. sells drinks and pure water. She purchases her drinks and pure water from distributors to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 45 years old and married with six children. She needs the loan amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and pure water to sell. She says, "thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pure water to sell.

loans.name: Sadaget

texts.en: Sadaget K. is 33 years old. She is married with two adorable children. Sadaget and her husband are working hard in order to have sufficient funds for educating their children so that their children become highly employable in the future. Sadaget sells perfume and cosmetics from shelves built on a wall of her house. She has been in this business for three years. Sadaget is dreaming of expanding her business. She wants to enlarge her own store and establish contacts with the suppliers of well-known products. Today Sadaget requests $1,200 US in order to purchase new perfume and cosmetics such as hair color, nail polish, and lipstick to increase the variety of goods in her store. She would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and perfume for resale.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham B. is 34 years old. He is married with two children. He is a small entrepreneur who has sold different kinds of foodstuff and detergents in his store for the last two years. His store is very famous in his community, thus allowing him to have a good clientele. This store is the only financial income in his family. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Ilham’s main goal is to educate his beloved children so that someday they’ll become successful entrepreneurs. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more food and detergent for resale.

loans.name: Anver

texts.en: Anver M. is 48 years old and is married and with four children. Nine years ago, he started his business of raising cattle. His primary business is with the local restaurants and livestock market. Also during harvest season, Anver works as a taxi driver. He has his own car, which he uses to take local people from one village to another. Despite having two jobs, his business is still quite small and doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Anver would like to request a loan to expand his business. He will use the profit generated by the business to repay the loan on time. Anver is asking for a loan of 1,200 USD in order to buy more calves to rise. Anver and his family thank you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase four calves.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth O. is 36 years old and married with seven children. She sells plastics, and she has been in this business for  a long time. She travels to Onitsha and Lagos to purchase her plastics to sell in Benin City. She needs the loan amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more plastics to sell. She says, "thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more plastic materials to sell.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan M. is a 26 year-old married man who lives with his newborn daughter and owns a small farm consisting of sheep. He lives and works in the small southern city called Bilasuvar (Tajikistan). Rovshan has been selling sheep for three years. Since sheep selling is a profitable business, Rovshan has become a very successful businessman in a very short period of time. The income has been enough to cover family needs up until now. However, his child is growing and he is expecting another child, so covering family needs has become harder. Rovshan is applying for a loan of 1200 USD to expand his activities and to purchase more sheep.

loans.use: purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Mikayil

texts.en:
Mikayil N. is a happy father of three children. He is 46 years old and married. 

Mikayil is a trader. He has been running his own grocery business since 2000. For eight years, he has been selling foodstuff like sweets, preserved foods, juices, soft drinks, alcoholic drinks and many others in his grocery store. Mikayil’s desire is to increase his business, offering a variety of foodstuffs to customers who pass through the market. 

He works with one aim in mind, to provide the best possible example and way of life for his beloved children, and this is the reason for his daily efforts. With this opportunity and the immensity of his desire to succeed, he is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of 1200 USD in order to increase the range of his goods. He promises to repay the loan within 15 months. 

You can be an important link in the growth of this business by supporting Mikayil.

loans.use: purchase more food stuff

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a widow. She sells cakes and sweets at the central city market. She offers her clients a large variety of sweets at a good price. Her working capital is 15,000 UAH and her monthly income is 3,000 UAH.

Valentina has been in the sweets business for five years. She was able to develop her business due to Hope loans. Valentina is kind and generous person. She is helping her granddaughter to start and develop her own business.

Valentina would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to buy more supplies for the coming Christmas and New Year season. In Ukraine, people buy lots of sweets to decorate pine trees, houses, and just give as gifts to children. Valentina hopes to offer her clients lots of sweets and give them great opportunity to celebrate the sweet holidays.

loans.use: to buy more candy supplies for coming holiday season

loans.name: Qasham

texts.en:
Qasham N. is 40 years old and is married with three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of stuff like: tea, washing powder, razors, shampoo, sugar and many others in his grocery store, which he built five years ago. 

Today, Qasham is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. 

One of his dreams is that his children progress in their studies. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more inventory for grocery store

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia C. is 46 years old and married with five children. She sells drinks and firewood, but she makes more profit from the sale of drinks. She purchases the drinks from distributors to sell to her customers. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more crates of drink to sell. 

She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drink to sell

loans.name: Surayya

texts.en: Surayya M. is a 56-year-old woman, married with 5 children. She has been diligently searching for a source of income, which has been a continual, difficult task for Surayya, as she hadn't been working. After trying her luck at a variety of occupations, she decided to work with livestock. She started this business more than 15 years ago with the support of her husband. Now Surayya has experimented and acquired the necessary knowledge for this activity. She would like to expand her activity by purchasing more cattle so she can increase her earnings and continue to improve her family’s quality of life. Surayya is requesting a loan of 1200 USD. She has agreed to repay this loan within 15 months. She appeals to your good hearts in her request to make her dreams become reality.

loans.use: Purchase four calves

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith O. owns a phone booth where she makes calls and sell rechargeable phone cards. She hopes to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N40, 000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She is 27 years old and married with 2 children. She says thank you to all those who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Novruz

texts.en: Novruz Y. is 23-year-old farmer who breeds cattle in the small southern city called Bilasuvar.  Novruz is a hard-working man who was taught farming by his father. He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business about two years ago. Over time, he has increased his cattle sales and is proud to say that the business has been running well. However, he now needs additional capital to expand his business. Therefore, Novruz is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 USD to purchase four cattle for an estimated cost 300 USD each. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in helping to expand his business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase four calves

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella E. owns a store where she sells lubricants such as engine oil. She has been in this business for a long time. Stella has applied for a loan to buy more engine oil to sell. She is 39 years old and married with three children. She says thank you to all of the people who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more engine oil to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth U. makes a living selling provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is a LAPO client and has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell. Elizabeth is 48 years old, married and has seven children. She says thank you to everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Becky

texts.en: Becky D. makes a living selling smoked fish. Demand for her products is high. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 44 years old and married with five children. She needs a loan to buy more smoked fish to sell. She says thank you to everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish for resale

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married, has two children and makes a living selling hardware products (such as gas burners and parts for them, plumbing parts and more) at the central market in his town.

Sergei started this business four years ago. He decided to open his company because competition was low and demand was high. One of the main income-producing items in his business is the sale of small spare parts for gas burners and plumbing systems. People can not afford to change their systems completely, so they buy parts to fix problems. Sergei lives in a private house and knows a lot about fixing it. His business helps people improve their gas and plumbing systems and have better living conditions.

Sergei has applied for a loan to increase his inventory and generate more income. His goal is to develop his business and have more clients.

loans.use: to increase his store's inventory

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy A. is 48 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a commercial driver, while she sells drinks and snacks. She needs a loan to buy more drinks and snacks to sell. Happy says thank you to all the people who are making this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and snacks to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys I. sells baby things like creams, diapers, shoes, dresses, etc. She sells in New Benin Market.  She purchases her baby things from Onitsha and Lagos to sell in Benin City. She is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She needs the loan amount of N40, 000 to purchase more baby things to sell. She is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme tient une alimentation générale prés du stade Néma. Il soutient activement sa famille grâce à son commerce; Il sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock et augmenter ses ventes.
texts.en:
This young man has a grocery store near Néma Stadium. He actively supports his family, thanks to his business. He is requesting a loan to bolster his inventory and to increase his sales.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Nofel

texts.en: Nofel B. is 34 years old. He is married with three adorable daughters. He rents a store where he sells different kinds of foodstuff and detergents. His store is very famous in his community, thus allowing him to have a good clientele. Today Nofel is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Nofel’s main goal is to educate his beloved girls so that someday they’ll become successful entrepreneurs. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase more inventories to his store

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Cette jeune dame exploite une buvette restaurant tout prés de l'aéroport de Ziguinchor. Avec cette activité, elle gagne sa vie et soutient son mari à entretenir leur petite famille. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour améliorer son restaurant qui est trés fréquenté en cette période de saison touristique.
texts.en:
This young woman runs a pub very near the Ziguinchor airport. Through this business, she earns her living and supports her husband in caring for their small family. She is requesting this loan to improve her restaurant, which is very busy during the current tourist season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurant and pub

loans.name: Faiq

texts.en: Faiq A. is a 47 year-old married man who lives with his five children and has owned a small farm for more than 20 years. He lives and works in a small village of the southern part of Azerbaijan.  Since a cattle selling is a profitable business, Faiq has become a very successful businessman in a very short period of time. The income has been enough to cover family needs, but as his children grow, covering family needs has become harder, so Faiq is applying for a loan to expand his activities and to purchase more cattle.

loans.use: Purchase four calves

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib A. is a good son to his old parents, a hard-working farmer, and is steadfast in his endeavor of raising animals. Thanks to his father, who gave him good education in farming, he is able to raise and feed the animals and prepare them for sale at both fairs and marketplaces in nearby towns. Sahib lives in a small village of  Imishli city. He has two years of experience in this field. His dream is to get married and have children, he also believes that additional funds will help to increase his income and improve his current situation.  Sahib would now like to increase the amount of cattle and is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 USD. He promises to be responsible and prompt in repaying it.

loans.use: Purchase four calves

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
“I must bring out my best in the business, for I know that it is the best way to support my family’s daily necessities and even during emergency cases,” says Mary Ann T.. She believes that patience and seriousness in business are needed to fulfill her goals in life.

Mary Ann is 29 years old and married to Arnold, a security guard in Santiago City. They have a three-year-old daughter named Athea and are planning to have two more kids in the coming years. They live in their own simple house in Yeban Norte, a village covered by the municipality of Benito Soliven, Isabela.

She came up with the hog raising business because she wanted to help her husband generate extra income to support their family. At the moment, Mary Ann would like to borrow the amount of PHP 4,000.00 which she can use to maintain her hog raising business. She will use the money to purchase feed for her hogs and vaccines for the piglets. She is serious about her business since this is their alternative source of income.

Since they are just starting, Mary Ann is hoping that her business will prosper for them to have a better life. She is also planning to venture into a vegetable and food vending business in the future.

loans.use: Purchase feed

loans.name: Takhmaz

texts.en:
Takhmaz T., 37, raises sheep and sells them to local people and restaurants.  He is married and has five children.  Takhmaz grew up in a farming family and therefore, learned how to raise, breed, and sell dairy cows and other livestock.  He has eight years of experience in running his own business.

Takhmaz would like to expand his business and purchase additional cows for $1,200 USD.  This loan will improve the life of his family and make his financial income more stable.  He is working very hard to achieve these goals.

loans.use: Purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Ezangul

texts.en:
Ezangul T., 61, is married with five children.  When her husband lost his job many years ago, she decided to start a business with her husband.  She decided on sheep breeding because mutton is very popular and raising sheep is easy for her. 

With 20 years of experience, Ezangul now has the necessary knowledge regarding this sheep breeding.  She would like to expand her activity by purchasing more sheep and goats, so she can increase her earnings and continue to improve her family’s quality of life. Ezangul is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD and has agreed to repay this loan within 15 months. She appeals to your good hearts in her request to make her dreams become reality.

loans.use: Purchase 12 sheep and 5 goats

loans.name: Khatira

texts.en:
Khatira H., 47, is a mother of five children.  For most of her family life, she has been dedicated to raising livestock.  The self-sacrifice and attention that she brings to raising each one of her sheep has increased the quantity of sheep.  As a result, she is able to give her children the opportunity to pursue university studies, giving her much pride and satisfaction. 

Her next goal is to expand the business into selling sheep, not only to local bazaar traders but also to local restaurants.  This business would generate enough additional income to sustain her home and enable her to pay the university costs for her children.  In order to meet her goals, Khatira is asking for a loan to buy more sheep. Khatira hopes that her expanded business will help her realize the dream of seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase 18 sheep

loans.name: Dib

texts.en:
Dib is a 31-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. He has been working as a carpenter and builder for twenty years. 

Dib requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and wood for his business.  This is his second cycle and he has always paid on schedule. 

Dib makes home furniture, closets and bedrooms. He is speciA. in his work because he has a good quality of work. His clients are his neighbors, friends, and others. 

In the beginning, when he first started his business, he had difficulties finding someone to help him in his work, as well as a bad economic situation due to high prices. His father taught him the business when he was young because it has been a family business. 

In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: purchase merchandise and wood for his business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahamd is a 22-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. He has been working as a mason for nine years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua for personal use. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan. 

Ahmad is special in his work because of his punctuality in finishing his work and the quality of his performance. The loan will help him overcome his difficult family situation. 

His clients are his neighbors, friends, contractors and architects. 

He started in the business because it is a family business and he learned it from his father and brother. In the future, he hopes to work on bigger projects.

loans.use: Ahmad needs the loan for personal use.

loans.name: Abed

texts.en:
Abed is a 71-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. He has owned a grocery store and candy shop for eighteen years. He requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order for him to pay his car maintenance. This is the first time that Abed has requested a loan.  

Abed is exceptional in his work because he has a special schedule; he opens early in the morning and closes late in the evening, as well as he has good relations with his clients. His clients are his neighbors and friends. 

In the beginning, when he first started his business, he faced some cash issues, but now it is not the case anymore. In the future, he plans to open a bigger store.

loans.use: Abed needs the loan to pay his car maintenance.

loans.name: Assem

texts.en:
Assem is a 26-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. He has been a taxi driver for almost two years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase another car. This is the first time that Assem has requested a loan.

Assem is special because he starts his day early in the morning. With his business, he earns more or less 1000 US dollars per month. When he first started his business, he had difficulties buying a license plate for his taxi. In the future, he plans to buy another taxi.

loans.use: Assem needs the loan to purchase another car.

loans.name: Safiyeh

texts.en:
Safiyeh is a 45 year old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their five children. Safiyeh has owned a grocery and sweets store for four years. She requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and candies for her shop. This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time.

Safiyeh said that her previous loan has influenced her life in a good way. She is special in her work because she is the only big shop in her area, and she also opens early in the morning till midnight every day. She makes 400 US dollars per month. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She started her business because of the difficult living conditions in the camp, as well as the lack of money. In the future, she plans to expand her business by opening a bigger shop.

loans.use: Safiyeh needs the loan to purchase merchandise and candies for her shop.

loans.name: Oghogho

texts.en: Oghogho E. is 24 years old and single. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells bags and shoes. She started this business in 2005. She travels to Lagos and Onitsha to purchase her bags and shoes to sell in Benin City. She needs the loan amount of N102, 000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell.  She says "Thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 34 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. He has been working as a car electrician since 1997. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a car. Mahmoud has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time.

Mahmoud said that his previous loans have influenced his life in a good way. He is special in his work because of his speed, fast work and good quality. He makes 1000 US dollars per month. His clients are his friends and others. In the beginning, he faced some competition difficulties, but if he decided to do this business is because of his good performance. In the future, he plans to open a shop for car batteries.

loans.use: Mahmoud needs the loan to purchase a car.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 25 years old and she is a single parent with a child. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Victoria sells sewing thread, sponges, bulbs, etc. She started this business in 2005. She is a LAPO client. Victoria needs the loan amount of N102, 000 to purchase more thread, sponges, bulbs and sewing needles to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more thread, sponges, bulbs and sewing needles to sell

loans.name: Esam

texts.en:
Esam is a 39-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. He has been working as a car painter for twenty-eight years. He requested a loan of 500 USD from A. Majmoua in order to pay his car loan. This is his fourth cycle, and he has always paid on schedule.

Esam said that his previous loans have influenced his life in a good way. He is unique because of his good work. He makes 700 US dollars per month. In the beginning of his business, he faced some competition difficulties. In the future, he plans to purchase a bus.

loans.use: To pay his car loan.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 58-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. He has been selling sweets for ten years. He requested a loan of 1,000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase sugar, nuts and other merchandise. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on schedule.

Adnan is unique in his work because he sells good quality sweets. His clients are his friends and others. In the future, he plans to open a cake shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, nuts and other merchandise.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 34 years old and married with two children. She sells jewelry and she has been in this business for a long time. The demands for her jewelry are high, and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers during and after the festive season. She needs the loan amount of 102,000 NGN to purchase more jewelry to sell. She says, "thank you to all KIVA lenders for their financial support."

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.en:
"Nueva Esperanza" is a group of 20 women from an extremely poor area in the Dominican Republic. In this particular loan, there are 11 women hoping to receive a loan to either start a business or increase the size of their existing small business. The businesses in this group range from clothing stands and beauty salons to small food stands. The one thing that all the women have in common is they are all striving to change their lives and break loose from their poverty.

Teodora D. L. S. is the representative of this group, and is a hardworking mother of four children. She has a very small business selling clothing in her neighborhood. She takes a bus each month to a city called Santiago which is a few hours away, and there she buys all her used clothing for her business. Santiago has the cheapest clothing but it is far away and difficult for her to make the trip. She has been profitable with her first couple loans and is finally at the point where she can save a little money for the future. She is hoping to take this next loan and increase her inventory and hopefully increase her income. She is saving to try and send her children to a university one day and knows that education is something that might help her children break out of this poverty. She is so happy with the way her business is going and hopes to keep on increasing in size. For once she feels like a provider and a person with purpose! She is going to continue working hard to reach her dreams!

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Mrs. Cecilia B., 40, is married and lives in Talisay, Dapitan City. She has three children, two of whom are in college and one in high school. Her husband is a motorcycle driver. From her desire to help her husband, she engaged in dried fish vending starting up with a capital of 3,000 PHP. It has operated for six years already.

Now, she is planning to borrow 6,000 PHP from Paglaum MP Cooperative, of which she became a member in May 2008. She displays her dried fish in her sister’s store from Mondays to Saturdays and Sunday in public areas on market day. 

Mrs. B., wanted to purchase a motorcycle of their own because her husband only rents a motorcycle. She also wants to have a stall in the public market to display her dried fish. Someday she will be happy seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase cavans of dried fish.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 35 años, es casada y vive con sus hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura por más de 15 años, junto a su esposo, de quien aprendió  todo lo necesario para desarrollarlo adecuadamente, Le agrada cosechar sus productos y llevarlos al mercado de su ciudad donde obtiene buenas ganancias al venderlos. Invertir en la agricultura es muy costoso, pero si los precios son buenos los costos de producción son cubiertos y se logra obtener ganancias, que por lo general, son durante temporadas determinadas. Lo difícil es adquirir los abonos y fertilizantes necesarios para sus productos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y está comprometida con ser una de las más responsables del banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado comprará abonos para sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Ana is 35 years old, married and her children still live with her. She has worked in agriculture for the past 15 years with her husband who taught her everything necessary to develop their lands properly. She enjoys harvesting their crops and taking them to the city market where she receives good revenues when she sells them. Investing in agriculture is very costly but if there are good prices, they can cover the production costs and earn a good income, but this is generally only during certain seasons. Their challenge right now is buying the necessary fertilizers for their crops. This is her first loan from Prisma Microfinance and she is committed to being one of the most responsible members of the village bank. She will buy fertilizer for her land with the money.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for her land

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee tiene 34 años, es casada, vive con su esposo e hijos. Aprendió desde muy joven a bordar, ahora tiene la gran bendición y oportunidad de desempeñarse como una de las más solicitadas bordadoras de su zona, tiene sólo un año en esta labor, pero los pobladores ya tienen una muy buena opinión acerca del trabajo que realiza, por la entrega y creatividad de doña Aydee. Ella está muy gustosa en su labor, está trabajando muy duro porque se viene una muy buena temporada donde habrá mucha demanda, y está iniciando un duro trabajo tomando mucho tiempo en los adornos y lentejuelas que se ponen en las faldas, ya que es lo más difícil de realizar. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y espera crecer económicamente, además de comprometerse a ser puntual y responsable con su préstamo. Aydee invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos, que son materiales necesarios e indispensables para su labor.
texts.en:
Aydee is 34 years old, married and lives with her husband and children. She learned how to embroider at a very young age and now has the great blessing and opportunity to work as one of the most popular embroiderers in her area. She has only worked in embroidery for a year, but her neighbors have a very high opinion of the quality of her work and her presentation and creativity. She enjoys her work and she is currently working very hard because the coming season is when demand is the highest. She is starting the most difficult part of her work, taking significant time to finish the decorations and sequins that are placed on skirts. This is her first loan from Prisma Microfinance and she hopes to grow her business while being punctual and responsible in the repayment of her loan. She will invest the money in the purchase of fabric and thread which are the most important raw materials for her work.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and thread for her embroidery

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia tiene 27 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Se dedica al bordado de mandiles, lo cual inició hace 3 años, gracias al apoyo de su pareja, y desde entonces ha elaborado hermosos mandiles de diversos colores y diseños, los cuales son muy requeridos por sus vecinos y amistades. Para Celia el bordar es una gran habilidad que pudo desarrollar gracias a su madre, quien le enseñó todo lo necesario y por ser de gran demanda en las festividades del pueblo, ella trata de elaborar varios modelos porque sabe que cada uno tiene un precio  muy costoso, pero que las personas los obtienen de  todas maneras. Lo difícil es hilar, porque toma mucho tiempo si se quiere hacer un acabado perfecto. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará materiales, como hilos especiales y adornos que dan brillo a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Celia is 27 years old, married, and lives with her husband and son. For the past 3 years, she has worked embroidering decorative aprons and skirts with the support of her husband. Since she started her business, she has made many beautiful aprons and skirts of various colors and designs which are highly sought after by her neighbors and friends. Celia is a very talented embroiderer, having learned the trade from her mother. During this time of festivals in her village, demand is very high and she tries to make various models since she knows that each is very costly and people will pay high prices for them to get them one way or another. Her main challenge is threading the decorations since it takes a lot of time to add all the perfect finishing touches. This is her first loan from Prisma Microfinance and she will use the money to purchase raw materials like special threads and decorations that add a bit of sparkle to her work.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for embroidery

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 34 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus  3 hijos. Desde que se casó, hace 15 años, dedicó su actividad económica a la agricultura, sobre todo a la producción de papa y maíz, productos más solicitados en diferentes zonas, además tiene un buen precio en los mercados y si los traslada a la capital, los precios son más altos y favorecen mucho al agricultor, logrando recuperar sus grandes inversiones y compensando el esfuerzo que se hace en el trabajo de las tierras. Lo difícil es regar, debido a la escasez de agua  y por la cantidad de agricultores que solicitan regadíos para sus terrenos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y está muy comprometida con su préstamo. Con el dinero solicitado Eva adquirirá fertilizantes y abonos para sus terrenos de cultivo y poder mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Eva is 34 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 3 children. Since her marriage 15 years ago, she has worked in agriculture, mainly in growing potato and corn, which are very sought-after in different areas, as well as selling for a good price in markets and, if transported to the capital, even higher prices which favour the farmer and allow them to recover their huge investments and offset the great effort made in working the land. Her greatest challenge is irrigation due to the scarcity of water and the number of farmers who need irrigation for their lands. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very committed to your loan. Eva will buy fertilizers with the loan in order to improve her land's productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: Fanny tiene 32 años, está casada, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Desde hace 10 años está dedicada a la producción de papa, hacerlo por grandes hectáreas de terreno es lo más favorable, demanda mayor trabajo, pero a Fanny le agrada trabajar en el campo. La venta de productos agrícolas es rentable, ya que se recupera los montos de inversión y las ganancias son mayores cuando ella misma los vende en los mercados o los traslada a la capital donde el valor es mayor y más favorable. Lo difícil es regar los terrenos sembrados, ya que el agua es escasa y hay que distribuirla muy bien en todo el terreno. Este su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete a ser responsable con los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará abonos y fertilizantes que son indispensables para tener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Fanny is 32 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children. For ten years she has cultivated potatoes. Growing them over vast areas of land is ideal, but requires a lot of work. Luckily, Fanny really enjoys working in the fields. Selling agricultural products is lucrative since it is easy to recoup costs. Fanny's earnings are greater when she sells the potatoes herself at the local markets or when she sell them in the capital, where their value is greater. The hard part of her job is watering the crops, since water is scarce and yet must be well-distributed throughout the fields.

This is Fanny's first loan with Kiva's partner MFP, and she promises to be responsible about repayment. With this loan, she will buy manure and fertilizers, which are crucial to ensuring a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase manure and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said Athuman is a Tanzanian micro entrepreneur. He runs a mobile phone accessories shop at Vituka ward in the city of Dar es Salaam. Phone accessories are purchased from Kariakoo wholesale shops and other shops around. He has been in the business for two years. He manages to meet his family's daily needs from the business income. He wants to buy more stock so as to expand his business but fund is a limiting factor. He is requesting a loan of T.shs 600,000 to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories stock

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés tiene 42 años, es casada, vive junto a sus familiares incluyendo hijos y nietos. Ella se dedica a administrar el alquiler de autos que posee, los cuales arrienda a los choferes por día, actividad que realiza por más de 10 años, iniciándose gracias al trabajo de agricultora junto a su esposo. Inés no deja de sorprenderse de todo lo que puede lograr con esfuerzo y dedicación, trata de cuidar al máximo sus bienes y no despilfarrar el dinero que tiene como ganancia, sino de administrarlo adecuadamente. Lo complicado es cuando los carros se malogran o sufren daños que hay que reparar, las cuales son muy costosas en las mecánicas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y tiene muchas ganas de ser una clienta constante de su IMF. El dinero solicitado se invertirá en la compra de repuestos y en el mantenimiento de  sus carros.
texts.en:
Inés is 42 years old, married, and lives with her family, including her children and grandchildren. For ten years, she has rented out her vehicles to drivers on a daily basis. She previously worked as a farmer with her husband, and thanks to her success in that field, she was able to begin her current business.

Inés never ceases to be amazed at how much one can achieve through hard work and dedication. She tries to take good care of her property and does not squander the money that she earns, but manages it wisely. The hard part of her work is when the vehicles break down or are damaged and must have costly repairs.

This is her first loan with Kiva's partner MFP, and she has a great desire to be a regular customer of this microfinance institution. She will invest the loan in the purchase of spare parts and in the maintenance of her vehicles.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts and maintain vehicles

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr:
Madame A. Akoélé a 51 ans d’âge, elle est une revendeuse de fruits (banane, mangue, orange) au marché d’Agoè assiyéyé et exerce ce commerce depuis 1978. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit chez WAGES et sollicite ce crédit pour se réapprovisionner en stock avec l’achat de  04 paniers de mangues, 06 paniers d’orange et 05 régimes d’ananas.
Madame AGBADOU est divorcée  de son mari ATTIOGBE sossoukpè qui est tailleur, elle a un enfant. Avec le profit tiré de ce commerce elle pourra subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Akoélé A., age 51, is a retailer of fruit (bananas, mangoes, oranges) at the Agoè Assiyéyé marketplace and has been in this business since 1978. She has never been a recipient of a WAGES loan and is requesting this loan to stock up with supplies: 4 baskets of mangoes, 6 baskets of oranges, and 5 bunches of bananas. Ms. A. is divorced from her husband Mr. Sossoukpè ATTIOGBE, a tailor. She has one child. With the profit derived from this business, she will be able to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es: Ricardina tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Desde hace 5 años vende licores en las ferias y en las fiestas de los pueblos como una forma de ganarse la vida y de ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, le agrada realizar esta actividad porque aparte de vender disfruta del show que se da en las fiestas, y como en toda celebración no faltan las personas que deseen brindar, Ricardina ofrece sus licores a precios muy buenos. Lo difícil es tratar con personas alcohólicas, pero la experiencia le enseñó a tener un carácter fuerte para controlar estas situaciones. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y se muestra muy comprometida con su grupo del banco comunal. Ricardina invertirá la cantidad que solicita en la compra de más licores para vender los en las festividades y ferias.
texts.en:
Ricardina is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children. For the past 5 years, she has been selling liquor at fairs and village festivals as a way of earning a living and helping her partner with the household expenses. She enjoys this business because aside from selling, she also gets to enjoy the shows which are part of the festivals. As in all celebrations there is never a shortage of people who want to drink, Ricardina offers her liquors at a very good price. The most difficult part of her business is dealing with alcoholics, but experience has taught her to be strong to control such situations. This is her first loan with MFP, and she has shown herself to be very committed with her community banking group. Ricardina will invest the loan in the purchase of more liquor to sell in fairs and festivals.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the stock of product for sale

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 35 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde muy pequeña aprendió las actividades de la agricultura, pero empezó a hacerlo con mayor responsabilidad desde hace 10 años para ayudar a su pareja en los gastos del hogar, desde entonces no hubo ni un momento de descanso, pero es muy gratificantes cuando se obtienen las ganancias de sus frutos. Para Sonia es importante saber cuidar los terrenos, ya que son los productos que le darán ingresos, hay que regarlos y abonarlos con mucha dedicación, aunque la inversión en estos productos sea costosa, es necesaria. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y se siente muy feliz de formar parte de un equipo de personas tan entusiastas  y trabajadoras como son las de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita Sonia adquirirá un terreno más para sembrar y tener  mayor cantidad de producción.
texts.en:
Sonia is 35 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children. She has worked in agriculture since she was very young, but ten years ago she began to farm with greater responsibility in order to help her husband with the household expenses. Since then, she has not had even a moment of rest, but she is very gratified to see the fruits of her labor.

For Sonia, it is very important to know how to take care of the fields, since she relies on them for her income. One must irrigate and fertilize them diligently. Although the investment in these products is great, it is necessary.

This is Sonia's first loan with Kiva's partner MFP, and she feels very happy to be a part of her community bank's hard-working and enthusiastic team. With this loan, she will acquire another plot of land to cultivate, thereby increasing her production.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land to increase production

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Se dedica  a la venta de flores por más de 5 años, tiempo también en el cual abrió su pequeña tienda, que ahora está en pleno crecimiento. La venta de flores en muy favorable, debido a está ubicada junto al cementerio, y las personas que van de visita compran las flores para sus seres queridos. Teresa tiene una gran simpatía con la gente, esto hace que sus clientes aumenten y que su tienda siga adelante. Lo difícil es cuando no hay visitas, no hay venta y las flores se marchitan, es una pérdida, pero no es un factor que mengüe el entusiasmo de doña Teresa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, pero se muestra muy comprometida con su banco comunal y con la institución. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mercadería para su tienda para surtirla con gran variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Teresa is 35 years old and lives with her husband and children. She has been selling flowers for more than 5 years, during which time she also opened her small store which she is currently expanding. Selling flowers is very profitable because she is located next to the cemetary, and the people who come visit buy flowers for their loved ones. Teresa has great sympathy for people, which is what attracts more clients to her and her store prospers. It is most difficult when no one visits, there are no sales and the flowers wilt, which is a loss but this does not damper Teresa's enthusiasm. This is her first loan with MFP, but she has shown herself to be very responsible with the community bank and with the financial institution. Using the loan, she will buy merchandise for her store in order to stock it with a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Koumandji Kanley

texts.fr:
Cette dame de 31 ans d’âge a pour activité la vente de céréales qu’elle fait depuis 2004 au marché d’Agoè Anomé, elle s’approvisionne au marché local d’Anié, Notsè et Bassar. Elle n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit au près de WAGES. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock avec 06 sacs de maïs, 01 sacs de soja, et 02 sacs d’haricots.
Elle habite le quartier d’Agoè Anomé avec ses trois enfants. Elle est mariée avec son mari NEKERE Aminou. Elle compte avec ce crédit agrandir son commerce et soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
This 31 year old lady's activity is the sale of cereals, she has been doing this since 2004 at the Agoè Anomé market. She stocks up at the local market of Anié, Notsé and Bassar. She has never received a loan from WAGES. She is requesting this first loan to increase her stock with 6 bags of corn, 1 bag of soy bean, and 2 bags of beans. She lives with her three children in the neighborhood of Agoè Anomé. She is married to Aminou NEKERE. With this loan she hopes to expand her business and provide for her family.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma Kasimu is a Tanzanian micro trader. For three years now, he has been running a video show library in Dovya at Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam. He shows videos and sells a variety of video cassettes, though he does not own the business room. He plans to construct and have his own satellite dish but he is limited by funds. He requests a loan of Tshs 600,000 to step up the plan.

loans.use: To expand video show business

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza Group

texts.en:
"Luz y Esperanza" is a group of borrowers who are all living in extreme poverty, but are on the path to changing that fact. Each member of this group has already started their very own business and is on the path to changing their future. Some members in this group are hoping for their 7th loan and continuing to increase their businesses in size. The businesses in the group range from clothing sales, restaurant, colmado (small grocery store), to a beauty salon. This whole group includes very diligent workers and is excited about this next loan!

Martha T. is the representative of this group and also a very outspoken leader. She is a hardworking mother to three children all under the age of 23. She said that her children are her motivation to work hard and all she wants is a better future for them. She started a small business selling clothing in her area. She goes to another city to buy clothes at a good price, then returns to her area and sells them for a profit. 

She has experienced success, and has for the first time started saving money for the future and for her children. She is able to do this saving while also feeding her children and providing them the basic necessities they need. She is excited about her business and finally feels like a proper provider and a person with purpose. 

She is very excited to see what the future holds for her family, her business, and for her! This next loan is just going to help her business grow!

loans.use: Purchase clothing for business

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
A "sari-sari" (variety) store is operating in Barangay Balasdiot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.  It is owned by Luzminda T. who is 38 years of age and married with one child. Her husband is a fisherman who bravely faces the perils of the sea.  He works hard for the family, but Luzminda also brings support through tending her little store. From a small loan, she has managed it as time passes.  She said, when it comes to running a business she has to be wise.  What she earns for the day will be used for rolling capital tomorrow. That goes on and on until she feels for a bigger loan.  

Being a member of Paglaum MPC, she applied for a PHP 10,000 loan.  She is thankful of the approved amount which will be used for additional canned goods, soft drinks and laundry items.

She hopes to take good care of her business and to be able to send her child to school. For the living she and her husband strive for is for them to taste a good life, she concluded with tears.

loans.use: to invest on soft drinks, canned goods and laundry items

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses M. is a micro-entrepreneur. He runs a shop at Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam city. He sells varieties of items including cereal commodities. He purchases the items from Kariakoo city market and other wholesale shops around. Income derived from the business is used to feed his family and pay school fees. He is in need of a loan of T.shs 800,000 to meet the business demand.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Yenaube Senandja

texts.fr:
Monsieur K. vend des pneus usés, huile à moteur et pièces détachées de véhicules à Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Ce type de commerce est très important à Lomé parce que la plupart des véhicules sont vieilles et les rues ne sont pas en bon état.  Monsieur K. a commencé ce commerce depuis 2003.  Il a une fois bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES, et il a bien remboursé.  Avec ce deuxième crédit, il peut acheter 12 paires de pneus usés, 5 bouteilles d’huile à moteur, et pièces détachées.  Avec ce nouveau stock, il peut bien vendre et servir ses clients.
Le Monsieur est né à Korbangou, une ville située au nord de Togo.  Il a 39 ans, il est divorcé et il n’a pas d’enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. K. sells used tires, motor oil and spare parts for vehicles in Agoè, a neighborhood north of Lomé, Togo's capital. This type of business is very important in Lomé because most of the vehicles are quite old and the streets are not in good condition. Mr. K. started this business in 2003. He has once received a loan from WAGES, and he paid it back. With this second loan he could buy 12 pairs of used tires, 5 bottles of motor oil and spare parts. With this new stock he will sell and serve his clients well. This gentleman was born in Korbangou, a town located in the north of Togo. He is 39 years old, divorced and has no children.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used tires, motor oil and spare parts

loans.name: Hamis

texts.en: Hamis O. is a small businessman in Buguruni Ward in Dar es Salaam. He runs a shop, and the income generated is used to meet his family's daily needs. He sells a variety of items. He purchases from wholesale shops in Kariakoo Business Center and other shops in the area. He plans to open a wholesale shop because demand is much higher than his ability to supply. He requests a loan of T.shs 1,200,000.to boost his business.

loans.use: To build up the business

loans.name: Karla Isabel

texts.es: La señora Karla Isabel Sánchez J., tiene la edad de 28 años habita en el barrio Monimbo ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya, junto a su esposo y  hijos, el esposo le apoya con los gastos de la casa, la señora desde hace cinco años trabaja en venta de ropa , los planes para su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , para brindarle una educación a sus hijos para que sean unas personas de bien , los sueños de doña Karla es llegar a tener una tienda donde pueda vender tanto ropa como zapatos y otros accesorios.  Con este solicitud desea invertir mas en mercadería de ropa variada para la temporada, La mayor dificultad que ha tenido es la falta de financiamiento, lo cual ella solicita a nuestra financiera el apoyo para poder incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Karla Isabel Sánchez J. is 28 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Monimbo neighborhood of Masaya. Her husband helps her with household expenses. For five years, Karla has sold clothing. Her plans for her family include improving their living conditions and providing an education for her children so that they will be good people. Karla's dream is to one day have a shop where she can sell clothing as well as shoes and accessories.

The main difficulty she has had is the lack of funding, so she has come to our lending institution for the support needed to expand her business. With this loan she will be able to stock a variety of seasonal clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase assorted clothing for children and adults

loans.name: Nsengiyumva

texts.en:
Greetings from J. C. Nsengiyumva in the Northern province of Rwanda! J. is 28 years old, married with one adopted child.

This young entrepreneur started his business in 2006, from capital he had saved after working as an assistant clay worker in building mud houses for the poor people in the area where he lives. 

Besides building, he also worked in the sugar factory and was able to save 130,000 Frws ($238) to start a small shop as his business. He sells different items needed in his neighborhood like beans, sugar, rice, cooking oil, fresh milk, salt, paraffin for lighting, peas, bread, clothes for both children and old people, soap, batteries, Vaseline, etc. Besides the business, he grows beans and sorghum that is used to make local brew, which is liked by many people in his village.

From this business, this entrepreneur has been able to build a house for his family and he bought a cow and goat which will be increasing his income in the near future. He employs one person to run his business.

He is therefore requesting a loan worth 400,000 Frws to start up a bakery for making bread to sell both to retail businesses and individuals. This loan will be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Start up a bakery for making bread

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia trabaja en el magisterio como profesora de religión, el ingreso que percibe no le alcanza para cubrir sus necesidades de alimentación y ropa. Ella trabaja como comerciante el tiempo que le sobra, vende edredones para camas viajando al departamento de Tarija los fines de semana. Es madre soltera, su esposo la abandonó con su pequeño hijo hace cinco años. 

Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Panoramica – Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito que ahora solicita lo destinará para la compra de mercadería, ya por las fiestas de fin de año, de acuerdo a su experiencia de vendedora, tiene mucha de manda.
 
Es el cuarto  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle este préstamo.
texts.en:
Delia works in the educational sector as a religion teacher, however her salary does not meet her needs as far as food and clothing. She works as a merchant in her spare time, selling bed comforters as she travels to various parts of the department of Tarija on weekends. She is a single mother, as her husband abandoned her and their small child five years ago. She lives in her parent’s house in the Panoramica zone – Rio Seco of the city of El Alto. The loan she is currently requesting is for the purchase of merchandise, for the end-of-year festivities and given her experience as a saleswoman she has much demand. This is her fourth loan with Impro and her previous favorable history permits her to apply for this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase comforters for her sales during the end-of-year festivities.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
A 51-year-old member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative from Punta Sulong, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, earnestly watches her fishpond. Carmelita E., married with 4 children, grows "bangus" (milkfish) in their pond.  Her husband who is a fisherman also takes charge of their business.  Their son-in-law works for them as support. The business is inherited from Carmelita's parents. It's a family business that has been handed down for generations.  She humbly said that the elders have passed down techniques on how to enjoy the business and at the same time make earnings from it. But it's a fact in a business that there are ups and downs. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. Jackpot!, she said when the "bangus" grew nicely.  They bring their produce to nearby Calamba Town Market.  

But the couple sees a good opportunity to expand their business. They wanted to utilize another section of pond. They are requesting PHP 7,000 from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for capital to be used for additional bangus and to purchase fish feed as well.

They deeply wish to pass the business to their kids and have fishponds on their own. And if time permits, pass it to their children's children as well.

loans.use: To invest in "bangus" (milkfish) for her fishpond

loans.name: Julia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Julia del Carmen G. R., tiene la edad de 34 años ,habita en el barrio monimbo ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya, junto a su esposo y  hijos, el esposo señora trabaja para poder apoyarla con los gastos de la casa y salir adelante con la familia una  las hijas de doña carmen le apoya con las cosas de la casa mientras ella , se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace mas de diez años , con esta tipo de negocio a logrado mantener su hogar pasando dificultades por a falta de financiamiento ya que ella con sus propios esfuerzos a logrado establecer su clientela, con esta solicitud va a comprar mercadería para tener productos variados para la temporada. Los planes para su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y para el negocio incrementar mas su producto.
texts.en:
Julia del Carmen G. is 34 years old and lives in the Monimbo neighborhood in the city of Masaya with her husband and children. Her husband works to help support the family’s expenses and get ahead. One of Mrs. Carmen’s daughters helps her tend to the home while she dedicates herself to selling footwear, an activity she has carried out for more than ten years. With this type of business, she has managed to maintain the home despite having gone through some difficulties due to lack of financing. Through her own efforts, she has managed to build a customer base. With this request, she will purchase merchandise to have varied products for the season. Her plans for her family include improving their standard of living and, for the business, to increase her supply of products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase footwear for children and adults.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna R. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She is married with four children. She runs a clothes shop at Kilimahewa in Dar es Salaam. She pays school fees and meets daily family demands from her business income. Her future business plan is to run a wholesale and retail shop. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more stock.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina M. is a fish monger. She normally goes to the shore to buy fish from the fishermen and taka it home to smoke as a form of preservation before sending it to the market at Mpoben near Elmina to sell. She has received education through senior high school. Georgina is married with three children and her husband is a tailor. She intends to use the money as capital to buy more fish to sell.

She would use the profits she earns to pay her children’s school fees, pay bills and also build a house for her family.

loans.use: She intends to use the money as capital to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La joven Maria Auxiliadora Velásquez tiene la edad de 21 años, habita en el barrio monimbo ubicado en la ciudad de Masaya, junto a sus padres, ella es soltera, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, para poder pagar sus estudios ya que sus padres no tiene la capacidad de pagarle todo lo de la universidad por problemas económicos, La joven Maria inicio este negocio con sus propios esfuerzos, ya que ella tiene el sueño de llegar a ser una profesional para poder apoyar a sus padres y hermanos. Los planes que tiene hacia un futuro para su negocio es llegar a establecer una tienda de cosméticos y poder realizar un salón de belleza. Por lo cual ella solita un financiamiento para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de cosméticos para ofertar sus productos variados, y así obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora Velásquez is 21 years old and lives with her parents in the Monimbo neighborhood located in the city of Masaya. She is single, and dedicates herself to selling cosmetics to pay for her studies since her parents are not able to afford all the costs for the university. Young Maria started the business through her own efforts, since she dreams of becoming a professional to help support her parents and brothers. Her future plans include establishing her own store selling cosmetics and opening a beauty salon. For these reasons, she is requesting financing to continue investing in the purchase of cosmetics so she can offer a diversity of products to her customers and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary P. is a fish monger. She buys fish from fishermen at the seashore and sends it home for processing in the form of smoking. She then sends the fish to the market to sell. She does this at Mpoben near Elmina and has been selling fish since 2004. Mary is married with two dependents, and her husband is a fisherman. She has received education through junior high school.

She will use the money given her as capital to buy more fish to sell at the market. She would then use her profits to pay for the school fees of her children and utility bills. She also intends to build a house.

loans.use: She will use the money given her as capital to buy more fish to sell at the market.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca Y. is a fish monger, which she has been doing since 1994. She buys fish at the shore and processes it at her house before reselling it at the market. Rebecca is married with four children and her husband is a secretary. She has received education through senior high school. She plans to use the money given her to increase her capital to buy more fish to sell at the market, which is at Mpoben near Elmina. She would then use the profits she gets to feed her children, pay for her children’s school fees and other bills, and also build a house for her family.

loans.use: Buy more fish to sell at the market

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Maria del Socorro García, tiene la edad de 36 años habita en municipio de monimbo ubicado en la ciudad de Masaya, junto a su esposo Y  hijos, su esposo  trabaja para compartir los gastos del hogar; ya que con sus propios esfuerzos a logrado mantener la venta de verduras desde hace seis años pero la mayor dificultad que tiene es la falta de financiamiento. Los sueños de doña Maria es darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos, y mejorar el negocio para poder obtener mejores ganancia y a la vez invertir  en la compra de mas productos con esta solicitud de préstamo en Afodenic, lo cual espera sea de mucho beneficios,   para incrementen sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria del Socorro García is 36 years old, and lives in the Monimbo municipality located in the city of Masaya with her husband and children. Her husband works to help meet the household expenses. Through her own efforts, she has managed to maintain the sale of vegetables for six years now. Her biggest difficulty has been a lack of financing. Maria’s dreams are to provide better living conditions for her children, and to improve her business to generate greater earnings. At the same time, she would like to invest in the purchase of more products. With the request for this loan in Afodenic, which she hopes is very beneficial, she will increase the quantity of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is a fish monger. She buys fish at the shore and processes it at home before selling it at the market, which is at Mpoben near Elmina. Elizabeth is a widow with two dependents. She has received senior high school education. She would use the money given her to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale at the market.

She intends to use the money to feed her children, pay utility bills and also save the rest.

loans.use: Buy more fish for sale at the market.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: Milton tiene 38 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Desde hace varios años se dedica, junto a su esposa, a la venta de ropa para todo tipo de público, desde bebes hasta adultos, recientemente, hace 3 meses, abrió otro stand o puesto de ropa, y le está yendo bien, y tiene planes de seguir extendiendo su negocio. Sus inicios fueron con poco capital, pero con el paso de los años fueron creciendo, lo que mantiene a Milton con muchas ganas de seguir esforzándose, porque sus hijas pequeñas lo mueven a seguir trabajando y para él es la mejor recompensa que puede tener. Es la primera vez que Milton solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Solicita este dinero con el que podrá invertir en la compra de polos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Milton is 38 years old, and lives with his wife and children. For several years now he has, along with his wife, dedicated himself to selling clothing for all types of people – from children to adults. Recently, three months ago, he opened another clothing stand and things are going well. He has plans to continue to expand his business. He started with little capital but, as the years passed, the business grew which gives Milton a great deal of enthusiasm to continue with his efforts. His small daughters motivate him to forge ahead with his work and, for him, it is the best reward he could get. This is the first time Milton requests a loan with MFP, for which he pledges to be punctual with his payments. He requests these funds to invest in the purchase of polos at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase polo shirts at wholesale.

loans.name: Dennise

texts.es: Dennise tiene 23 años, vive con su madre y sus hermanas. Ella es una joven con muchos deseos de superación, por ello trabaja diariamente en la crianza de sus propios animales, los cuida con dedicación para luego venderlos, los fines de semana, en la feria ganadera, ahora ella quiere seguir creciendo con lo que se ha proyectado, y aumentar  la cantidad de animales que con su capital de trabajo, con el paso del tiempo a visto que la mejor manera de adquirir buenos animales es siendo muy minuciosa en la revisión, pues muchas veces está el riesgo de comprar un animal enfermo, pero con estos 4 años de experiencia ha podido tener estos conocimientos. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a ser puntual con sus pagos. Con el dinero de este crédito, Dennise comprará animales para tener mayor capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Dennise is 23 years old and lives with her mother and her sisters. She is a young women with great desire to get ahead and she works every day raising her own animals. She is very dedicated about caring for them so she can later sell them at weekend livestock markets. Currently, Dennise would like to expand her business by increasing the number of animals she owns. Since there is always the risk of buying a sick animal, she has realized that the best way to choose healthy animals is by being very picky about inspecting them. With four years of experience in this field, Dennise knows how to chose wisely.

This is Dennise's first loan with Kiva's partner MFP, and she promises to be on-time with her payments. With this loan, she will purchase animals to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the number of animals owned

loans.name: Digna

texts.es: Digna tiene 36 años, vive con sus 2 hijos. Cada día trabaja con mucha energía y ánimo de seguir adelante, su labor es la crianza de sus animales, específicamente sus vacas, de las cuales vende su leche diariamente, es por ello que ella misma las ordeña cada día, obtiene un promedio de 10 litros, que le brinda un ingreso económico diario. Así mismo, trabaja atendiendo un grifo de combustible que se encuentra muy cercano a su casa y puede atender a sus hijos, mientras que los fines de semana vende sus animales, es por ello que Digna está satisfecha con la labor que realiza, además de que disfruta de estar siempre ocupada y viene desempeñando estas funciones desde hace 12 años. Es la segunda vez que Digna solicita un préstamo con MFP, y durante el tiempo que viene trabajando ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad.
