The biggest problem she has is a lack funding, which doesn't allow her to get a good yield from her crops because she can't afford enough planting supplies. Maria's dream is to be able to expand her crops so she can better help her children and provide them with a better future. With the loan she is requesting she plans to purchase fertilizer and insecticide for her crops and hopefully achieve a better yield. For this, she turns to Kiva partner AFODENIC so she can get the necessary fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and insecticide for her crops

loans.name: Pastora Del Socorro

texts.es: La Joven Pastora  está solicitando refinanciamiento de su3er  crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de una habitación), trabaja como docente de la Escuela Rafael Salmerón,  esta clienta no tiene hijos pero ayuda a su mamá a cuidar a sus ancianos abuelitos y con los gastos del hogar; Pastora es una joven  con alto espiritud de superación personal, responsable y trabajadora, que ama su trabajo ya que ayuda a muchos niños de la colonia Talolinga a 30 km de la Nueva Guinea a aprender a leer y escribir, Pastora todos los días tiene que levantarse  a las 4 de la mañana ya que tiene que viajar a la colonia Talolinga en camión,  su sueño  es  terminar de estudiar la Licenciatura en Ciencias de la Educación, tener estabilidad laboral, salud  y una vivienda con mejores condiciones para vivir con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Pastora is requesting her third loan to invest in improving her home (adding a room). She works as a teacher at the Rafael Salmerón School. She does not have any children but she helps her mother care for her elderly grandparents and with household expenses. Pastora is a responsible and hard-working young women with a strong desire to better herself and who loves her job because it helps a lot of children in Talolinga, a village 30 km away, learn how to read and write. Every morning she gets up at 4 a.m. because she has to take a bus to Talolinga. Her dream is to complete her Education Sciences degree, have job stability, good health and a home with better living conditions so she can live in more comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room in her home

loans.name: Juana Yamileth

texts.es:
La joven Juana yamileth T. E. tiene la edad de 34 años, su estado civil es casada, Ella tiene 2 hijos de los cuales su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 4 años y cursa recientemente el 3 nivel de primaria y su hija de 3 años cursa el 1 nivel de primaria, su esposo labora como cambista, sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio activo ya que le ha proporcionado la ayuda necesaria para sacar adelante a sus hijos y así alcanzar cada uno de sus propósitos presentados además también desea obtener una casa propia para sus hijos ya que quiere darle lo mejor para ellos y el día de mañana no tendrán problemas y les ofrecerá un buen futuro en los estudios. 


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general en donde vende los productos como: cosméticos, pantalones, camisas y carteras, la ubicación de su negocio es un tramo en el Mercado Central de León, Ella inicia este negocio por cuenta propia razón por la que empieza con pocos productos como: pinturas de uñas, desodorantes y perfumes y decide realizar la compra de mas productos para tener mas variedad que ofertar a sus clientes razón por la decide incrementar mas en su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de productos como ropa, cartera  y sabanas  ya que su  Mama empezó trabajando con Fundación León 2000 y mas tarde su hija trabaja con Fundación y con las organizaciones amigas y agradece trabajar con ellas ya que le brindan la mano amiga para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana Yamileth T. E. is a 34-year-old married mother of 2 children, the eldest of whom is 4 years old and attends the 3rd level of elementary school, while her 3-year-old daughter is the in 1st level. Ms. E.’s husband works as a money changer. Her goal is to keep her business active because it has given her the assistance needed to help her children get ahead so that they can reach all of their goals. Furthermore, she also wishes to obtain her own house for her children because she wants to give them the best. Thus, her children will not have problems, and she will offer them a bright future in their studies.

She sells general merchandise such as cosmetics, pants, shirts and handbags. Her business is located in the Central Market of León. She started this business on her own, initially only selling products like nail polish, deodorant and perfume. Later, she decided to purchase more merchandise in order to offer a greater variety of products to her customers, so she expanded her business. This loan will be used as business capital to purchase products like clothing, handbags and bed sheets. Her mother started working with Fundación León 2000, and then her daughter joined in with Fundación and other organizations. She is grateful to work with them because they lend her a helping hand so that she can keep moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Angélica María

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua la señora Angélica María R. desde hace tres años inició un pequeño negocio de pulpería y hoy en día ha logrado suplirlo hasta el punto de llenar sus estantes logrando beneficios para su familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo.

Ella ha logrado mantener su pulpería gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel por medio de los créditos y no podemos omitir que una vez más solicita un crédito con el propósito de comprar la mercadería para continuar ofreciéndola en su negocio de pulpería al que tanto se dedica.
texts.en:
Ms. Angélica María R. has been running her small general store in the Ciudad Sandino municipality of the city of Managua for three years. She has managed to supply her shop up to the point where she now has full shelves, obtaining benefits for her family who really needs her support.

She has managed to maintain her general store thanks to support from Ceprodel via microloans. Once again, she needs a loan so that she can purchase goods to sell them in her general store, to which she is so dedicated.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La Señora de nombre Ramona Pérez B. tiene la edad de 66 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Ramona tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo 2 dependen de ella una adolescente de 20 años  de edad recientemente cursa el 1 año de su carrera en una universidad publica unan-león y su hijo de 39 años de edad que no trabaja, sus deseos son de ofrecerle a su hijos una casa propia para que el día de mañana no tengan necesidades de alquilar una casa, en sus propósitos esta darle mejorías a su vivienda como seria la instalación de piso para  que así tenga mas presentación.


La actividad económica a la que Doña Ramona se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general la ubicación de su negocio es el mercado central en donde vende los productos de: sabanas, lentes para el sol, delantales y camisones, da inicio a este negocio por la necesidad  de obtener un trabajo el cual le ayudara a mantener a sus hijos y decide comprar productos como: sabanas y manteles mas tarde decide trabajar con Fundación León 2000 ya que así obtendría  ayuda para la compra de mas productos y así agradece trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y las diferentes organizaciones, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de mas productos ya que se acerca la temporada festiva y necesita obtener variedad en sus productos.
texts.en:
Ms. Ramona Pérez B. is a 66-year-old single mother with 5 children, two of whom are her dependents. One is a 20-year-old who is in her first year at the UNAN-León public university, and her son is 39 years old and unemployed. She wishes to give her children their own house so that they will not need to rent a house in the future. Her goal is to do some home improvements, such as installing flooring, so that it can look more presentable. Ms. Ramona Pérez B. sells general merchandise for a living. Her business is located in the central market, where she sells products like bed sheets, sunglasses, aprons and nightgowns. She started this business out of a need to support her children, so she decided to purchase products like bed sheets and tablecloths. She later chose to work with Fundación León 2000 because she would receive help to purchase more products. She is grateful to work with Fundación León 2000 and other organizations. This loan will be used as business capital to purchase more merchandise because the holiday season is approaching and she needs to offer a wide variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bianeth Del Socorro

texts.es: Bianeth está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción de una habitación), trabaja como responsable de Biblioteca en la universidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea desde hace 7 años, es madre de un niño de 1 añito de edad,  su esposo trabaja como albañil,  y comparten los gastos del hogar, ella se caracteriza por ser humilde en su labor de trabajo y en su comunidad, su sueño es tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, estabilidad laboral para así  ayudar a sus padres ya que son familias huumildes y de escasos económicos y ellos solo dependen de la ayuda de Bianeth y de otra hija.
texts.en:
Bianeth is requesting her second loan so she can invest in her home (build a new room). She has worked as a librarian at the local university in Nueva Guinea for the past seven years and has a 1-year-old son. Her husband is a construction worker. Her dreams are to have a home with better living conditions and have stability at work so she can help her parents, since she comes from a humble family with limited resources and they depend on her and her sister for support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a new room in her home

loans.name: Maria Estebana

texts.es: La Sr. María tiene 53 años de edad, habitante del barrio 31 de Diciembre en la capital de Managua, soltera, tiene dos hijos ya mayores. Los planes de doña maría para con su familia es mejorar su nivel de vida, ofrecerle seguridad y una mayor comodidad.Se desempeña en servicios  domestica desde hace quince años, es un trabajo muy casado y agotador. Pero tiene que salir adelante, Sus metas en el ámbito laboral es cambiar a un mejor trabajo, conseguir un préstamo para construir completamente su casa, para  compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento,  hierro y otros. Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra ofrecerle a su familia una mayor comodidad y seguridad y sobre todo una vivienda digna
texts.en:
María is 53 years old and lives in the December 31st neighborhood in the capital city of Manauga. She is single and has two children, both adults. María wants to improve the quality of life for her family and offer better security and comfort in her home. She has worked as a domestic servant for the past 15 years. It's very tiring and exhausting work, but she has to make headway. Her goal is to change to a better job and get a loan so she can completely finish building her home by purchasing materials like stone, sand, cement, iron and other items. Thanks to the loans from Kiva partner AFODENIC she will be able to offer her family a more comfortable and secure home and above all a dignified dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials so she can finish construction of her home

loans.name: Ignacia Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora Ignacia Teresa B. tiene la edad de 54 años, su estado civil es acompañada, Doña Ignacia tiene 1 hija de 12 años de edad y cursa recientemente el 1 año de secundaria, su esposo labora como contador en el hospital Oscar Danilo, en sus propósitos esta mantener activo de su negocio y a la misma tiempo sacar calidad de en productos para innovar en lo que seria su productos ya que en sus metas esta sacar al mercado productos nuevos y que a los clientes les guste los nueva línea de  productos.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de pan, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 15 años, sus inicios  se dan cuando ella tiene la profesión de enfermera  pero debido a la situación del país tuvo problemas en su trabajo y es por eso que decide establecer un negocio de una panadería con el apoyo de su familia que siempre le ha brindado la ayuda en lo que es su negocio ella inicia la producción con pan simple y pan dulce por lo que tenia mas variedad en el pan dulce y así consigue afluencia de clientes por lo delicioso que son sus productos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesario realizar las compras de su materia prima como es harina, huevos y la compra de sartenes para la elaboración de sus productos y así tener una variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Ignacia Teresa B. is 54 years old, and is a co-habitee. Ignacia has one daughter aged 12 and who recently began her first year of secondary school. Her partner works as an accountant in Oscar Danilo hospital. Her aim is to maintain her business' activity and at the same time to keep producing quality goods and keep innovating, as one of her goal is to to introduce new products to market, as her customers like the new product lines. This business is the sale of bread: she has had this business for 15 years, first establishing it when she was a nurse, because thanks to the situation in the country she had problems in her work and as a result decided to establish a bakery with the help of her family, who have always given her all the support she's needed with her business. She began baking simple bread and sweet bread and cakes too as there were more types of sweet breads. As a result of her goods being so delicious, customers flocked to her. The loan is for work capital, as she needs to purchase raw ingredients such as flour and eggs, as well as pans, in order to make her breads and thus have a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work Capital

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para  construir  una habitación, trabaja como docente desde hace 9 años en la Escuela Mauricio Cajina, tiene un  niño de 8 años que estudia 2do grado de educación primaria, su esposo trabaja con chofer de un camión que viaja a las diferentes colonias del Municipio, y le ayuda con los gastos  familiares.  María a pesar que es una persona asalariada ha demostrado ser una mujer muy responsables, honesta y muy trabajadora, tiene gran espiritud  de superación profesional y laboral, ella se siente agradecida con la institución de AFODENIC  ya que con los anteriores logro tener su propia casa, su sueño para el futuro es estudiar una licenciatura este proximo año, salud para sus familia y tener estabilidad laboral. demostrado puntualidad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is requesting her seventh loan so she can build a new room in her home. She has worked as a teacher at Mauricio Cajina School for the past seven years, and she has an 8-year-old son in second grade. Her husband is a bus driver who travels to the different villages in the area and helps her with household expenses. Along with earning a salary, María has shown herself to be a very responsible, honest and hard-working with a strong desire to better herself professionally. She feels grateful to Kiva partner AFODENIC because past loans helped her have her own home, and she has been punctual with her payments. Her dreams are to study for a degree next year, for her family to be healthy and to have stability at work.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room in her home

loans.name: Mario Marcelino

texts.es:
El señor Mario Marcelino R. en conjunto con sus dos hermanos Omar y Mario, se dedica a la actividad  de carpintería habiendo adquirido la habilidad desde muy jovencito y habiéndose dedicado a este negocio con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación en la ciudad de Managua específicamente en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino.

El señor Mario Marcelino es padre de cuatro hijos de los cuales dos de ellos están en su obligación por lo que tiene que darles de comer y brindarles las condiciones necesarias para sus estudios. 

El propósito por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de madera y materiales de trabajo para continuar en la actividad de la carpintería.
texts.en:
Mario Marcelino R., together with his two brothers Omar and Mario, works in carpentry, having acquired the skill when he was very small, having dedicated himself to the business, with much effort and devotion in the town of Managua, specifically in the municipality of Cuidad Sandino. Mario Marcelino is the father of four sons of which two are still dependent on him to provide food and the necessary conditions for them to study. His ambition in approaching Ceprodel is to obtain a credit which will allow him to purchase wood and work materials to continue his carpentry business.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood for his business

loans.name: Omar Antonio

texts.es:
El negocio de carpintería por ser una actividad muy drástica requiere de mucho sobre esfuerzo por lo que se trabaja con grandes cantidades de madera pesada que debe ser trasladada de un lugar a otro.

A este negocio el caballero Omar Antonio R. se dedica en su propia casa de habitación donde es visitado por los clientes para elaborar roperos, puertas, sillas, etc. 

Hoy en día una vez más se ha apoyado de Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de madera para continuar con su actividad en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua.
texts.en:
The business of carpentry, being a extremely tough job, requires considerable force as one works with large quantities of heavy wood which must be moved from one location to another. Omar Antonio R. works in this business, from his own house where clients visit him to commission the fabrication of wardrobes, doors, chairs, etc. Today, he's been helped once more by Ceprodel to obtain a credit in order to purchase wood to continue his activity in the municipality of Ciudad Sandino in Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de madera

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Sr. Roberto tiene 31 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital llamado laureles norte en la capital de Managua, casado, tiene dos hijos de 9 años son gemelos los tiene estudiando. Los planes que tiene para su familia es asegúrales un patrimonio mejor para su esposa y  hijos. Don Roberto se desempeña como responsable de compra de una empresa privada desde hace diez años. Su objetivo en el ámbito económico es aumentar sus ingresos, aspirando a un mejor trabajo y seguir con el progreso de su vivienda, en estos momentos necesita comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques  ya que el tiene piedra comprada necesita  terminar de construir su casa. Es un porche en la parte de enfrente para tener mas espacio Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra que su casa este segura y sus familia protegida. Para nuestra empresa  es importante el desarrollo de nuestros clientes.
texts.en:
Roberto is 31 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Laureles Norte in the capital of Managua. He's married and has twin sons who are nine years old and in school. The plans that he has for his family includes assuring greater financial security for his wife and children. Roberto has been working as a buyer in a private company for 10 years. His economic objective is to increase his income, aspiring to a better job, and continuing the progress with his home. At this time he needs to purchase construction materials like cement, iron and blocks since he already has purchased the rocks he needs to finish constructing his house. It's a porch in the front of the house in order to have more space. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, he will make sure his house is secure and that his family is protected. For our business, the development of our clients is important.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a porch

loans.name: Mario Domingo

texts.es:
El señor Mario Domingo R. originario del municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua se dedica a la labor de carpintería, oficio que lo aprendió desde hace varios años en conjunto con sus hermanos y hoy en día le ha sacado gran provecho porque se sustenta de este negocio.

A sus 43 años de edad, el señor Mario R. es padre de familia y con cinco hijos de los cuales uno de ellos está en edad escolar y debe de mantener sus estudios. Por esta razón es que hoy en día ha buscado el financiamiento en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de la madera como material de trabajo para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario Domingo R. is from the municipality of Ciudad Sandino in Managua and works as a carpenter, a trade he learned several years ago along with his brothers. Today he takes great advantage of this [skill] because this business supports him. At 43 years of age, Mr. Mario R. is a father with five children, one of whom is school aged and should continue their studies. For this reason, today he has requested financial assistance from Ceprodel in order to benefit from a loan that will allow him to purchase wood as working material for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Magda

texts.es: Magda es casada, vive con su esposo y con uno D. sus hijos. Hace más D. un año, esta madre, le dio la mejor solución a los bajos ingresos económicos en su hogar por medio D. la elaboración D. bocaditos artesanales como maní confitado y habitas saladas, D. esta manera produce preferentemente todas las noches en su casa para salir por las mañanas a repartir a las principales tiendas cercanas, también reparte a las  escuelas, colegios y hospitales, ella disfruta D. realizar esta actividad, es por ello que Doña Magda está planeando expandir su negocio, motivada diariamente por sus deseos D. seguir adelante y apoyar al último D. sus hijos con sus estudios. Esta es la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, anteriormente participó en un banco comunal que cerró hace varios años atrás, por lo decidió abrir otro con sus vecinas. Con la cantidad que solicita podrá invertir en la compra D. habas y maní por sacos, a demás comprar un saco D. azúcar y un balD. granD. D. aceite, para abastecerse por un buen tiempo D. los ingredientes que usa, sin perjudicarse por el alza D. precios constante D. los productos.
texts.en:
Magda is married, lives with her husband and one of their children. More than a year ago, this mother and house maker found a solution to supplement the family's low income: preparing and selling snacks like candied peanuts and salted fava beans. Magda cooks preferably in the evenings and goes out every morning distributing her snacks to small grocery stores, and offers them in schools and hospitals. She really enjoys this activity and is planning on expanding her business, motivated by her wish for a better life and to help the last of her children finish his education. This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP. Before that she participated in a communal bank that closed years ago, so she decided to open another with her neighbors. The loan will be used to purchase sacks of fava beans and peanuts, as well a a sack of sugar and a large oil can. Having a large amount of ingredients will allow her not to be held back by the constant price increases.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: María Otilia

texts.es:
La señora de Nombre Maria Otilia M. tiene 45 años de edad, su estado civil es casada, esta Señora tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen de ella sus edades son las siguientes Ana Gabriela de 15 años y cursa el 2 año de secundaria y Candida Rosa de 13 años que cursa el 1 año de secundaria, su esposo labora de conserje en club privado, sus deseos son que su negocio se incremente ya que así obtiene los ingresos para ayudar a su familia en sus propósitos esta el darle a su hijas un futuro en la educación para que el día de mañana no tengan necesidades también darle mejoras a su vivienda ya que este favorecerá a su familia que esta en proceso de desarrollo para que tengan un futuro prometedor.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 5 años, y esta ubicada en el Repto. Santa Lucia 2 calle, ella inicia este negocio con la venta de comida en la que vendía tacos, enchiladas, maduro, gallo pinto y otros pero se vio obligada a dejar este tipo de negocio debido a su condición de salud y es entonces que decide implementar el negocio de la pulpería donde vende refrescos, golosinas, bolsitas y es así como empieza llenando un estante donde vendía cosas personales y así obtiene la atención de sus clientes, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita invertir mas en lo que seria los granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, gaseosa y pollo ya que son los productos que mas se venden debido a la temporada festiva y así podrá ofrecer los diferentes productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Otilia M. is 45 years old, married and has five children, of whom two depend on her. Their ages are as follows: Ana Gabriela is 15 and is in the 2nd year of secondary school and Candida Rosa is 13 and in the 1st year of secondary school. Her husband works as a concierge in a private club. Her wish is that her business grows in order to obtain more income to help her family reach their objectives, giving her daughters a future through education so that one day in the future they don't have needs. Also, to improve her home because this benefits the family that is in the development process so they have a more promising future. Her work consists of managing a grocery store and it took her five years to become the owner of the business. It is located at Calle 2 in Reparto Santa Lucia. She started the business by selling food and sold tacos, enchiladas, fried plantains, gallo pinto (rice and black beans) and other items but felt obligated to leave this type of business due to the condition of her health. It was then she decided to start the grocery business where she sells soft drinks, candies and small bags and that's how she started filling a shelf where she sold personal items and began to attract the attention of her clients. The financial assistance is for business capital that she needs to invest more in staple items like rice, beans, cooking oil, soft drinks and chicken as they are the products that are sold the most during the holiday season, so she'll now be able to offer different products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for a grocery store

loans.name: Sebastiana Cristina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua todos los viernes, sábado y domingo desde muy tempranas horas de la madrugada la señora Sebastiana R. se levanta para preparar los deliciosos nacatamales que son vendidos en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes.

Es importante señalar que ella se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente cocinera y ha tenido vasta experiencia en la preparación de los nacatamales. Para llevar a cabo su negocio de venta de nacatamales ella acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de su materia prima para la preparación de los nacatamales tal materia prima es el arroz, el maíz, las papas, las verduras y sobre todo el cerdo para destazarlo. Con el crédito que solicita se beneficiará tanto ella como su familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua, every Friday, Saturday and Sunday, very early in the morning Mrs. Sebastiana R. gets up to prepare her delicious tamales that are sold in her home which is where she attends to her clients. It's important to point out that she is known for being an excellent cook and has vast experience in the preparation of the tamales. In order to carry out her tamale business, she has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan to buy materials she needs to make them like rice, corn, vegetables and most importantly, the pork that will be shredded. With the loan she is requesting, both she and her family will benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make tamales

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
La dama Luz N. desde hace varios años se ha destacado por ser una excelente costurera teniendo su establecimiento en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en la ciudad de Managua.

Se ha destacado debido a que ha aprendido a elaborar todo tipo de trajes así como camisas, pantalones, blusas, etc. La situación que hoy en día ella está atravesando es que necesita el material de trabajo para continuar y este material es tijeras, hilos, telas, agujas, centímetros, etc. Por esta razón espera que Ceprodel le beneficie con un crédito para la compra de estos materiales y para beneficio propio en su negocio.
texts.en:
For several years Luz N. has been well known for being an excellent seamstress. Her establishment is located in the municipality of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua. She has stood out due to the fact that she has learned to make all kinds of suits in addition to shirts, pants, blouses, etc. The situation that she finds herself in today is that she needs to buy materials to continue working and they include scissors, thread, fabric, needles, measuring tape, etc. For this reason she hopes that Ceprodel will give her a loan in order to buy these materials and so that she benefits from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Cristian Carolina

texts.es:
Esta  microempresaria Cristian Carolina R. S.  tiene la edad de 30 años, su estado civil es casada tiene 2 hijos de los cuales su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 6 años y cursa recientemente el 1 grado de primaria  y su otro hijo de 14 meses no estudia, su esposo labora como controlador del tiempo de las rutas, sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio de forma activa y así superarse para mantener a sus hijos ya que necesita sacarlos adelante para que estos en un futuro no pasen necesidades sus deseos son de obtener un lugar mas adecuado para que sus clientes puedan apreciar mejor sus productos.

Su actividad económica es la venta de artesanía y bisutería que esta  ubicado en el parque central de león, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 10 años, la forma en como inicia este negocio es por su mama ya que su Mama era la que tenia el control de su negocio y mas tarde decide independizarse obtener su propio negocio Ella inicia con la inversión de 300 $ dólares netos que fueron destinados para la compra de de 1 docena de camisetas, 3 sillas playeras y algunos jarros donde aparecía Nicaragua y al paso del tiempo decide incrementar mas su productos y es así como obtiene este medio de trabajo, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de llaveros, vestidos típicos, sillas playeras, hamacas, bolsos ya que todo este tipo de producto lo encuentra en Masaya de una forma mas factible.
texts.en:
This micro-entrepreneur, Cristian Carolina R. S., is 30 years old. She is married and has two children. Her oldest son is six years old and has recently started the first grade. Her other son is 14 months old and doesn't study. Her husband works controlling the time for drivers' routes. Her desires are to actively maintain her business and thereby improve her situation in order to take care of her children because she needs them to get ahead so that in the future they can manage their own needs. She wants to have a more suitable place so that her clients can better appreciate her products. Her business is selling handicrafts and imitation jewelry and she's located in the central park of León. She has had the business for 10 years. The way in which started is because of her mother because her mother was the one that had control of the business. Later she decided to become independent and create her own business so she started with an initial investment of US$300 that she used to buy one dozen T-shirts, three beach chairs and some jars that had "Nicaragua" on them. As time passed, she decided to increase the number of products. The financial assistance is for working capital that is needed to purchase key chains, typical dresses, beach chairs, hammocks and bags. These types of products are less expensive in Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase inventory

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace un año decidió abrir su propio negocio en su casa, instalando máquinas de juego  para niños, atiende todos los días, preferentemente en las tardes, hasta el momento, nos dice, le va muy bien, por lo que tiene planes de seguir adelante con sus proyectos de expansión, trabaja en esto porque le permite tener ingresos extras para sostener su hogar. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete ser muy responsable en sus pagos, a fin de ser una persona de confianza para su banco comunal. Con esta cantidad podrá pagar el mantenimiento de sus máquinas de juego, además también desea dar una inicial para la compra de un minibús para que su esposo tenga su propia herramienta de trabajo, ya que es chofer, pero por ahora trabaja de manera dependiente.
texts.en:
Maria, 39, lives with her husband and their three children. A year ago she decided to open her own business at home, and installed video arcade machines. She tends to her business every day, mostly in the afternoon. So far, the business is doing very well, so Maria has plans to expand it, and continue to provide additional income for support her family. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she has committed to making timely payments, and become a trustworthy member of her communal bank. With this loan, Maria wants to pay for maintenance on the machines, and she wants to give the down payment on a van for her husband, who works as a driver, but does not own the vehicle that he drives.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for video arcade machines

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La Sr. Maria tiene 59 años de edad, habitante del barrio Villa Reconciliación  en la capital de Managua de estado civil soltera,  con ochos hijos todos independizaron de ella. Sus planes es tener una vivienda segura y protegida. 
Dona Maria tiene su pequeño negocio situado en su casa de habitación de cafetín desde hace nueve años lo posee, inicio con fondo propios y vende refrescos, café, pan simple y pan dulce, cosméticos y de todo un poco, así ella se ayuda económicamente. Sus metas es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda para ofrecerles a los clientes mayor comodidad, seguridad y protección. También oto objetivo a  futuro incrementar las ventas con nuevos productos en su cafetín. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloque y otros materiales permitiendo hacer su casa, y así poder dar un buen servicio a sus clientes en su casa, pero una casa digna.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria is 59 years old, lives in the neighborhood Villa Reconciliación in the capital of Managua, her marital status is single and she has eight children who are independent from her. Her plan is to have safe and secure housing. Ms. Maria has a small business, a cafeteria, located in her home. She has had it for nine years, beginning with her own funds and selling drinks, coffee, simple bread and sweet bread, cosmetics and a bit of everything, which helps her economically. Her goals are to improve the infrastructure of her place to offer customers better convenience, safety and protection. Another objective for the future is to sell new products in her cafeteria. Thanks to the loans from Afodenci she has purchased materials for construction such as: cement, iron, blocks and other materials that will allow her to make her house and give good service to her clients in her house, a worthy house. .

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to finish constructing her house

loans.name: Marilú

texts.es: Marilú tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Hace 2 años se asoció con uno de sus sobrinos para instalar un taller de mecánica, su sobrino repara los carros de motor gasolinero y ella vende los repuestos necesarios, de esa manera y por la alianza han salido adelante para enfrentar los duros momentos de escasez económica, y tienen con este medio un ingreso más. Ella atiende su negocio preferentemente en las tardes donde más abunda la clientela, ahora su deseo es seguir adelante e implementar con más productos su vitrina de ventas. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a ser una de las mejores clientes, siendo muy responsable en sus pagos. Con esta cantidad aumentará su capital de trabajo con la compra de más repuestos para autos.
texts.en:
37-year old Marilú lives with her husband and children. Two years ago she went into partnership with one of her nephews and opened a garage. Her nephew repairs engines, and she sells spare parts. Because of the partnership, everything is going well even in hard economic times, and they have increased their income. Marilú takes care of the business especially in the afternoons when there are more customers. Her wish now is to continue doing well and have more products to put in the display window. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan from MFP, and she promises that she will be a highly regarded client, always paying back her loan on time. With the money she will increase her working capital and buy more vehicle spare parts.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. DesD. hace 8 años se dedica a la venta D.  productos D. primera necesidad, todas las mañanas y todos los días se esfuerza con la buena atención que ofrece para adquirir nuevos clientes, su tienda está ubicada en uno D. los mercadillos cercanos a su casa, por lo que se le hace más fácil estar permanentemente en la atención D. su negocio, D. esta manera, garantiza un ingreso más en su hogar y se mantiene alegre y satisfecha consigo misma D. estar siendo un sostén económico más. Su deseo es seguir adelante y tener cada vez más  la mercadería. Es la primera vez que Mayela solicita un préstamo con MFP y se compromete en ser responsable en sus pagos y desempeñarse bien en su banco comunal. Con el monto solicitando invertirá en la compra D. mercadería para su tienda D. abarrotes, comprará sacos D. arroz, azúcar y menestras.
texts.en:
54-year old Mayela lives with her husband and children. For the last eight years she has sold basic necessities. Every day she works hard to proviD. good service in order to gain new customers. Her store is located in one of the street markets near her house which makes it easier for her to always be on hand to serve her customers. Thus she can guarantee earning more money for her family, and she herself also feels happy and satisfied that she is a contributing member. Her wish is to continue doing well and to keep expanding her inventory. This is the first time that Mayela has asked for a loan from MFP, and she promises that she will repay her loan to the communal bank in a timely, responsible manner. With the loan she will buy more merchandise for her grocery store such as bags of rice, sugar, and beans.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Lesli Lorena

texts.es:
La joven de nombre Lesli Lorena Rodríguez tiene la edad de 33 años, su estado civil es divorciada, esta joven tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hija menor de 9 años cursa recientemente el 4 grado de primaria y su otro hijo de 12 años que cursa el 6 grado de primaria, sus deseos son obtener una casa propia ya que en la que reside actualmente es de su papa y así podrá darle a sus hijos un lugar propio donde vivir, sus propósitos son de aumentar su negocio y mantenerlo activo ya que negocio le ayudo en sus principios para seguir adelante y así ayudar a sus hijos y a su papa ya que ellos le dieron el apoyo necesario para seguir adelante.


Su actividad económica es la de comerciante en donde vende los productos como: manteles, cortinas y delantales de gabachas el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 2 años, la ubicación de su negocio es en Chinandega, ella inicia este negocio por su Mama ya que desde pequeña asistía a su negocio y al pasar del tiempo su Mama le propone realizar la venta de algunos productos de los cuales las ganancias serian de ella y es así como decide independizarse de su Mama para obtener su establecimiento y sus propios productos y empieza con la venta de los adelantares de gabacha, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita invertir mas en sus productos para tener una amplia variedad de todo ya que se acerca la temporada festiva y necesita satisfacer a su clientes con sus productos.
texts.en:
Lesli Lorena R. is 33 years old, divorced, has two young children, their ages as follows: her youngest daughter is 9 years old and recently entered the 4th grade of primary school and her other son is 12 years old in 6th grade, their desires are to get their own house as they are currently living with her father and to give her children a proper place to live she plans to increase her business and keep it active because the business helps her in her principles to move forward and help her children and her father so they can give him the help necessary to move forward. Her economic activity is that of a merchant selling product such as tablecloths, curtains and aprons. She has owned her business for two years, the business is located in Chinandega. The business was started by her mother and from the time she was young she assisted with the business and as time passed her mother helped her sell various products, whose profits would be hers and in this way she decided to become independent from her mother to obtain her establishment and her own products and began to sell aprons. The financing is for working capital that she needs to invest in her products to have a greater variety of everything now that the festival season is approaching and she needs to satisfy her customers with her products.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Se dedica desde hace 3 años a vender todo tipo de artículos para el hogar y también como abastecimiento a las tiendas, vende todo tipo de dulces, prendas de vestir, artículos de limpieza, etc., de esa manera puede tener los ingresos económicos necesarios para educar a sus hijos. Nelly se traslada todos los sábados con una camioneta de muchos años de uso para  repartir todos estos productos, su principal almacén es su casa, donde cuidadosamente selecciona lo que ha de vender, y reparte principalmente a los pequeños comerciantes de las ferias de cada zona local, su meta es tener una gran distribuidora a nivel de la ciudad que le permita ser una empresaria de éxito. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a ser responsable con los pagos. Con esta cantidad incrementará su mercadería para aprovechar esta campaña navideña .
texts.en:
34-year old Nelly lives with her husband and children. For the last three years her job has been selling all types of household items and also supplies for stores. She sells many sorts of candy, clothing, and cleaning supplies and in this way earns enough money to pay for her children’s education. Every Saturday Nelly travels in a much-used truck to deliver these products. Her main storage place is her house where she carefully selects what she has for sale, and takes these goods to small business owners in the local markets. Her goal is to have a widespread distribution network in the city and become a successful entrepreneur. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan from MFP, and she promises to be a responsible client in regard to repayments. With the loan she will buy more merchandise to sell during the upcoming Christmas period.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Christmas products

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. Julio tiene 51 años de edad,  habita en barrio Villa Reconciliación de la capital de Managua, estado civil casado su esposa es ama de casa y tienen seis hijos de los seis, cinco ya son mayores y el menor  de 16 años de edad estudia. Los planes para su familia es dejarle un patrimonio en cual  sus hijos puedan tener .Don Julio se desempeña como vigilante en unos de los mercados de la capital desde hace ocho años. Sus objetivos  en el ámbito económico es cambiar de trabajo con un mejor salario construir su casa por completo quiere construir las divisiones de adentro son de madera y casi no tiene privacidad, y le resulta muy incomodo es por eso que desea hacer esta construcción. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, piedras, ladrillos y ofrecerle a su familia sus propios espacios, la seguridad y protección para ellos.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio is 51 years old, lives in the neighborhood Villa Reconciliación in the capital of Managua, is married, his wife is a homemaker and they have six children, of the six five are older and the youngest is 16 years old and in school. The plan for their family is to leave an estate that their children could have. Mr. Julio has worked as a guard in one of the markets in the capital for eight years. His economic objectives are to change his job for a better paying one and build a complete house- he wants to build divisions because the inside is wooden and there is no privacy, which is uncomfortable and for this reason he wants to do this construction. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic he can purchase construction material such as: cement, iron, stones, bricks and give his family their own spaces and security and protection.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make divisions in his house

loans.name: Modesto Jose

texts.es: El joven Modesto está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (costrucción de una habitación), trabaja como ejecutivo de ventas en la CURACAO desde hace 3 años,  es un  joven, responsable, honesto, trabajador con alto espiritu de superación personal, vive en la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea, actualmente  esta estudiando 4to año en administración de Empresas  en la Univesidad  URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea, a pesar que no tiene hijos se encarga del cuido de sus padres y de los gastos familiares, ya que ellos son personas de escasos recursos económicos y dependen del salario que el devenga, el es un ejemplo de hijo para todos los Nicaraguenses que aman y cuidan a sus padres,  su sueño es seguir  estudiando y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.a que en los créditos anteriores demostró capacidad y puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The young Modesto is requesting financing for his third credit to invest in improving his home (building a room). He works as a sales executive in CURACAO for three years. He is young, responsible, honest and a hardworker with high spirits. He lives in the zone number 5 in Nueva Guinea, and currently he is studying in his 4th year in Business Administration in the University URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea. Although he does not have children, he takes care of his parents and the household expenses because they are people of limited economic resources and depend on the salary that he earns. He is a model son for all of the Nicaraguans who love and care for their parents, his dream is to continue studying and have job security to help his family. In previous loans he proved his capability and punctuality in paying his dues.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Edgar Antonio

texts.es:
El señor de nombre Edgar Antonio Sánchez tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es casado, este Señor tiene 2 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 32 años de edad trabaja por cuenta propia y su hija de 30 años que también labora por cuenta propia, su esposa labora como comerciante, sus deseos son de ampliar su negocio para seguir proporcionando a su familia ayuda económica ya que hasta los momentos con este negocio ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, en sus propósitos esta proporcionarle a su vivienda mejoras para que en un futuro sus hijos puedan tener un lugar digno donde vivir ya que todo lo que tiene es debido al arduo trabajo que ha realizado.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de reloj para mujer y para varón el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 15 años, la ubicación es de forma ambulante, el inicia este negocio por cuenta propia ya que Don Edgar poseía conocimientos de relojería y es así como el obtiene la experiencia en este campo y decide realizar la compra de reloj y venderlos al por mayor a sus clientes y así obtiene este tipo de negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de mas producto ya que a Don Edgar le resulta mas favorable la compra en los diferentes departamentos como Chinandega, Managua y Chichigalpa para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Edgar Antonio Sánchez is 53 years old, married and has 2 children, His oldest son is 32 years old and is self-employed and his daughter is 30 years old and also works on her own. His spouse works as a trader, their desires are to increase his business to continue providing his family with economic help because this business has helped the family move forward. It is in their plans to improve their home so that in the future their children will have a decent place to live, for all that they have is thanks to the hard work that he has done. The economic activity he is dedicated to is selling watches for women and men. He has owned his business for 15 years, it is located in a mobile cart. He began this business by himself because Mr. Edgar has contacts in the watch business and this is how he obtained the experience in this field and decided to purchase the watches and sell them to customers, and that's how he had this kind of business. The financing is for working capital that will be used for the purchase of more products because Mr. Edgar found it is more favorable to purchase in different regions such as Chinandega, Managua y Chichigalpa to satisfy the demand from his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martha Miriam

texts.es: La profesora Martha S. está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 5to crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (repellar la vivienda), trabaja como docente desde hace 21 años, tiene 4 hijos, todos estudian y la hija mayor  estudia y trabaja a la vez para ayudar a su mamá con los gastos familiares ya que son muy pobres, a pesar que Martha ha sido madre y padre para sus hijos ha luchado para que a ellos no le falte lo básico en el  hogar, es una docente que ama su trabajo ya que ayuda a muchos niños a leer, escribir y a ser mejores personas para la sociedad, actualmente esta estudiando su 4to año en la universidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea. Ella se siente agradecida con la Institución de AFODENIC pues con los créditos anteriores ha comprado electrodomésticos y a mejorado la vivienda donde ella vive, su sueño es tener una vivienda bonita y trabajo para así sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Professor Martha S. would like to refinance her fifth loan, in order to invest in home improvements. Martha has been a teacher for 21 years. She has four children, and all of them are in school. Her eldest daughter works in addition to studying full time in order to help her mother cover the family's expenses. They're very poor but in spite of that Martha has been a mother and father to her children, fighting to ensure that their basic needs are met. Martha loves her job, especially helping children learn to read, write, and become better citizens. She's currently studying in her fourth year of university at URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea. Martha is grateful for AFODENIC and has used prior credits to buy home appliances, improving her house. Her dream is to own a beautiful home and work so that her children can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Andrea Policena

texts.es: La señora Andrea es habitante de la zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea, esta solicitando su 5to crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para invertirlo en arenillar las paredes de su casa y de esta forma mejorar las condiciones económica del nucleo familiar, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor tiene 12 años estudia su quinto grado de educación primaria y la niña  de 9 años estudia su tercer grado, su esposo trabaja como colector de la Alcadia Municipal, ambos comparten los gastos familiares ya que son muy unidos, Andrea se caracteriza por ser muy responsable, honesta y ha demostrado buena conducta en la sociedad, ella es muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo, padres y alumnos por ser una mujer muy humilde, su sueño es tener salud, estabilidad laboral y que sus dos hijos estudien para que lleguen a ser personas de bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Andrea lives in zone #6 of Nueva Guinea. She's asking for her fifth loan with AFODENIC, which she'll use to invest in sanding the walls of her home, thereby improving the economic conditions of her nuclear family. Andrea has two children. Her is 12 years old and is in fifth grade. Andrea's daughter is 9 years old and in the third grade. Andrea's husband works as a collector in the municipal government. Both Andrea and her husband work to cover the family's expenses, and they're very close with each other. Andrea is responsible, honest, and has demonstrated good citizenship. She's well loved by her colleagues, parents, and students for her humility. Her dream is to be healthy and have a stable job, so that her two children can grow up to be good people.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sand the walls of her home

loans.name: Heidy Thalia

texts.es:
La señora Heidy pertenece al Banco Comunal “Loreto”, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez Nº 620, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja en el aserradero “Aserrador”. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de dulces, aguajes y gaseosas. Tiene una bebe recién nacida, motivo por el cual está de descanso médico y para ello tiene el apoyo de su querida madre. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 6 moldes de dulces, 2 sacos de aguajes, 6 paquetes de gaseosas, etc.

Heidy es una mujer con muchos deseos de triunfar en la vida para poder darle una buena educación a sus queridos hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Heidy belongs to the "Loreto" Community Bank. She lives on Comandante Suárez Nº 620 in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province in the department of Ucayali. She is 28 years old, and the mother of two young children who depend on her. Heidy is married and her husband works in the sawmill. With her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos, Heidy invested in a clothing sales business. She's been working for three years with the community bank. Now Heidy sells candy, fruits, and sodas. She has a newborn baby, and is now on bed rest, while her mother helps out with the business. With his loan of 1,000 soles Heidy will buy six candy plasters, two bags of aguaje fruits, six packs of sodas, etc. She'll repay the loan in five months. Heidy wants badly to triumph in life so that she can provide a good education to her beloved children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She'll buy six candy molds, two sacks of aguaje fruits, six packs of sodas, etc.

loans.name: Ana Celina

texts.es: La Sr. Ana tiene 31 años de edad, habitante de bario Villa Reconciliación, en la capital de Managua, de estado civil casada su esposo posee modulo que los alquila ubicado en un punto de la capital de Managua. Sus planes para su familia es mejorar su nivel de vida, mediante un mayor ingreso de económico en los alquileres de modulo. Doña Ana alquila cuartos siendo un ingreso mas a la economía del hogar, sus objetivos en el ámbito laboral es mejorar la infraestructura de la piezas de alquiler.Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales como: cementos, piedras, hierros y bloques para las mejoras de su casa ya que es de zinc y es muy sencilla y insegura y desea tener una casa digna donde pueda sentir seguridad, ella y sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana is 31 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in Managua. Ana is married and her husband owns a home on a corner in the capital of Managua. Ana rents rooms in their home in order to earn money, and she'd like to improve the infrastructure of the rooms for rent. Thanks to the AFODENIC loans, Ana has been able to buy materials like: cement, stone, iron and blocks to improve her home (it is made of zinc, meaning the structure is simple and insecure). Ana would like to have a dignified house where she can feel secure and offer that same security to her clients. Ana and her husband would like to improve their quality of life by earning more from their rentals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make their house out of concrete

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La profesora Ana Maria, soltera, con 2 hijos en union de hecho con el Sr. Efrain Laguna, sus hijos son estudiantes de secundaria, ella trabaja en el Instituto San Juan Bautista de Cuapa, con 21 años de servicio, esta solicitando su 10mo credito el que utilizara para la compra de terneros pues su comprañero tiene una finquita y le ayudara con el cuido de sus animales, estos animales son parte del patrimonio que desea dejarle a sus hijos en el futuro.   Durante sus creditos anteriores ha cancelado antes de la fecha esablecida, pues es una persona con mucha responsabilidad y esta catalogada como clienta con categoria "A".  Manifesto que confia cen AFODENIC ya que desde su inicio esta trabajando con sus creditos y siempre ha recibido excelente trato.  Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos sigan estudiando para llegar a ser personas de bien.
texts.en:
Professor Ana Maria is lives with her partner, Mr. Efrain Laguna, and their two children. Ana Maria's children are in high school, and she works at the San Juan Bautista de Cuapa Institute. Ana Maria has been working there for 21 years and now she's asking for a 10 month loan, which she'll use to buy calves. One of her colleagues has a small farm and Ana Maria helps care for the animals. She'd like to leave these animals for her children to inherit. Ana Maria has repaid her past loans in advance of the due dates, and she is very responsible. She is a category "A" client. Ana Maria says that she is confident in AFODENIC, and she has been working with the institution since it began, and has always received excellent service. Her greatest dream is that her children can keep studying and become good people.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calves

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es: La Joven Martha Lidia  está solicitando su1er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Repellar la vivienda), trabaja como docente en la colonia Providencia a 32 km de Nueva Guinea  desde hace 2 años, todos los dias tiene que  levantarse a las 4 de la mañana para viajar y dejar el desayuno hecho para su esposo, por las tardes cuando regresa de dar clase se dedica a cuidar a su hijo, terminar de hacer los quehaceres del hogar y por la noche a planear la clase para impartirla el siguiente dia a sus alumnos, Martha es una mujer  profesional responsable, honesta, trabajadora, vive en la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea donde la población cada dia crece mas,  tiene un bebe de 10 meses, su esposo trabaja como agricultor, ambos comparte los gastos del hogar; su sueño es   seguir  estudiando, salud y en el futuro tener una casa bonita con todas las condiciones  para que su hijito crezca en un ambiente sano y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia ya son de escasos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Martha Lida is asking for her first loan in order to invest in home improvements. Martha works as a teacher in colonia Providencia, 32 kilometers outside of Nueva Guinea. She's been working for two years, and every day she wakes up at 4am in order to make breakfast for her husband and travel to work. In the afternoons Martha returns from class and cares for her son. She finishes her chores and spends her evenings putting together lesson plans for the following day. Martha is a professional, responsible, honest, and hard-working young woman. She lives in zone #5 of Nueva Guinea, where the population is growing rapidly. Martha has a ten month old baby and her husband works as a farmer. Martha and her husband share the household expenses. Their dream is to continue their studies, and to be healthy. In the future they'd like to have a beautiful home where their son can grow up in a healthy environment and have job security, so that he can add to the family's scarce economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Mily Caronila

texts.en:
Mily C. E. is a 22-year-old entrepreneur who sells salchipapas (Peruvian dish consisting of hot dogs and french fries) from a cart on a highway near her home in Carabayllo, a northern suburb of Lima, Peru. She is requesting this loan of 600 soles to help expand her business; she wants to be able to offer a wider variety of food options, to have a covering for her cart, and to add lights to it as well. She will pay back the loan over a period offour months. This married mother of two children, aged 5 and 2, works from 5pm to 10pm every night at her salchipapas business and has been doing so since the age of 14.

She views this loan as the first step to achieving her greater goals. One day she hopes to convert her salchipapas cart business into a restaurant. Then she wants to have her own house and be able to have enough room in it to open a weekend retreat hotel. While the process of achieving her dreams is likely to be a long one, this loan will help her take the next step in it. She believes she already has part of her dream achieved by owning her own business, however small it may be.

loans.use: To invest in salchipapas dinner business

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en: Mrs. Carmela G. has applied for a loan to grow her wholesale vegetable business in Carabayllo, a northern suburb of Lima, Peru.  She has been in this business for only four months, and her first loan with EDAPROSPO played a big role in starting her new career.  She buys vegetables such as lettuce, onions, radishes and celery wholesale and sells them in smaller quantities for a profit.  Mrs. G. has three children - ages 18, 15, and 11 - and one of the main uses of her profits will be to convert their house from adobe to concrete. Her immediate goal for her vegetable business, and one your loan may help her achieve, is to get her own stall in the market because she currently has to sell her vegetables by walking around.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes C. is a loving mother and entrepreneur who sells vegetables in a market in Carabayllo, a northern suburb of Lima, Peru.  She is requesting a loan, paid back over 4 months, of 500 soles to buy more vegetables to sell.  She has been working for 10 years but is only a recent participant in microfinance; this will be her second loan with EDAPROSPO.  Lourdes buys vegetables wholesale and sells them in the market from 4am to 10am every morning.  With her current level of sales, she makes around 200 to 300 soles in profits a week.  Her dreams rest on her two year-old son.  In the short-term, she hopes to make enough to build her house and buy clothes for her son.  Her life's dream, however, is to work hard enough that he won't have to work in the market like her but instead go to school and become a professional.

loans.use: To Buy More Vegetables

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Mrs. Janet D. L. C. is a married mother of two (ages 7 and 4) who sells mazamorra morada (a Peruvian breakfast dish) in her neighborhood in Carabayllo, a northern suburb of Lima, Peru.  She is requesting a loan of 200 soles to be paid over 4 months in order to buy more ingredients for her mazamorra.  She has been in the business for the past six months, selling two sizes of mazamorra for 50 centavos and 1 sole respectively from 3pm to 6pm every day.  Her goal for the business is to expand it a little and use the profits to buy shoes and school supplies for her two children.  Though she entered the business because she sometimes did not have any food when her children would ask her, she hopes to end her business career many years from now, with them becoming professionals and having better lives.

loans.use: To Buy More Product

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth C. E. D. F. is a recent mother (2 month old daughter) who wants to begin raising animals at her house.  Now with a baby, Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 600 soles to be repaid over 4 months in order to buy piglets and ducklings to raise for resale.  She is in the final year of university and hopes that this business (and loan) will help her realize her dream of graduating and becoming a professional.   While her dream is to become a professional, she is also hoping the piglets and ducklings will grow very large, large enough to drop the suffixes and be just pigs and ducks (and fat!).  With a very cheerful demeanor, she is tackling her motherhood and education with an entrepreneurial response.

loans.use: To Buy Piglets to Raise for Resale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
In order to succeed, Rebecca believes she needs three things: thrift, patience and perseverance.  

Rebecca A. has managed her store since 1995. She has been able to maintain her business because of her attentiveness and hard work and the help of her husband and children, who serve as her inspiration. She is 43 years old and has three children: Renerold – 16 years old, a first-year college student; Ralph – 12 years old, already in high school; and Remington – 6 years old, in elementary school.  They live in Yeban Norte.

Managing a sari-sari (or community-based) store is her way of helping her husband improve their living conditions and provide for their basic needs as well as the education of their children. Rebecca believes in the saying: “if there is a will, there a way." She also added that, “If you don’t look for ways to improve your life, there will be no progress." 

Rebecca has applied for a new loan to buy more products to sell in her store.  She also hopes that her store will become a larger, mini-grocery in the future.  

She believes that through her business she can help give her family have a stable source of income and support the education of their children through college.

loans.use: purchase of additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
“I would like to sustain our business and somehow expand it in the future because it is my goal to help my husband in supporting the needs of our family, especially the education of our children,” Milagros said.

Milagros is helping her husband earn a living by collecting and selling firewood in their village.  During weekends, their children also help her collect wood. 

She is married to Gaudencio, a driver in their area.  They are helping each other provide for the needs of their family, especially the education of their children who are still studying.  They are blessed with six: Ranmil – 28 years old and a college undergraduate; Mila – 22 years and a high school graduate; Myrr – 20 years old and in the third year of college; Gaudencio Jr. – 19 years, a vocational course graduate in automotive repair; Mae – 14 years, in junior high school; and Ralph – 13 years old and a high school freshman. 

Milagros wanted to become an entrepreneur but lack of capital prevented her from sustaining her wood business.  She has applied for a loan which she will use to compensate people who collect wood.  This will not only allow her to have enough wood to sell, but can also help her neighbors earn extra income.

loans.use: to hire people to collect wood for her business

location.town: Sitio Guingab, Masipi East Cabagan, Isabela

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is Samuel Abdul M., age 36.  He was born in Magburaka town, Tonkolili District, in northern Sierra Leone. Abdul is married to a businesswoman and the two have four children. Three of his children are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Abdul runs a video center (a cinema with several 19” televisions) where he shows movies and European soccer matches.   People of all ages come to watch Premier League, FA Cup, Carling Cup and European Championship Cup matches.  Once in a while, he’ll also televise the German, Spanish and Italian league games.  He has never received a loan from SMT before, but is now applying for one to help him strengthen his business.

With this loan, Abdul will make a great improvement to his operation. Currently, he is using two satellite dishes, but this is not enough. These dishes cannot show all of the above-mentioned matches. Abdul will therefore add some of his own savings to the money from the loan to buy a new satellite dish that can show all of the above-mentioned matches. He will travel to Freetown, about 240 miles round trip, to buy it. 

Not having the third dish has been Abdul’s greatest challenge in his business. Many customers deserted him because of his inability to show all of the matches. But with this loan, and the dish that he’ll be able to buy, he is optimistic that he will be able to regain all of his lost customers and even find some new ones. Many of the youths in town prefer his video center to others because of its convenient location in the center of town. In addition to having a good location, he is young and many youth like patronizing with him because of their similarities. Also, as chairman of the Motorbike Rider’s Association, he is very popular among the many motorbike riders.

When business improves for Abdul, he will be able to take good care of his family, pay school fees, and provide them with more food and clothing.

loans.use: buying a third satellite dish for his video center

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas G. is 26 years old and widely thought of as very determined to fulfill his dreams for his family.  With his talent and skills, he is sure that he can uplift their lives from poverty.  

He is married to Shery and has three children: Shery-Ann – 6 years old and a day-care student; Flora – 4 years old; and Nicolas Jr, one month old. His family lives in the rural and flat area of Malamag East, where vegetable planting and clean and green programs are the main projects being implemented in their village and other villages. Sometimes, floods strike in their village when excessive rains and typhoons take place.  

Nicolas manages a small furniture shop which is his only source of income.  He wants a better life for his family and hopes to achieve this by improving his business. In order to do so, he has applied for a loan which he will use to buy materials such as wood.

Nicolas works hard for the success of his business.  He is very optimistic that he can achieve his dreams and he believes that God is good all of the time.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood for his shop

loans.name: Jenry Omar

texts.en:
Jenry Omar is working his way through university. With his childhood dream of becoming a professional now within reach, he is asking for a loan of 400 Soles to pay his upcoming school fees. Jenry has always wanted to study to become a medical technician but has also always had to work. 

From a very young age when he worked in a bakery, he has been in a number of odd jobs. Currently, Jenry works three days a week as a "cobrador" (in Peru's informal transportation business, the person on buses and vans who tell the driver when to stop to pick up passengers and when to go, announce stops, and collect passengers' fares). 

He wants to be licensed as a medical technician, however, to do that he still needs to get his título (certificate), which takes a year. He plans on continuing his transportation job when he's a medical technician but hopes he'll have enough to own his own car and run it as a taxi when needed. 

With this loan, Jenry Omar will be one step closer to his life goals of owning his own house, business, and working as a licensed medical technician.

loans.use: To pay for school fees to become a medical technician

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
This is Daniel D. T., age fifty-five. Daniel was born in Magburaka town, Tonkolili District, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and the two have eight children. Six of his children are currently living on their own and two are in secondary school. Daniel sells a number of items, including palm oil, rice, soft drinks, cigarettes, soaps, toothpaste, sardines, Peak brand powdered milk and more. This will be his very first loan from SMT. He is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 to help him strengthen his business.

With this loan, Daniel will strengthen his business by buying a refrigerator and a generator. With these machines, Daniel will be able to sell cold drinks. He will buy the machines from neighboring Makeni (30 miles round trip). The refrigerator will cost him Le 1,200,000 and the generator will cost him Le 800,000.

Business had been moving at a slow pace for Daniel, but he is quite sure that with this loan business will start running faster for him.  Sales will increase with the introduction of the new items in his shop. Needless to say, when sales increase and Daniel generates more income, he will feel good and become a happy man.

loans.use: buying a refrigerator and generator to chill his beverages

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic R. got married when she was 17 years old. Marrying at a young age has not been a hindrance for her to have a happy family. In fact, it taught her to become productive.  

She is now 19 years old and her husband Rock John R. is supporting their family through his farm business. The young couple has a two-year-old daughter named Shane-Ann. Their family is living in a mountainous area of Old San Mariano. This is considered to be a dangerous place but they are not afraid to live here because they believe that God is with them all the time. 

Marivic is a very responsible wife and mother.  She engaged in hog raising to help her husband earn additional income for their family.  Her pigpen is located in their backyard. She also wants to have a store, which could be another source of income for them.

To further achieve her dreams, Marivic is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000.00 which she can use for her hog raising business and in starting her sari-sari (a community based store). 

She hopes to have a better life as soon as possible for the welfare of their daughter and future children. “I don’t want my child to experience the hardships that I have been through. I am hoping that through my efforts, our life will be uplifted,” says Marivic. 

To have a better life, provide good education to her child and a comfortable house for them are some of her prayers and dreams for her family.   She believes that all of these will come into reality with their diligence and determination to look for possible opportunities.

loans.use: to be used in her hog raising business and to put up a small store

location.town: Old San Mariano, San Mariano Isabela

loans.name: Learn To Grow Group

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim K. and Fatmata T.. They named their group "Learn to Grow". They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Makeni. This is the third time they’ve received a Kiva loan through SMT. Previous loan had made significant contributions to the wellbeing of these entrepreneurs. Ibrahim, for example, can now boast of a business that is worth more than Le 2,000,000. He is very thankful to God for all the loans he has received. Learn to Grow is requesting a loan of Le 1,200,000 to further enable them to strengthen their businesses by buying more products to their sellable stock.

Ibrahim is the leader of the group. He is forty-three years of age. He was born in Robuya Romendeh, in the Port Loko District in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and the two have five children. Four of their children are in secondary school and one in primary school. Ibrahim sells second-hand clothes, belts and several other items – like mints, sardines, drinks, cosmetics, cigarettes, etc. – in Makeni. He has been in this business for 20 years now.

With this new loan, Ibrahim will expand his business. He will be able to buy at least two bales of second-hand clothes. A bale of second-hand clothes will cost him anywhere between Le 350,000 and 400,000 in Freetown. Ibrahim’s round-trip fare to Freetown costs him Le 30,000. He will use the balance of the loan to buy more of the articles he sells at his store.

The only challenge he faces in his business is the occasional slow rate of sales he encounters. Apart from this, things are going fine for him. He likes his business and enjoys doing it. 

Most importantly, the loan will enable Ibrahim and Fatmata to educate and feed their children.

loans.use: purchasing second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Neiva

texts.en:
Mrs. Neiva R. is a hardworking mother of four who owns her own restaurant in Carabayllo, a northern suburb of Lima, Peru.  She is requesting a loan of 200 Soles to be repaid over four months in order to grow her restaurant's business a bit more.
