Neiva is married with four children - ages 20, 18, 16, and 11 - and also works as the treasurer of her banquito ('little bank' lending group at EDAPROSPO). She started her business in the market, but after two years has now moved into a rented indoor space. She works from 5:30am to 4:00pm everyday selling breakfasts for 3.5 Soles and fixed menu lunches for 4.5 Soles. 

Her dishes include ceviche de pollo (a twist on the classic ceviche which is raw fish soaked in lime juice and served with onions), spaghetti, aji de gallina [traditional Peruvian chicken stew in a spicy, nutty cheese sauce], and pollo a la cerveza [beer-cooked chicken].  She sells about 40 to 50 lunches a day and comes out with a daily profit of around 50 Soles.  As she accumulates more capital and gains more experience, her dream is to study to become a chef (which is expensive in Lima, the culinary capital of South America) and learn how to cook international food.

loans.use: To invest in restaurant

loans.name: By God In Power Group

texts.en:
Zainab K. and Adama M. are two local entrepreneurs in the town of Makeni. They named their group By God In Power, a Krio phrase meaning “by the power of God.”  

They have received previous Kiva loans through SMT. Most recently, each of them received a loan of Le 500,000, which was a great help to Zainab and Adama. The loan enabled them to expand their businesses, make additional profits, and consequently improve the living condition of members of the group.  Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are each asking for Le 800,000. 

Zainab (right) is the leader of the group. She is forty-seven years of age and was born in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone.  She is married to a teacher, and they have had five children together.  Zainab sells several items in a kiosk on Magburaka road in Makeni. Some of the items she sells include body lotions, cigarettes, biscuits, and Peak brand powder.  She has been in the business for over ten years now.

With this new loan, Zainab will expand her business. She will be able to buy items in bulk to add to her business. For example, she will now be able to buy one carton of cigarettes instead of one pack at a time.  She will travel to Freetown (240 miles r/t) to purchase these goods. 

Zainab thanks God that her business is doing fine. She will reinvest some of the income generated from the loan back into the business.  She will use the rest to take care of her children, specifically their education, food and clothing.

loans.use: Purchasing lotions, cigarettes, biscuits and other goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Gladis

texts.en:
Mrs. Gladis E. D. C. is a lighthearted mother of seven with a husband whom works in the mines in Peru.  Gladis is originally from the Junin province, but now lives in Carabayllo, a northern suburb of Lima where she has her own artesanía (traditional crafts) business.  She is requesting a loan of 300 soles to be repaid over 4 months to buy a sewing machine for her business so that it can grow.  

Mrs. E. D. C. sews in her house and travels out to the provinces every 15 to 20 days to sell her handicrafts; all of her goods are maD. to order.  Her dream, she says with a laugh hiding behind her eyes, is that her children (5 girls and 2 boys) will do well.  She specifically wants her son (Jenry Omar, who is also raising a loan on Kiva here) to become a professional.

loans.use: To support her Artesanía

loans.name: Mayamka Group

texts.en:
Mariatu K. and Adama S. K. named their group Mayamka.  They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Makeni, and this is not their first time receiving a Kiva loan through SMT.  Previous loans have been a great help to the members of this group. It enabled them to expand their businesses, make more profits, and consequently improve the living conditions of the members of the group.  Having repaid their last loan successfully, they have requested a new loan for the amount of Le 1,500,000.

Mariatu is the leader of the group and fifty years of age. She was born in Magbass, a few miles away from Magburaka in the Tonkolili District in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a diamond digger, and they have three children. One of their children is now running a business, one is in secondary school and the youngest is in primary school. Mariatu sells groundnuts and sometimes items such as onions, rice, and palm oil depending on market demand. She has been in business for more than thirty years now.

With this new loan, Mariatu will expand her business by buying more bags of groundnuts.  She will be able to get at least eight bags of groundnuts depending on the price determined by the market.  She travels to Bamoi (a make-shift business center) to buy the groundnuts.  In Bamoi, a bag of groundnuts costs something between Le 80,000 and 110,000.  She pays a fare of Le 15,000 or 20,000 for transport to and from Bamoi and another Le 2,000 as a delivery charge for each bag of groundnuts she brings back with her.

Every time she receives a loan from SMT, Mariatu experiences growth in her business. This time again, she is expecting an increase in profit, which will improve her standard of living. She will be able to assist her children in school, feed them and give them medical attention whenever they are sick.

loans.use: Bags of groundnuts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Trust Me Group

texts.en:
Iye L. and Osman K. are local entrepreneurs in the town of Makeni. They named their group Trust Me and have several loans from Kiva through SMT.  Recently, each group member received a loan of Le 800,000, which was of a great help to members of this group. It enabled them to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve the living condition of members of the group.  Having repaid their last loan successfully, they have requested a loan for Le 1,000,000. 

Iye (left) is the leader of the group and is forty-three years of age. She was born in a village called Mayombo, about twenty-seven miles from Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. She is married, and her husband is a working professional. They have one child who is currently in secondary school.  Iye sells a number of items, such as ready-to-wear-clothes for both males and females, shoes, skirts, dishes, rubber bowls and so on. She has been in the business for twenty years now.

With this new loan, Iye will expand her business.  She can not tell exactly how much she will be able to buy as prices keeps fluctuating.  As Christmas is fast approaching, she will use the loan to buy pairs of jeans, trousers, skirts, shoes, sneakers and so on. These are popular Christmas gifts in Makeni.  She pays a fare of Le 70,000 to neighboring Guinea, where she buys the goods she sells.  Depending on the quality and type of goods, prices vary from one item to the other.

So far, the only major business challenge Iye faces is bad debtors. In other words, she has customers who do not pay in-full for their goods at the time of sale, and she has difficulty obtaining the remainder of their payment.  Apart from this, her business is going well.  She loves running her business so that she can feed her family and pay for her daughter’s education.

loans.use: Jeans, trousers, skirts, shoes and sneakers to sell during holiday season

loans.name: Drev

texts.en:
Drev D., 40, rose above the situation of living without a stable job.  Her family's day-to-day needs and the education of her four children were the problem at hand.  She had been toying with the idea of starting a business selling soap, soy sauce, vinegar, sugar and eggs, but she had no idea where to start, especially finding the capital.  

Her husband is a laborer and farmer and could not raise extra money for the store's needs.  They were thankful to their uncle helped initially fund the business.  With very little capital, they were able to rise above their hardships.  

Their daily sales give provide just enough to support their necessities.  They were able to buy and sell of whole nuts for extra income.  They joined Paglaum MPC in order to gain additional capital and applied for PHP 8,000 loan.  They were attracted to Paglaum MPC for its savings and insurance services of the cooperative.  

They want to gradually expand their little store.  They want to taste the "good life" and have a descent home.  Drev smiles and dry up tears while describing her dreams.

loans.use: To invest in beverages and canned goods for her store

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Opportunity knocked for Belinda E., 38 , who is married and from South Poblacion, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.  

Her husband who works in the Philippine National Army, gave her the capital to start her piggery business.  They figured that the space did not need to be very big, just big enough for five piglets.  Despite having zero sales in the first few months, it turned out well.   They sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive.  They gave their best efforts to produce good pigs, in order to sell them continuously.  

Belinda is now trying to expand their piggery business.  They presented their project proposal to Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative to buy additional piglets and animal feeds with a loan of PHP 5,000.  They are thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing their capital needs.  

They will be able to add a number of piglets and purchase sacks of feeds for their business.  In addition, they want to build a cemented piggery in their backyard and deliver pigs in volume to nearby towns.  

With their profits, they wish to send their children to school and have stable careers.  With Paglaum's help, they know they can!

loans.use: buy additonal piglets and animal feeds

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita and her family are currently living in Brgy Minallo, Naguillan, Isabela, a rural and agricultural Philippine community known for having disciplined and united residents. Married to a farmer named Delfin who is 16 years older than her, she has two siblings, Delmar, a 25-year-old college graduate and Rodel, a 22-year old high school graduate. Aside from managing a hog-raising business, Lolita also buys and sells piglets in their village.

With her skills in marketing, Lolita earns a steady income, and in order to develop it further, she is requesting a loan to buy two heads of piglets, two 50 kilogram sacks of feed and medicine for the raising of the piglets.

She has faith in the saying that if others can do it, so can she. Possessing the necessary financial support, Lolita promises that she will pay back the loan promptly so that she can be trusted for future loans.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly, 27, stays in Isabela caring for her children, Clarissa Mae, four, and Jexie Ann, two, while her husband works in Manila as a passenger conductor, returning home twice a month.

A diligent woman, Shirly did not want to depend on the income of her husband and so devised a plan for her own business, applying to become a dealer of Avon, Natasha and Board Walk products, selling cosmetics and clothes. With the help of her brochures, she goes house to house to collect orders from her regular customers and products are payable within one month. According to her, her sacrifices will be for the benefit of her children when they are going to school.

She is hoping to have a progressive life and so is requesting a loan to provide additional capital for her business. She hopes that as she increases her merchandise lines, she will also increase her income.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business.

location.town: Sitio Guingab, Masipi East Cabagan, Isabela

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
“I will value whatever support I can get and will utilize it in a proper way,” a mother of ten children from Barangay Malamag East Tumauini, Isabela said with the blink of hope in her eyes.

Margarita B. G. is known in the village as the hard-working wife of Juan G. and a mother of five girls and five boys ranging in age from 32 to 12. She is very proud of the fact that her children are either in school or have achieved either high school or college graduation.

Theirs is an agricultural community whose villagers can plant rice, corn, tobacco and various kinds of vegetables. Margarita’s husband Juan is one of the farmers specializing in planting rice and corn while she has been operating a community-based store since 2003, opening each morning at 6:00 and closing each evening at 7:00. Margarita has been able to support the daily needs of her family through this business.

To continue to help her husband, she is requesting a loan to purchase goods for her store such as canned items, a variety of noodles, basic commodities, smoke and dried fish, beans, eggs, soft drinks, rice, etc. The money will not only meet the additional needs of the store but ensure the financial support of her two youngest children’s education - the reason Margarita and her husband work so hard in their respective livelihoods.

loans.use: To purchase more products for her store.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
“I am very proud of how the members of my family do their part towards the achievement of one goal, which is to uplift the life of our family,” Leonor said.

Leonor L., 43, is married to Jaime and gifted with three children: Mark James – 24 years old, college undergraduate; Karen – 19 years old, currently in second year college and Kenneth Christian – 13 years old, a high school sophomore. The family is living in Sitio Guingab which is considered a poor and small village.

She has been engaged in the soap-vending business since the first quarter of 2008 and is requesting a loan to further invest in it. Leonor’s simple hope is to sustain her enterprise in order to assist her husband in supporting the needs of their family and providing their children with the best education that they can achieve so that they will enjoy successful lives in the future.

loans.use: To invest in her soap business.

location.town: Sitio Guingab, Masipi East Cabagan, Isabela

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Village Bank; “Sumaq Huayta” means “Beautiful Flower” in Quechua. Juana is 30 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their three children. She and her husband have a locksmith shop in their home; they have one employee who helps them with their work. Juana also makes homemade ice cream, which she sells from a cart on the streets around the city of Ayacucho. Juana needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy iron rods and ingredients to make ice cream. Juana dreams of improving and outfitting her business and that her children will grow up to be working professionals. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Linda Flor. Juana es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Juana junto a su esposo tienen un taller de cerrajería que esta ubicado en su domicilio, además tiene un personal que le ayuda en los trabajos. Además Juana vende helados que ella misma prepara, sus ventas los realiza ambulatoriamente por diferentes calles de la ciudad. Juana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fierros y insumos para helados. Juana sueña con mejorar e incrementar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Buy iron rods and ingredients to make ice cream

loans.name: Renee Elva

texts.en: Elva is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Village Bank; “Sumaq Huayta” means “Beautiful Flower” in Quechua. Elva is 30 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. Elva has a workshop where she sews custom clothing, located in the Jesus Nazareno Market. Elva and her husband own three stands where they sell pre-made clothing and shoes. Elva needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy underwear, socks, T-shirts and baby clothes. Elva dreams that her children will graduate from college with professional degrees, of expanding her workshop, and of buying all of the necessary machinery. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Elva es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Linda Flor. Elva es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Elva tiene un taller de confecciones de prendas de vestir que esta ubicado en el mercado Jesús Nazareno, confecciona prendas sobre medida, Elva tiene 3 puestos en donde vende ropa hecha, calzados, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo. Elva necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropas interiores, medias, polos y ropa de bebe. Elva sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar su taller e implementar con toda la maquinaria necesaria.

loans.use: Buy underwear, socks, t-shirts and baby clothes

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en: Joaquina is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Village Bank; “Sumaq Huayta” means “Beautiful Flower” in Quechua. Joaquina is 43 years old and has five children. Joaquina has a store in a rented location on Libertad Street, where she sells natural remedies that she buys in Lima. Sometimes she also buys grains, which she then sells in the city of Pisco. Joaquina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy grains and different kinds of flour. Joaquina dreams of starting her own laboratory to make natural remedies, that her children will graduate from college with professional degrees, and to travel to other countries with her children. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Joaquina es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Linda Flor. Joaquina es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 5 hijos, Joaquina tiene una tienda en un local alquilado ubicado en el Jr. Libertad en donde vende medicina natural que compra en la ciudad de Lima, además en algunas oportunidades compra cereales que luego lo vende en la ciudad de Pisco. Joaquina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales y molidos. Joaquina sueña con tener un laboratorio de medicamentos naturales, sus hijos sean profesionales y viajar al extranjero con sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy grains and different kinds of flour

loans.name: Olinda

texts.en: Olinda is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Village Bank; “Sumaq Huayta” means “Beautiful Flower” in Quechua. Olinda is 33 years old and married with two children. She and her husband own a shoe store, located in a gallery on a street near Ayacucho’s central market. She sells shoes for all ages and sporting equipment. Olinda needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy sporting goods. Olinda dreams of opening another branch of her store. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Olinda es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Linda Flor. Olinda es casada, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Olinda junto a su esposo tienen una zapatería ubicado en una galería que esta en una calle cercana al mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, vende zapatos para todas las edades y también implementos deportivos. Olinda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de artículos deportivos. Olinda sueña con tener otra sucursal, tener una casa en la ciudad de Lima.

loans.use: Buy sporting goods

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: Marlene is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Village Bank; “Sumaq Huayta” means “Beautiful Flower” in Quechua. Marlene is 28 years old and has two children. Marlene travels to different regional markets, where she sells dry goods and bread and buys a variety of grains, which she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Marlene also works in a store as a saleswoman. Marlene needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy rice, sugar, and milk. Marlene’s dreams are to buy a house and to provide her children with a good education. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Marlene es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Linda Flor. Marlene es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Marlene viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes, panes y de las ferias compra cereales diversos, cuyos productos luego vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además marleny trabaja en una tienda como vendedora. Marlene necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche. Los sueños de Marlene son comprar una casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and milk

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en: Roxana is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Village Bank; “Sumaq Huayta” means “Beautiful Flower” in Quechua. Roxana is 32 years old and lives with her partner and their son. Roxana has a store in her home, where she sells dry goods. She also sells meals and provides lodging for employees of a transportation company. Roxana needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy rice, sugar and milk. Roxana dreams of improving her business and expanding by offering a wider variety of merchandise. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Linda Flor. Roxana es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, Roxana tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, además Roxana vende comida y da pensión a los trabajadores de una empresa de transporte. Roxana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche. Roxana sueña con mejorar su negocio y ampliar con mas productos.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and milk

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.en: Maria is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Village Bank; “Sumaq Huayta” means “Beautiful Flower” in Quechua. Maria is 51 years old; she is divorced and has three children. Maria is an obstetrician. She and her siblings have a family business making gold and silver jewelry. Maria is in charge of selling jewelry to a number of different institutions. She sells on credit, and collects payments on a monthly basis. Maria needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy gold and jewels. Maria dreams of improving her business and of opening her own jewelry store. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Maria es socia D. Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Linda Flor. Maria es divorciada, tiene 51 años y 3 hijos, Maria es obstetriz de profesión , Maria junto a sus hermanos tienen una empresa familiar que se dedican a la elaboración de joyas de oro y plata, Maria se encarga de las ventas en las diferentes instituciones, las cuales son al crédito y cobra cada fin de mes. Maria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de oro y joyas. Maria sueña con mejorar su negocio y tener una tienda de joyas.

loans.use: Buy gold and jewels

loans.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Sr. Sonia tiene 33 años de edad, habitante del barrio Máximo Jerez en la capital de Managua, casada su esposo es comerciante, No tienen hijos. Sus planes para con la familia es brindarle una mayor comodidad  y seguridad.
Doña Sonia tiene su pequeño negocio de una pulpería lo inicio mediante sus propios recursos económicos, el negocio lo poseen desde hace dos años y medios .Sus objetivos en el ámbito económico es aumentar sus ventas con nuevos productos y comercializar productos como: carnes, verduras y granos básicos. Con la solicitud del préstamo va a comprar productos variados que sastifagan a sus clientes, y  así vender mas obteniendo más ingresos
Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograran que aumente sus utilidades con una nueva comercialización de productos.
texts.en:
33-year old Señora Sonia lives with her husband in the neighbourhood of Máximo Jerez in the capital city Managua. Her husband is a businessman. They don’t have any children. They would like a more comfortable and secure standard of living. Doña Sonia has a small convenience store which she started with her own money. She’s had this store for two and a half years. Her financial objective is to increase sales with new products such as meat, vegetables, and basic grains. With the loan she plans to buy various products to satisfy the demands of her clients and thus earn more money. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic she will manage to increase her profits by selling new products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products such as fruit and vegetables for her store

loans.name: Fiorela Liliana

texts.en: Fiorela is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Village Bank; “Sumaq Huayta” means “Beautiful Flower” in Quechua. Fiorela is 25 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. She has a rented store on Ciro Alegría Street, where she sells replacement car parts. Her husband is an electrician, and his workshop is located near her store. Fiorela works seven days a week. Fiorela needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy replacement car parts. Fiorela’s dreams are to expand her business, to offer a wider variety of products, and to provide her children with a good education. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Fiorela es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Linda Flor. Fiorela es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Fiorela tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en el Jr. Ciro alegría en donde vende repuestos para carros, además su esposo es electricista y tiene su taller cerca de su tienda, actividad que realiza todos los días. Fiorela necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos para carro. Los sueños de Fiorela son ampliar su negocio, surtir con mas productos y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy replacement car parts

loans.name: Berta Hilda

texts.es: La señora Bertilda P. tiene la edad de 24 años, habita en el barrio San Pedro ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo y hijo , el esposo de ella trabaja como transportista para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo a un niño de un año de edad , los planes para su familia es llegar a comprar un terreno y construir su casa ya que ellos actualmente vive con su mamá , ella desde hace dos año se dedica al comercio en la  venta de cosméticos , que con tanto esfuerzos ha logrado establecer , la mayor dificultas que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento con la solicitud del préstamo quiere invertir en mercadería variada para incrementar su negocio ya que en las fiestas navideñas presenta demanda de producto.
texts.en:
Señora Bertilda P. is 24 years old and lives with her husband and son in the neighbourhood of San Pedro in the municipality of Ticuantepe. Her husband is in the transportation business and also helps with household expenses. They are responsible for the care of their one-year old son. They plan to buy a piece of land and build their own house since currently they are living with Bertilda’s mother. For the last two years Bertilda has been selling cosmetics and through hard work she has managed to establish a successful business. The biggest difficulty she faces is the lack of financing. With this loan she plans to buy a variety of merchandise for her business as the Christmas festivities will bring increased demand for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: La señora Ángela G. tiene la edad de 34 años habita el barrio altos del norte ubicado en la ciudad de Masaya , junto a su esposo , el cual le poya con los gastos del hogar ya que el trabaja como agricultor . Ellos tiene a su cargo cuatro hijos los estudian; los planes hacia un futuro de doña Ángela es mejor las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. Doña Ángela se dedica a la venta de leche desde hace tres años, ella ya tiene sus clientes que le entrega el producto y el mayor problema que se le ha presentado es la falta de financiamiento, ella solicita el apoyo de Afodenic para poder compra mas cantidad de leche, para poder obtener mas ganancia y sastifacer a sus cliente ya que la demanda amerita invertir mas.
texts.en:
34-year old Señora Angela García lives with her husband and children in a community in the city of Masaya. Her husband also works and they share the household expenses. They have kids in their care who are in school. Angela plans for the future are to improve the living conditions of her children. For 3 years Angela has been in the business of selling milk. She already has her clientele, but the biggest problem she has faced is lack of financing. She is asking for Afodenic's help so that she may buy greater quantities of milk, to be able to obtain more sales and meet the higher demand of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Francisca Antonia

texts.es: La señora Francisca Antonia M. tiene la edad de 63 años,  habita en el barrio jardines de apoyo, junto a su esposo, el cual le poya con los gastos del hogar, ya que el es comerciante y agricultor, ellos tiene  hijos pero no a su cargo. Los hijos le apoyan con algunos gastos del hogar ya que ellos son casados. Los planes de doña Francisca son ampliar más su negocio, ya que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras que con sus propios esfuerzos inicio. Ella solicita un financiamiento para poder incrementa su inventario y  a la vez mejorar su negocio. Alargo plazo es prestar para poder mejorar la infraestructura de su baño que esta en malas condiciones y desea poder mejorar con las ventas al tener productos variados y frescos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca Antonia M. is 63 years old, lives in the neighborhood Jardines de Apoyo, together with her husband, who helps with the household expenses because he is a merchant and a farmer. They have children but not under their care. Their children support them with various household expenses because they are already married. The plans of Mrs. Francisca are to increase her business, which is dedicated to the sale of fruits and vegetables that she started with her own efforts. She is requesting financing to be able to increase her inventory and improve her business. Long-term this loan will be able to improve the infrastructure of their bathroom which is in poor condition and she wants to improve her sales by having various products and drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rafaela Isabel

texts.es: La Sr. Rafaela tiene 51 años de edad, habitante de barrio Memorial Sandino, en la capital de Managua, madre soltera con dos precioso hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad, ambos los tiene estudiando. Sus planes en ámbito familiar es ofrecerle seguridad a su casa y darles comodidad a sus hijos. Doña Rafaela se desempeña como vendedora en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, cosmético y variedades. Trabaja medio tiempo como cocinera en una comediría, es un trabajo agotador pero es un ingreso más a la economía de la casa. Sus planes a futuro es tener su propia tienda con variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y ubicada en una zona en donde la comercialización este en abundantemente requerido a la necesidad del cliente este ramos de ventas. A corto plazo es construir su casa dándole seguridad as su familia. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloque para darle protección a su hogar, para terminar su casa, y tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Señora Rafaela is 51 years of age, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua, and is a single mother of two precious children of 13 and 15 years of age, both of whom are studying. Her plans in the family environment are to offer security to her home and to provide comfort for her children. Doña Rafaela works as a vendor in her small business selling clothing, cosmetics, and various other items. She works part-time as a cook in a food stand. It is exhausting work but is more income for the household. Her future plans are to have her own shop with a variety of products to offer to her clients and that is located in the commercial zone. Clients are in abundant need of these types of sales. In the short term her plan is to build her home providing security to her family. Thanks to the AFODENIC loans she has been able to buy construction materials like cement, iron, and blocks to give protection to her home, to finish her home, and to have a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Construction Materials to Finish Building her House

loans.name: Evarista Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Evarista del carmen R. Velásquez tiene la edad de 57 años habita en los altos de Masaya, junto a su esposo, el cual le poya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo una hija de 19 años la cual no estudia; pero le apoya con las cosas de la casa mientras doña Evarista atiende  la pulpería, los planes hacia un futuro en mejorar las condiciones de vida y mejorar su negocio. Doña Evarista desde hace tres años tiene la pulpería la cual inicio con sus propios esfuerzos. Sus objetivos hacia su negocio es incrementar su inventario y obtener mayor ganancia, ella solicita el apoyo de nuestra financiera para comprar abarrotes y cosméticos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Evarista del Carmen R. Velásquez is 57 years of age. She lives in the hills of Masaya with her husband who helps with the household expenses. They care for their 19 year-old daughter who does not study but helps with things in the home while Doña Evarista goes to her grocery store. Her plans for the future are to improve her quality of life and her business. Doña Evarista, for three years, has had a store that she started with her own efforts. Her business goals are to increase her inventory and to improve her earnings. She asks for the support of our financing to buy groceries and cosmetics for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products for her grocery store and cosmetics

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
El señor Jhonny M. vive en casa propia, en la zona  Obispo Bosque, ubicada en la ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa la señora margarita Choque y sus cuatro hijos.
El señor Jhonny trabaja como mesero en un restauran y su esposa es empleada en una empresa de transporte.
La vivienda que habita se encuentra deteriorada por ser de construcción antigua.
El crédito será para la refacción de los pisos de patio y pasillos, mas las barandas.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Jhonny M. lives in his own home in the Obispo Bosque zone located on the western side of the city of La Paz with his wife, Señora Margarita Choque, and their four children.

Señor Jhonny works as a waiter in a restaurant and his wife is an employee in a transportation company.

The home in which they live is in a state of deterioration because of its old construction.

The loan is for the restoration of the patio floors and hallways and especially the handrails.

This is the third time he has asked for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis shows that he is well-qualified to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restoration of the patio floors and hallways in his house

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Sr. Maria tiene 37 años de edad, habitante deL barrio memorial Sandino,  en la capital de Managua, casada con un  hijo de 11 años de edad, su esposo se desempeña como taxista ya que es un ingreso mas para su hogar. Doña María trabaja como vendedora de ropa, zapato y tiene una pequeña pulpería inicio con fondo propio con una experiencia de diez años. Sus planes para con su familia es brindarle un mejor calidad de vida y que hijo tengan la comodidad necesaria. En ámbito laboral es seguir brindando buena atención y servicio a sus clientes y adquirí su propio salón de belleza que le permita obtener un mayor beneficio y a corto plazo sus planes son construir su casa y otra modificaciones a su vivienda. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra realizar la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques y brindarles seguridad, protección y un patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora María is 37 years of age and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood, in the capital of Managua. She is married with an 11 year-old child. Her husband works as a taxi driver since it provides more income for their home. Doña María works as a seller of clothing and shoes and has a small grocery shop that she started with her own funds and with ten years of experience. Her plan for her family is to provide them with a better quality of life and for her son to have needed comfort. In the work environment, it is to continue providing good customer service and to acquire her own beauty salon that will allow her to earn more profits. In the short term, her plans are to build a house and make modifications to her home. Thanks to the AFODENIC loans, she will succeed in buying construction materials like: cement, iron, blocks, and to provide better security, protection, and assets for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Construction Materials to Finish Building her House

loans.name: Maria Micaela

texts.es:
La pulpería P. es el nombre del negocio cuya propietaria es la señora María P. dedicándose a este desde hace 6 años. Al ver la necesidad de ampliar su negocio ha iniciado a reconstruir su vivienda con el propósito de dar lugar a que se puedan introducir más estantes donde ofertar sus productos.

Para llevar a cabo esta reconstrucción en su vivienda ella ha utilizado el apoyo de Ceprodel para la compra de los materiales de construcción. Sin embargo a medida que la construcción avanza ella va requiriendo mayores cantidades de materiales de construcción y para esto una vez mas busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y de esta forma comprar la arena, piedrín, cemento, laminas de zinc y madera para las puertas. Todo esto con el propósito de mejorar y ampliar su pulpería ubicada en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega.
texts.en:
The “P. Pulpería” (small grocery store) is the name of the business whose owner is María P., who has had it for 6 years. Because she sees the need to expand her business, she has begun to re-construct her house, with the purpose of creating space for more shelves where she can offer her products. In order to re-construct her house, she has used the support of Ceprodel to buy the construction materials. However, as the building process advances, she needs larger amounts of construction materials and so she is once again seeking the support of Ceprodel for a loan so that she can buy the sand, pebbles, cement, and zinc panels and wood for the doors. This is for the purpose of improving and expanding her small grocery store, which is located in the municipality of Cinco Pinos in the department of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Sonia Mariana

texts.es:
La actividad a la que muy esforzadamente se dedica la señora Sonia E. es a la elaboración y venta de tortillas las cuales son elaboradas por ella misma habiendo adquirido experiencia desde muy pequeña y hoy las oferta en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega.

La señora Sonia E. es madre casada y con tres hijos que mantener por este motivo busca la forma de cómo salir adelante en el negocio y para esto ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de maíz y leña para elaborar sus tortillas. Una vez recibido este dinero ella logrará comprar la materia prima para continuar con la venta de estas deliciosas tortillas.
texts.en:
Sonia E.'s business activity, in which she puts forth a lot of effort, is the preparation and selling of tortillas. She has gained experience making them over the years, starting from when she was very small, and currently sells them in her house in the municipality of Cinco Pinos in the city of Chinandega. Sonia Espinozaa is married with three children to support, which is why she constantly is looking for ways to get ahead in the business and has come looking for support from Ceprodel to purchase corn and wood for the preparation of her tortillas. Once received, the loan will allow her to purchase the materials to continue selling her delicious tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and firewood to make tortillas to sell

loans.name: Gilberto David

texts.es:
La actividad económica a la que se dedica el señor Gilberto G. es a la venta de cloro, pinesol, criolina, ambientador ofreciéndolos ambulantemente en las calles del municipio de San Rafael en la ciudad de Managua de donde es originario.

Es importante destacar que este negocio se vuelve muy agotador por el hecho de que todos los días y sin descanso alguno, el señor Gilberto recorre las calles de su municipio y con la fatiga del sol dando lugar al desgaste físico pero con la esperanza de que algún día mejorará su nivel de vida. 
La razón por la cual ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para  solicitar un crédito para la compra de estos productos de limpieza y así ofertarlos en su municipio y de esta forma llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Gilberto G.'s business activity is the selling of chlorine, Pine Sol, criolina (a cleaning substance), air fresheners, offering them traveling through the streets of the San Rafael neighborhood in the city of Managua, his hometown. It's important to emphasize that this activity has become very exhausting due to the fact that everyday, without rest, Gilberto travels through the streets of his neighborhood, with the fatigue caused by the sun causing physical exhaustion, but with the hope that someday he will improve his quality of life. The reason he has come seeking the support of Ceprodel is to request a loan for the purchase of cleaning products to sell them in his neighborhood to bring income to his household.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchae of home cleaning products

loans.name: Irene Abigail

texts.es:
La actividad económica a la que se dedica la señora Irene Candia es a la costurería la cual atiende en su casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur y se ha destacado por elaborar excelentes trajes de vestir para niños, damas, caballeros de todo tipo y de diferentes tamaños.

Desde que comenzó con su negocio ha logrado mejorarlo y para esto lo ha hecho por medio de los créditos que solo Ceprodel brinda. Es importante destacar que gracias a este apoyo brindado ha logrado comprar su máquina, y materiales de trabajo. Hoy en día la razón por la cual solicita el crédito es para la compra de materiales de trabajo como tela, hilo y agujas para continuar en su actividad.
texts.en:
Irene Candia's business activity is sewing, which she performs in her house in the neighborhood of San Rafael del Sur, and has stood out by making excellent suits for children, women and men of all types and sizes. Since starting her business she has managed to improve it through loans that only Ceprodel provides. It's important to note that thanks to this support she has managed to purchase her sewing machine and work materials. Today the reason for her loan request is for the purchase of work materials, such as fabric, thread and needles to continue her work.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of work materials

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Refael del Sur de la ciudad de Managua la señora Juan María Ruíz se desempeña en su actividad económica de venta de prendas de oro la cual las ofrece en su casa de habitación y de igual forma viaja a diferentes lugares de la capital para lograr su venta.

Es menester informar que este es el único sustento para su casa de habitación y para su pequeño hijo que tanto necesita de su apoyo ya que al ser ella madre soltera debe de buscar la manera de suplir todas las necesidades de su hogar. Es por este motivo que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para comprar las prendas de oro y comercializarlas lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of San Rafael del Sur in the city of Managua Juana María Ruíz performs her business activity, which is selling gold jewelry in her house as well as traveling to various places in Managua. It should be noted that this is the only economic support for her household, including her small son that needs her support since, being a single mother, she has to find the means to provide all the necessities of the household. It is for this reason that she has come to Ceprodel for support to purchase gold jewelry to sell as soon as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of gold jewelry to sell

loans.name: Karen Valeria

texts.es:
La joven Karen G. habita en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur dedicándose a su actividad económica de venta de periódicos en su casa de habitación donde es visitada por diferentes personas para la compra de los periódicos emitidos diariamente en Nicaragua.

Es una joven soltera y con muchos deseos de superación ya que se ha destacado como buena estudiante en la universidad.  Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los periódicos para continuar con su actividad económica en su casa de habitación y de esta manera seguir supliendo todas las necesidades que se presentan en su humilde casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Karen G. lives in the San Rafael del Sur neighborhood. Her business activity is selling newspapers in her house where people come to purchase the daily papers of Nicaragua. She is an unmarried, young woman with much desire for self-improvement, since she has stood out as a good student in her university. She has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will allow her to purchase newspapers to continue with her business, through which she will be able to continue covering all of the necessities of her modest household.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of newspapers to sell

loans.name: Ninoska Esperanza

texts.es:
La tienda de la señora Ninoska S. fue inaugurada desde hace 10 años por ella misma vendiendo pocos productos y en ocasiones con grandes pérdidas debido a las bajas ventas percibidas. Hoy en día ha logrado suplir su negocio gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel pasando a tener de una pequeña tiendita a una mas ampliada y con más variedad el cual es atendida en su municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua.

El motivo por el cual ha buscado el refugio en Ceprodel es para la compra de la mercadería para continuar ofreciéndola en su tienda. Con el crédito se beneficia tanto ella como su  familia y de esta manera se cumplen sus sueños de mejorar en el negocio.
texts.en:
Ninoska S. started her store 10 years ago selling small products in the neighborhood of San Rafael del Sur in Managua, sometimes with large losses due to the low sales. Today she has managed to reestablish her business thanks to the support provided by Ceprodel, helping to make her small store larger with a greater variety of products. The reason she has come to Ceprodel is for the purchase of merchandise to continue offering it in her store. With the loan she will benefit, as well as her family, and be able to fulfill her dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Emilia Gutierrez es originaria del municipio de San Rafael del Sur y es una dama viuda que desde el momento en que quedo sola, ha buscado por diferentes medios la forma de como suplir las necesidades de su hogar.

A pesar de los infortunios de la vida siempre se ha mantenido con un espíritu de superación y esto la ha impulsado a seguir adelante siendo una pequeña comerciante que se esfuerza día a día para mejorar su condición. También es importante destacar que ella es dueña de un vehículo taxi y para esto también requiere de un préstamo para invertir en el taxi y también para seguir en su comercio.
Con el crédito otorgado se beneficia grandemente ya que logrará mejorar en parte su situación y continuar con el sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia Gutierrez is from the municipality of San Rafael del Sur and is a widow who, from the moment she lost her husband, has sought a variety of means of supplying the necessities for her home. In spite of the misfortunes of life, she has always kept up positive spirits and this has motivated her to keep going. She is a small trader who works hard every day to improve her situation. It is also important to note to that she is the owner of a taxi, and she also needs a loan to invest in the taxi as well as to continue with her trade. With the loan she has been granted she benefits greatly because she will be able to improve her situation, in part, and to continue to support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica tiene 32 años, es soltera, vive con su hija Edith de 10 años de edad. Ella es una abnegada madre que siempre ha velado por el bienestar de su pequeña trabajando en diversos oficios para poder brindarle educación, vestimenta, y todos lo necesario. Es así, que desde hace 8 años, ha incursionado en el negocio de la venta de ropa de bebe, yéndole muy bien en las ventas, ya que Angélica trae modelos variados y muy novedosos siendo muy demandados por los clientes. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es el tener que viajar constantemente para traer la mercadería de otras ciudades, lo cual le demanda tiempo y dinero extra. Angélica se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado viajará a traer mayor cantidad de mercadería para vender y poder obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Angélica is 32 years old, single, and lives with her daughter, Edith, who is 10 year old. She is a selfless mother who has done everything for the well-being of her daughter, working at a variety of jobs in order to provide her with education, clothing, and all of the necessities. For this reason, she decided 8 years ago to get into the business of selling baby clothing. Angélica’s sales are good because she has a good variety of interesting products that are in high demand by her customers. The hardest part of the job is having to travel constantly to bring the merchandise from other cities, which requires time and extra money. Angélica is taking out her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the requested money, she will travel and bring home a larger quantity of merchandise to sell and thereby improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia tiene 32 años, es madre soltera de 5 hijos; Rosmery de 14 años, Milton de 12, Elizabeth de10, Talia de 8 y Yesica de 6. Se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 12 años, ya que al velar por una familia numerosa requería trabajar en un oficio que le permita cuidar a sus hijos y al mismo tiempo obtener ingresos para su sostenimiento, siendo ella la única fuente de manutención de sus 5 hijos. Felizmente el trabajo de Claudia obtiene buenos resultados, ya que las ganancias son buenas y alcanzan para cubrir las necesidades de todos ellos, teniendo además una ayuda extra, ya que sus hijos al ver la esforzada labor de su madre la apoyan incondicionalmente. Claudia se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para vender en época navideña.
texts.en:
Claudia, 32, is a single mother of 5 children: Rosmery,14; Milton,12; Elizabeth, 10; Talia, 8; and Yesica, 6. Claudia started selling clothes 12 years ago, to support her children and at the same time be able to care for them. Happily, Claudia's business is doing well, and she is able to cover the needs of her 5 children, who see their mother's tireless efforts and help her in the business. This is Claudia's first loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes to offer during the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restocking for holiday sales

loans.name: Elicia

texts.es: Elicia tiene 28 años, es madre soltera de dos niñas, Yesenia de 7 años y Rosalinda de 3 años. La venta de ropa es el negocio al cual se dedica Elicia para poder mantener a su familia sola. El arduo trabajo que realiza desde hace 8 años va arrojando sus primeros frutos, los cuales son muy representativos para Elicia, ya que la motivan a seguir trabajando a favor de sus hijos, sabiendo que poco a poco va forjándoles un mejor futuro. Elicia no le encuentra dificultad en realizar su trabajo, es más le agrada mucho hacerlo, en compañía de sus dos pequeñas. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará gran cantidad de ropa para aumentar sus ingresos y pasar una bonita navidad al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Elicia, 28, is a single mother of two girls: Yesenia, 7; and Rosalinda, 3. Elicia's business is the sale of clothing. Being the sole supporter of her young family, Elicia's has worked very hard for the last 8 years to see her business grow. Good sales motivate her to continue working, knowing that little by little she is providing for her daughters' future. Elicia has no trouble running her business, in fact, she really enjoys sales, specially because her daughters can go with her. This is her first loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. The loan will be used to purchase more clothing to increase her sales during the holiday season. With your help, she will have a nice Christmas with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restocking for holiday sales

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es: Ninfa tiene 37 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos, Viller de 15 años y Fany de 9. Se dedica a la venta de tunas desde hace 10 años, optó por incursionar en este negocio por la gran demanda que tiene peculiar fruta, ya que resulta muy agradable al paladar. A Ninfa le gusta su trabajo, ya que es muy tranquilo y puede disponer de su tiempo de acuerdo a lo vendido, por ejemplo si acaba con la venta de tunas puede retirarse a su hogar más temprano. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que lidiar con las espinas que se le introducen en las manos cuando pela estas ricas frutas. Ninfa se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más cantidad de tunas para aumentar las ventas y por ende sus ingresos para esta navidad.
texts.en:
Ninfa, 37, is a single mother of two children: Viller, 15, and Fany,9. She began selling prickly pears 10 years ago. She opted for this business knowing that prickly pears are in great demand for their great flavor. What Ninfa likes about her job is that it is peaceful and if she finishes her sales early, she can go home early to care for her children. The hardest part of Ninfa's job is to avoid the thorns on the prickly pears, which hurt her hands when she peels the fruit. This is Ninfa's first loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. The loan will be used to purchase a larger number of prickly pears to increase her income in this holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing larger number of prickly pears

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es: Pastora tiene 37 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos; Nelvar de 14, Rosmery de 4 y Ángel de 2. Se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Juliaca. Ella empieza su trabajo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 o 6 de la tarde que es cuando existe venta. Sus ventas son muy buenas, especialmente en el mes de diciembre y enero por la costumbre de comprar ropa nueva para recibir el año nuevo, así que Pastora quiere aprovechar esto para aumentar sus ventas. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de prendas para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Pastora is 37 years old and is the single mother of 3 children; Nelvar 14, Rosmery 4 and Ángel who is 2. She works as a traveling clothes seller in the city of Juliaca. She starts her work from 8 in the morning until 5 or 6 in the afternoon which is when there are sales. Her sales are very good, especially in the months of December and January due to the custom of buying new clothes to receive the New Year, so Pastora wants to take advantage of this to increase her sales. She is in her first loan with Prisma Microfinance. With the money she has requested she will buy more articles of clothing to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of articles of clothing to sell

loans.name: Profeta

texts.es: Profeta tiene 40 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus tres hijos; Pedro de 14, Ludwin de 11 y Jaquelin de 5. Ella es una trabajadora madre que se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de poleras de forma ambulatoria, en el mercado San José de la ciudad de Juliaca. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la estabilidad que le da para mantener a sus hijos y poder brindarles educación, vestido, etc. Las ventas van en ascenso y con mucha más frecuencia en este mes que todos hacen sus compras navideñas, siendo lo más dificultoso tener que lidiar con el calor por las mañanas y el frió que hace por las tardes en este mercado. Profeta se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de poleras para su venta por campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Profeta is 40 years old, is a single mother and lives with her three children: Pedro 14, Ludwin 11 and Jaquelin who is 5. She is a hard working mother who has worked for the past 10 years as a traveling sweatshirt saleswoman in the San José market of the city of Juliaca. What she likes about her job is the stability that it gives her to support her children and be able to give them education, dress, etc. The sales are increasing and with much greater frequency this month that everyone makes their Christmas purchases. The most difficult thing that she faces is the heat in the mornings and the cold in the afternoons in this market. Profeta is in her first loan with Prisma Microfinance. With the money she is requesting she will buy more sweatshirts to sell for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise that she sells

loans.name: Remigio

texts.es: Remigio tiene 25 años, es soltero y vive solo. Es un joven muy trabajador que se dedica desde hace 4 años a ser estibador, el frecuenta los mercados, ferreterías, tienda de comestibles al por mayor para ofrecer su servicio como cargador. Remigio gana bien con su trabajo, ya que frecuenta muchos lugares, y aún es joven y tiene las fuerzas necesarias para realizar este trabajo tan duro, pero aún así, termina muy cansado al final del día, no teniendo tiempo para nada más. El quiere seguir esforzándose para que en el futuro pueda cosechar las recompensas que le arroje tanto esfuerzo y cumplir todas sus metas. El se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará un triciclo para hacer transporte de pasajeros, y así poder dedicarse netamente a ello y dejar el trabajo de estibador, que le resulta muy agotador por el esfuerzo físico que requiere.
texts.en:
Remigio is 25 years old, is single and lives alone. He is a very hard working young man who for the last 4 years has worked as a porter. She frequents the markets, hardware stores, and wholesale food stores to offer his service as a porter. Remigio earns well with his job, as he frequents many places and as he is still young he has the strength necessary to carry out such difficult work, but still he finishes very tired at the end of the day and does not have time for anything else. He wants to continue working hard so that in the future he can enjoy the rewards that such effort brings and achieve all of his goals. This is his first loan with Prisma Microfinance. With the loan requested he will buy a tricycle to do passenger transport, and dedicate himself to this and stop working as a porter, which is very exhausting because of the physical efforts that it requires.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a tricycle to do passenger transport

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene tiene 21 años, es soltero y vive con su madre. Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en triciclo por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca desde hace dos años, ayudando a su madre en los gastos de su hogar. La jornada diaria de Rene comienza a las 8 de la mañana transitando las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca en busca de pasajeros, y termina alrededor de las 6 o 7 de la noche que es cuando no hay mucha clientela. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que realizar mucho esfuerzo físico, ya que pedalear su triciclo requiere de ello. Rene se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado refaccionará su triciclo, comprando llantas nuevas y refaccionando algunas partes para brindar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Rene is 21 years old, is single and lives with his mother. For the past 2 years he has worked providing tricycle passenger transport service through the streets of the city of Juliaca, helping his mother with the household expenses. Rene's daily workday begins at 8 in the morning traveling through the streets of the city of Juliaca in search of passengers and ends around 6 or 7 in the evening which is when there is not much clientele. The most difficult thing about his work is having to carry out a lot of physical effort as pedaling his tricycle requires this. Rene is in his first loan with Prisma Microfinance. With the money he is requesting he will refurbish his tricycle, buying new tires and repairing some parts to provide better service for his passengers.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires for his tricycle

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana tiene 22 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a brindar servicio de llamadas por celular de forma ambulante, desde hace 4 años, en los cuales ha sabido aprender de su negocio, los clientes son numerosos, ya que Yovana cuenta con un gran carisma que hace que tenga sus “caseritos”, clientes muy fieles a su negocio. El negocio anda muy bien, por ello Yovana quiere expandirlo comprando otro equipo para hacerlo trabajar. Las dificultades radican en tener que permanecer caminando y no tener estabilidad en realizar su trabajo, lo cual se le hace cansado, pero Yovana sabe que son pequeñas cosas que tiene que aprender a superar si quiere progresar. Ella se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, comprometida a ser responsable y puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Yovana is 22 years old, is single and lives in her parents' house. She has worked as a traveling cellular telephone call provider for the past 4 years, in which she was come to know her business. Her clients are numerous as Yovana has great carisma that makes her have her “caseritos”, clients who are very loyal to her business. The business is going very well which is why Yovana wants to expand it buying another telephone to put it to work. The difficulties are having to keep walking and not have stability in carrying out her job, which makes her tired, but Yovana knows that these are little things that she has to learn if she wants to progress. She is in her first loan with Prisma Microfinance and is commited to being responsible and punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of another cellular telephone

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina D. believes that “discipline is the backbone of progress.” She adds that a man who is undisciplined is a man without ambitions. Marcelina aims to have a better life someday and so prays and works hard to achieve her goals.

Marcelina, 36 and married to Joel D., a farmer, have three children: Jomar – 14 years old, in junior high school; Jonalyn – 13 years old, a high school sophomore, and Joel - 2 years old. She considers herself fortunate to have intelligent children who can help their family.

To assist her husband in their farming business, Marcelina raises hogs. At present, she is raising two hogs and hopes to generate a 50% net return on her investment in order to increase the number she can raise in the coming months. At the moment, to improve her business Marcelina is requesting a loan to support her hogs’ feed supply and provide financial assistance to their modest rice farm.

She dreams that in the near future, she will be able to send all of her children to post-secondary school.

loans.use: To purchase hogs' feed and farm inputs (fertilizers, seeds, etc.).

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza L., the 37-year-old mother of Nolie, aged four, and Noliza, aged two, is married to Nolie L., a farmer. They live in the village of Binarzang Quirino, Isabela where living conditions are average and peaceful, and the people dream not only of progress in their lives but also in the community.

Flordeliza manages a simple village store which offers most of the prime commodities needed by her fellow villagers. She would now like to expand into vegetable and meat vending, her reason for requesting this loan. She is working diligently to develop this additional source of income in order to supply the daily needs of her family and save for the education of her children. To further achieve their dreams, Flordeliza and her husband will double their time and efforts in their respective businesses.

loans.use: To add vegetables and meat to her store's inventory.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Because her husband is working in Mindanao, another region in the Philippines, Teresita and her six year old daughter live apart from him. She has operated a community-based variety store for the past three years, and it is open from 6:00 in the morning until 8:00 in the evening. Teresita is now requesting a loan to buy stocks such as soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, sugar and other basic commodities for her store. She expects that this will increase her daily income and ultimately give her and her husband the chance to have a better life and support their child's education.

One of Teresita’s dreams is to have a grocery store, which is so much bigger than a community-based village store, so that she can sell a variety of commodities in her community. She also prays that her husband will find work in the area so that they can support their only daughter together.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria S., a vendor married to Orlando, a farmer, has six children ranging in age from 33 to 20, all engaged in farming activities. Unfortunately, due to financial constraints, only one of the children reached high school.

Maria wants to have a better life as she patiently operates her humble store which only generates a modest weekly income of about $20. In order to increase her business income she is requesting a loan to add to the range of stock carried in the store. Maria hopes to eventually develop her enterprise into a progressive operation.

“I had set my mind to work harder with the help of my husband to attain our goals in life for the future of our family. I never succeeded in giving my children a better education, but somehow they understand that I really tried but life has been difficult; in my heart I know that as long as can, I am here to fill what has been taken away from them because of poverty,” she concluded.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her store.

location.town: Old San Mariano, San Mariano Isabela

loans.name: Femarie

texts.en:
Femarie L. is a 29-year-old store owner married to Freddie, who is involved in farming activities. They are blessed with two children, Sigrid Faye – six years old, already in Grade One and Geradee – three years old. They live in Brgy San Mateo, Quirino, Isabela, which she describes as an agricultural area with rice and corn as its main products.

Femarie is generating an average weekly income of about $30, used in maintaining her store's daily operation and sustaining her other source of income - raising pigs. She wants to expand into selling vegetables and meats which will be displayed in front of her store and is therefore requesting a loan for this purpose.

Femarie hopes to improve the business so as to enable her children to gain the highest level of education they need.

loans.use: To buy meats and vegetables to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred, a 35 year old storeowner, is married to Serafin, a tricycle driver and manager of their welding shop as well as village treasurer. Their marriage is gifted with three children: Shermae Michelle – a 16-year-old first year nursing student; Sermil Micheal – a 13-year-old junior high school student, and Shella Mae – a 10-year-old Grade 4 elementary student. The family lives in Barangay Magsaysay Naguillan, Isabela.

Mildred’s store has been a big help in their family, as each week she can earn a gross income of at least $320, budgeting that income to support the studies of her eldest, since the nursing course is very expensive, and for the educational needs of her other two children. Some of the earnings are also used to maintain their corn and rice farming business.

To further sustain her store and farming business, Mildred is requesting a loan as additional capital with which she will buy more stocks to offer in her store. The said amount will make her store profitable and hopefully enable her to convert it into a grocery store. In this way, she can provide for the immediate needs of the people in the community and make it more convenient for them because they will not have to go to the market just to acquire their basic requirements.

Through the income from her business, Mildred is able to provide the medication for her eldest child who is suffering from lupus, a chronic auto-immune disease that can be fatal. She prays that they can prevail in their struggle and that her child will be cured. She loves her family and becomes teary- eyed whenever she remembers her child's sickness. According to Mildred, her child is strongly fighting her sickness and this gives her the strength to overcome it.

loans.use: To buy more stocks for her store.

loans.name: Ma. Daisy

texts.en:
“Time is gold but the only difference is in us. While there is still time, use it to the fullest” This is the inspirational thought conveyed by Ma Daisy as she told her story. At the age of 40 Ma Daisy has three children: Airish – 17 years old, college freshmen, Kim Lawrence – 14 years old, junior high school student, and Aimee Dae – 11 years old graduating in elementary. They reside in Brgy San Mateo, Quirino, Isabela near the municipal hall. Farming is the major source of income for most of the residents.

Ma Daisy is a food/snack vendor in her village, selling pork barbecue, cleaned chicken intestines, hotdogs and other kinds of street foods that are in demand. She prepares her roasting materials and ingredients every afternoon just in front of her house and her regular customers will come by for their snacks in the afternoon. She hopes to improve the business and add a greater variety of snacks to sell so that she will able to increase her income and better provide for the needs of her children in school. She is therefore requesting a loan for business capital. Ma Daisy is doing all these things to feed her children and accrue savings for their education in the coming years.

loans.use: To add a variety of snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
“I don’t want to merely depend on my children because they have their own families already,” Esmeralda said.

Esmeralsda, a rice retailer, lives in a village considered to be a model. Barangay in Tumauini, Isabela, is known for its clean and green project whereby all families are obliged to have their own backyard gardens, thereby promoting personal food security and productivity.

Esmeralda is married to Nelidoro, a house carpenter, and they are blessed with four children: Gema, 31, a college graduate; Chamie, 35, a college graduate; Rolly 40, an elementary graduate, and her eldest son Leslie, 41, also a college graduate.

Esmeralda is now requesting a loan to buy more sacks of rice for her business, as the commodity sells very quickly given the fact that most of the farms in the area grow only corn and tobacco. She hopes to expand her business in the future, dreaming of the day she will have her own stall beside their house from which she will sell large volumes of rice.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Edarlina

texts.en:
“Competition is a spice in business. And in life, always bear in mind that you can’t be good and determined in your chosen field if you have no one to compete with.” This is the life philosophy of Edarlina G. from Old San Mariano, Isabela, a village situated in the lowland near the Pinacanauan River and frequently covered with water when successive rains occur. 

Edarlina, 49, is married to Vicente G. Jr. and they are blessed with three children: Filimon – 30 years old, married and working as a teacher; Eugine – 29 years old, a college graduate engaged in farming, and Rachelle – 19 years old, a senior nursing student.  

Edarlina operates a village store generating an average weekly income of over $20 which is used to support her family and the needed school allowance of her youngest child. Her needs for additional capital for the store and the maintenance of their farming business are the reasons she is now applying for a loan. 

Her faith in God and determination to succeed has motivated her to persevere and to develop the family’s other business - raising hogs.  The combined incomes of the two enterprises will give them the chance to have a better life and support their child's education.

loans.use: Additional store capital and maintenance of their farming business

location.town: Old San Mariano, San Mariano Isabela

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
“The major reason I work hard is I want our business to prosper in order to save for the education of my three children, especially when they study in college,” Betty, who has a small store in their village, said. “I have been managing our store since 2008. I have to earn an additional income to help my husband who only has a limited income. He just relies on the harvest of our cornfield and other irregular jobs in our village,” she added.

Betty T. lives at Cabisera 18 Ilagan, Isabela, where she is married to Larry, a farmer who cultivates his own corn field. They have three children: Zyrene, five, a day care student; Jowell, 11, a grade six student, and her eldest son Joemer, 12, in his first year of high school. Theirs is a small agricultural-based community whose residents mainly plant rice, corn and vegetables for their living.

Betty is now requesting a loan in order to acquire different products to be sold to her co-villagers, including soft drinks, biscuits, noodles, salt, sugar, coffee, eggs, and other items which are in high demand.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products to sell in her store

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet shoulders the responsibility as both mother and father of her family as she is married to Apolinario, who is an overseas contract worker. She lives in Brgy. Magassi, Cabagan, Isabela, a peaceful place where villagers’ primary work is in farm land. They have three children: Mark Anthony, 13, a second-year high school student; Apolinario Jr., 11, a grade six elementary student, and the youngest and only daughter, Lovely Rose, 8, a grade three student.

As a beautician, Janet’s daily routine is to go throughout the village looking for customers who might want manicure/pedicure service. Janet is now requesting a loan to replace her manicure tools including her nail cutter, nipper, cuticle remover, nail brush, towel and nail polish. Part of the loan will also be used to buy new sets of school uniforms for her children.

Janet does this type of work in order to earn income for her children’s needs because her husband cannot always remit money, and she dreams of ultimately enabling her children to get college educations.

loans.use: To buy replacement tools for her manicure business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario has lived in Barangay Magsaysay, Naguillan, Isabela since she was born. The place is relatively peaceful and a progressive village. Agriculture is the major source of income for most of the residents here. Most of the women are engaged in other businesses as alternative sources of income.

Rosario is married to Nolie and blessed with four children: Christian, 18 years old, 2nd year college; Chester, 16 years old, 4th year high school; Nolie Jr., 13 years old, 2nd year high school; and Nolie Rose, 11 years old, a fifth grader in elementary school. Her husband works in an electronic shop in Manila, but his salary is insufficient to provide all their needs.

In order to help her husband, Rosario started to raise chickens in their backyard. After 40 days, they sell the chickens to their neighbors and regular customers. Rosario has had her poultry business for two years, and she plans to expand it by purchasing 20 chicks. This will bring in more income and savings for her family. To fulfill her plan, she requests a loan of $200 (9, 000.00 PHP) which she plans to use to buy more chicks, and feed and medicine for her chickens.

Rosario acts as the mother and father of their four children because her husband works in Manila and only goes home once every four months to minimize travel expenses. Her fellow villagers know her as a dedicated businesswoman and a responsible mother. She will sacrifice a lot for the welfare of her children and for them to have good education.

loans.use: Buy more chickd, feed and medicine for the chickens

loans.name: Livestock Group

texts.vi:
Đào Thị Thưởng sinh năm 1961 (Mã số 010105060003 ). chị đang sống cùng chồng và gia đình người  con trai lớn. Chồng chị hang ngày đi làm thợ xây, bản thân chị có lương hưu và người có uy tín và được mọi người yêu mến. Chị tham gia mức vay 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng: 3.500.000 vnđ/ tháng.
 Trong nhóm chị còn có:
  Nguyễn Thị Thu May sinh năm 1981 (010105060010) Chị tham gia mức vay 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Bản than đi làm thuê có thu nhập, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/ tháng.
  Nguyễn Thị Chuyên sinh năm 1957 (Mã số 010105060012) Chị tham gia mức vay 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 2.000.000 vnđ/tháng.
  Đặng Thị Dung sinh năm 1957 (Mã số 010105060004) Chị tham gia mức vay 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ/tháng.
 Đặng Thị Tắc sinh năm 1963 (Mã số 010105060008) Chị tham gia mức vay 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lơn và chồng hoa. Thu nhâp bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vnđ/tháng.
